Job Title: Control Tower Data Analyst
Job Location: Torrance, CA
DHL Global Forwarding (DGF) is the world leader in air freight services and one of the leading providers of ocean freight services. Around 30,000 employees work to ensure the transport of all kinds of shipments by air or sea. DGF's logistics solutions span the entire supply chain, from the factory to the shop floor. They also include special transport-related services.
We have an exciting opportunity for a Control Tower Data Analyst to perform data analysis, reporting, for a large strategic within the Operational Excellence Center (OEC) Control Tower team. The Data Analyst monitors a variety of key performance indicators. In addition, the analyst will performs and coordinates assigned duties to help providing solutions that will meet or exceed the requirements of internal/external customers. This position will be based at the customer location in Torrance, CA.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure high quality of data and information, including close collaboration with visibility solutions and providers to achieve uninterrupted data inflows and outflows
Clearly communicate issues to the OEC team and to customers
Liaison between the OEC team and customer in troubleshooting, root cause analysis, correction of process breakages, and resolution of data integrity issues
Drive, adopt and enforce best practices in reporting tools, thereby instilling standard reporting suites for use by the OEC team in weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual reviews
Manage data needs of the OEC team and customer including data collection, analysis, high-quality reporting, and strategic data-based continuous improvement recommendations
Respond to time-critical ad hoc requests and participate in report design, administration, maintenance, fine-tuning, and data reconciliation
Prepare accurate and meaningful qualitative and quantitative reports, analyses and briefs for various internal and external stakeholders
Work with large amounts of data for processing and distribution to other systems and / or departments, including to / from various internal and external sources
Understand data relationships, make observations, draw conclusions and effectively communicate same
Provide solutions / analytical support for implementation of strategic projects as assigned to the OEC team.
SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS
Working knowledge of DHL’s business applications, standard Microsoft software (particularly Excel), and business processes including third party and in-house developed applications
Excellent analytical skills, with attention to detail and a focus on accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of deliverables
Ability to independently prepare, interpret, and present information from various types of sources
Ability to anticipate desired views to form meaningful conclusions or flag impending potential issues based on data
Ability to identify and resolve problematic areas and trends in data
Ability to develop graphs, reports, and presentations
Ability to work as effectively independently as with a team
Ability to strictly adhere to deadlines and to work with minimal supervision and direction
Minimum 2-3 years of logistics/supply chain experience preferred
Minimum 2-3 years of experience in data management
Excellent interpersonal and verbal / written communications skills, including strong follow through capabilities
Why join DHL Global Forwarding?
We are part of Deutsche Post DHL, the world’s leading logistics provider with operations in over 220 countries. Visit our career site on the web at https://www.logistics.dhl/us-en/home/careers.html
Our TOP EMPLOYER prestigious certification attests to our best-in-class efforts to attract and retain talent by fostering a positive work environment and encouraging personal and professional development among employees. At DGF, we don’t build businesses. We believe in building people so they can build the business and this means every success that we have comes from our employees. Together, our employees continue shaping our environment as a great place to work and community that we are all proud of.
As the world’s leading logistics’ company, DHL offers a wide range of interesting job challenges and opportunities in our different divisions around the globe. Our performance management system supports us in recognizing your potential, evaluating your performance, and continuously planning the development of your career with DHL. We will always enable you to take on responsibility and encourage your growth, personally and professionally.
We are proud of our history and what we have created, a global market leader with 30,000 passionate employees. Our aspiration is to become the undisputed leader in our industry, when people think of forwarding; we want them to think DGF, because we have:
The largest global network with more than ~30,000 passionate employees
The most efficient processes and fastest response times
The best solutions and best customer service
Our Vision: The Logistics Company for the World
Our Mission: Excellence. Simply Delivered.
Our Purpose: We connect people, improving their lives.
Our Values: Respect & Results
Our Goals: Employer, Provider, and Investment of Choice, Living Responsibility
About DHL Global Forwarding (DGF):
DHL Global Forwarding (DGF) is the world leader in air freight services and one of the leading providers of ocean freight services. Around 30,000 employees work to ensure the transport of all kinds of shipments by air or sea. DGF's logistics solutions span the entire supply chain, from the factory to the shop floor. They also include special transport-related services.
Our business model is very asset-light, as it is based on the brokerage of transport services between customers and freight carriers. We consolidate shipments to achieve higher volumes, purchase cargo space at better conditions and optimize network utilization. Our global presence means we can offer a variety of routing options and meet our customers' increasing demand for multimodal shipments.
We are part of Deutsche Post DHL, the world’s leading logistics provider with operations in over 220 countries. Visit our career site on the web at https://www.logistics.dhl/us-en/home/careers.html
DHL Global Forwarding is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
Work Authorization:
DHL Global Forwarding will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which visa sponsorship will be provided. Individuals who need sponsorship for work authorization, now or in the future, are not eligible for hire for this role.

Shopkick, the leading multi-chain shopper rewards app, is looking for a Data Analyst who will provide insights to our most important clients and Senior Management; develop understanding about how users engage with our App; and bring an analytical perspective to teams across the company.
We are actively seeking candidates who combine both the baseline technical skills required (see below) with strong “soft” abilities, including communication, influence, presentation, and prioritization. This role will provide the right candidate with an unusually broad level of influence at Shopkick and exceptionally strong opportunities for growth.
While we don’t use a formal “office” for any day-to-day work, we do benefit from being in the same room from time-to-time (post-Covid). For that reason, we can only consider applicants already in or moving to Southern California at this time.
The Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Developing dashboards and reporting to support revenue teams as needed
Attending “live” meetings / VCs with sales teams, clients, and Marketing to represent Shopkick from an Analytics perspective
Using SQL, Python, Excel, and/or other BI tools to answer ad-hoc questions about client campaign performance.
Creating custom analysis of the Shopkick user base to understand how different categories and different types of Shopkick marketing vehicles influence consumers
Constructing and overseeing A/B/* experiments as part of Shopkick’s “test-and-learn” culture
Creating benchmarks and other aggregate insights that would be of interest to key clients, the press, and other external partners
Creating, measuring, and documenting KPIs that will drive focus across the business
Automating, maintaining, and improving all levels of client-facing reporting
Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a preferably-quantitative field (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Analysis, etc.). All programs of study considered for strong candidates who can show analytical ability. Career switchers are welcome to apply, but please be prepared to demonstrate the skills required.
HARD REQUIREMENT: Ability to extract data from databases by writing SQL, from scratch, including table joins, subqueries, and very basic window functions (rank, row_number, etc.). You’ll be given “Notepad / TextEdit” and need to write some basic code to demonstrate this ability. If you can’t do this, study up and please reapply later.
Understanding of data visualization best-practices and experience in at least one tool through which that understanding can be expressed (Excel, Tableau, Python / matplotlib or other visualization libraries, etc.)
Experience with one or more data visualization / dashboarding tools, esp. Sisense / Tableau / PowerBI / etc. is helpful.
Ability to construct intermediate level Python code to assist with data cleaning, transformation, analysis, or visualization. Use of python packages that allow creation of Office files (Excel, Powerpoint).
Ability to translate analytical results to a data-supported story; excellent written and oral communication skills
Self-learner, self-starter, high degree of intellectual curiousity; ability to thrive in fast-paced startup-y situation where problems are not always well-defined
Interest in digital advertising; understanding of advertising principles
2+ Years of experience in a role where you can explain why your experience is relevant to the Data Analyst role at Shopkick
A Plus If You:

Have experience with Google BigQuery or other columnar data store (Vertica, etc.) or “big data” technologies
Have experience with JIRA/Confluence
Have created, run, and analyzed studies of marketing incrementality/lift
Have a Master’s Degree in a related field
Have experience with common 3rd party event-based analytics packages, such as Google Analytics, Amplitude, or Mixpanel
Have experience with advertising campaign analysis
Have experience with app user analytics
Have comfort with statistical analysis (i.e. can prove that differences in outcomes are statistically significant at a target level)
Can explain how “programmatic” advertising or Marketing Mix Modeling works; can discuss how to use first party data to make marketing more effective

Have Stephen Few, Cole Nussbaumer Knaflic, or Edward Tufte on your bookshelf
Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Shopkick are considered property of Shopkick and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Job Posting Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Department: BI/ Data Insights Group
Location: Burbank, CA

About Us:
ViacomCBS Streaming (formerly CBS Interactive) is a division of ViacomCBS that encompasses both free, paid, and premium streaming services including Pluto TV, Paramount+, CBS Sports Digital, and CBS News Digital.

Role Details:
Data plays a central role at ViacomCBS Streaming, and as part of the Data & Insights Group (DIG), Business Intelligence Analysts are key to delivering actionable insights for our leadership teams to act upon. The BI Analyst is responsible for developing and generating reports, insights, & analysis across multiple systems. You will be expected to identify business, marketing, and product opportunities, challenges, and trends and be able to communicate your findings effectively to a variety of stakeholders. This role will be primarily focused on data analysis work related to Paramount+ and other streaming initiatives.

Your Day-to-Day:
Build and manage reports showing the health of key performance metrics
Write SQL to query a data warehouse (BigQuery) for data in order to answer questions from a variety of stakeholders
Present insights and analysis to different teams and stakeholders
Develop and maintain statistical and spreadsheet models for forecasting, scenario planning, and other predictive work
Work closely with product, finance, and marketing teams to represent and capture business goals and initiatives
Develop automated dashboards and reports that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Make recommendations to the product, finance, and marketing teams on tactical adjustments to improve performance
Support A|B testing tasks with exploratory analysis, sample size calculations, and test analysis

Key Projects:
Building dashboards (using Tableau and other BI tools) that illustrate how key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics are changing over time
Refining reports, dashboards, and insights based on the needs of a rapidly changing business
Live Sports and Premiere Event reporting focused on content performance and audience acquisition
Supporting monthly and quarterly reporting initiatives
Developing our standard reporting for product KPIs and questions
Owning the forecasting model for the portfolio of properties
Perform Ad Hoc analysis on specific business problems and summarize findings in an accurate, concise, easy-to-understand manner

Qualifications:
You Have:
BA/BS or equivalent training and experience in Business Analytics
2-3+ years of experience in digital media with data analysis as a key component of the work
Can provide accurate information in a usable form and on a timely basis.
Can communicate clearly and succinctly, adjust to a variety of styles and audiences and tell compelling stories with data
Proficiency in web analytics, video analytics (Adobe Analytics and/or other robust data solutions)
Experience with SQL and/or other query languages
Experience with Python or other scripting languages
Adept with presentation tools and services (Google Docs, Tableau, Google Data Studio, Keynote, PowerPoint, etc.)
Must successfully pass a background check

You might also have:
Strong mathematics, statistics background
Experience using project management tools like those from Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience using Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
A background in SVOD/AVOD/TVE or other subscription-based digital services

Job Description Summary:

Job Title: Data Analyst
Location: Sherman Oaks, CA
Per Executive Order 14042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment.
About this Role:
Comscore Movies is looking for a Junior Data Analyst and content specialist who can help maintain our studio reported box office data and produce custom deliverables for press requests and Comscore client partners. If you have a passion for movies, experience with movie data and the entertainment sector, this is a great opportunity to interact with movie studios and our international Comscore offices around the world and advance your career.
This position’s primary responsibilities are to understand all aspects of Studio Reported Box Office data for International Box Office Essentials (IBOE); Customer Service (at all studio levels, including Executives); and to work with closely with internal content team and Comscore press relations.
What You’ll Do:
Understand how to analyze international box office trends, and industry behavior

At Comscore, we’re pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients & partners. If you’re motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we’d love to hear from you.
Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry’s emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.

Job Summary
The Clinical Data Analyst II supports quality and process improvement activities by producing healthcare outcome measurements that are used for internal and external reporting, the tasks including data warehouse building, data quality assurance, process programming, specification documentation and report developing.

The Clinical Data Analyst II applies technical skills to design, develop, and generate ad hoc or production reports that may evolve into complex data analysis/data integration projects that this individual may be responsible for maintaining. The complex data analysis/integration projects are those which may require periodic maintenance on a weekly, monthly, quarterly, biannual, or annual basis. The position works with Information Systems analysts when ongoing reports can be accurately transferred for production. The individual interprets and documents both written and verbal specifications. The individual takes basic instructions or specifications and interviews the client for complete details sufficient for writing data queries based for ad hoc and ongoing health care measures. This position must comprehend the relationships between the field elements in encounters and claims, membership, and provider databases. The individual is a key resource to the HOA department on application use. The position supports the functions related to quality improvement activities inclusive of quarterly reports that demonstrate health care outcomes in comparison to targets or national averages/percentiles published by recognized organizations such as National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) and Certified Health Coach (CHC). Analytic skills include the ability to identify data aberrations and recognize data patterns that impact quality.

Duties

Develop automatic, robust and sharable SAS procedures and programs towards building a comprehensive clinical data repository. Design, develop, and generate ad hoc/production reports.

Creates work tools that facilitate tasks by reducing paperwork and errors. Document assumptions, specification in a clear and sharable fashion.

Produce accurate analysis as allowed by resources. Identifies and creates work-around to create valid results that meet the intent of the client's specifications. Produces periodic results as scheduled.

Share findings and trends with clinical and operations staff, provider network and other stakeholders. Be able to present findings of data analyses at internal and external meetings, professional conferences and stakeholder meetings. These reports can be in the form of PowerPoint presentation, discussions during meetings or in as a formal written report.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Education Required
Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems or Related Field
In lieu of degree, equivalent education and/or experience may be considered.
Education Preferred
Master's Degree in Information Systems or Related Field
Experience

Required:
At least 3-5 years of experience in designing, developing, and generating ad hoc/production reports.

Working knowledge of MS Access, Excel, and Word software.

Skills

Required:
Medium to Advanced SAS programming skills.

Demonstrated ability to use relational databases for the purpose of generating ad hoc reports.

The ability to work well in a team setting with individuals having professional backgrounds in the technical and/or clinical fields.

Must demonstrate the ability to work independently and seek solutions proactively.

Able to apply critical thinking in evaluating priorities/solutions.

Preferred:
Demonstrated ability to take responsibility for making sure requested projects meet the client's needs with respect to data accuracy, format, and timeliness.

Licenses/Certifications Required
Licenses/Certifications Preferred
Statistical Analysis System (SAS) Certification
Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA)

Overview
The NFL Digital Media Intelligence team helps business leaders make thoughtful, evidence-based decisions to support NFL Media's long-term value. The DTC Data Analyst will be an essential role in the direct-to-consumer business and data strategy organization and serve as the key business partner across all functions including Marketing, Content, Product, and Operations.
This role is responsible for the reporting, forecasting, and optimization of the NFL Media’s DTC business. The DTC Data Analyst will work closely with teams across the DTC business to determine impact of current and future content and product initiatives, deliver actionable insights, and identify customer segments to reduce churn and grow customer lifetime value.
Responsibilities
Support development and reporting of KPIs across the NFL’s direct-to-consumer business
Leverage internal and external trends to support revenue and subscriber forecasts
Track and analyze data through exploratory analyses to answer key business questions, provide actionable insights, and ensure data integrity
Work directly with stakeholders to develop new initiatives and tests based on user behavioral segments and within the context of broader business objectives
Partner with IT teams to improve and iterate on the NFL’s current data architecture and capabilities
Create materials and communicate key findings to key stakeholders / project leads
Required Qualifications
The ideal candidate must be motivated, disciplined and able to effectively work with autonomy in a fast-paced, cyclical and often highly fluctuating work environment. He/she/they must possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
3+ years of experience in descriptive analytics
Knowledge of relational databases and conducting analysis in large data sets
Experience using SQL and Adobe Analytics
Experience using MS Excel & PowerPoint
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Preferred Qualifications
BA/BS degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or quantitative field
Background in DTC Media or Sports business
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, design, and data engineering
Other Key Attributes / Characteristics
Ability to execute analytics projects from beginning to end – including hypothesis forming, data collection, analysis, and presentation
Able to think strategically and contextualize findings within NFL and broader market trends
Proven ability to manage multiple projects at once and work in fast-paced, high-pressure situations
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and experience presenting to senior leaders
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with strong business acumen
Terms / Expected Hours of Work
Potential for >40 hour weeks leading up to and during the season
Potential for required weekend tasks leading up to and during the season

Human Resources, Diversity and Inclusion is committed to the mission of meeting the needs of a multi-cultural, diverse campus community. Our highly qualified team of professionals is focused on providing human resource services and supports the University's goal to recruit and retain a high-quality and diverse faculty and staff. At Edmunds we’re driven to make car buying easier. Ever since we began publishing printed car guides in the 60’s, the company has been in the business of trust, innovating ways to empower and support car shoppers. When Edmunds launched the car industry’s first Internet site in 1994, we established a leadership position online and have never looked back. Now, as one of the most trusted review sites on the Internet, millions of visitors use our research, shopping and buying tools every month to make an easy and informed decision on their next car. For consumers, we bring peace of mind. For dealers, we make tools to help them solve their problems and sell more cars. How do we do it, you ask? The key ingredients are our enthusiastic employees, progressive company culture and cutting-edge technology. Want to join the team? Read on to find out how!
What You’re Applying For:
Are you passionate about helping people get the right car? The Edmunds Insights team is looking for a Consumer Insights Analyst who is enthusiastic about helping shoppers be better prepared for the car buying process. The ideal candidate will be using experience, ingesting external factors (economic, marketplace, etc.) and data to identify shopping habits, pain points and proposing resources/solutions that work best for the entire car shopping ecosystem. We are looking for someone who can generate ideas and work with other team members to execute content and messaging for an infographic, ad, press release, article, or some other form of content not yet discovered! The Consumer Insights Analyst will also be comfortable talking about their identified trends with executives, media, or at industry events so we are looking for someone to become the go-to spokesperson on all consumer car shopping needs!
What You’ll Do:

Actively follows car shopping trends - participates in forums, online discussions, communicates with dealers and shoppers about current car buying environment
Crafts narratives which try to solve pain points for dealers and consumers in current market conditions
Interfaces with other internal teams to create marketing content based on developed storylines/themes
Works in Databricks, Excel to extract and analyze data to help support thesis developed
Conducts interviews with print, radio, TV outlets, must be comfortable speaking on camera in an unscripted fashion.
Represents Edmunds at industry conferences and events
Produces ad-hoc reports as needed for teams throughout the organization.
What You Need:

Solid overall knowledge of the car buying process including F&I for both new and used
Thinks ahead of the curve - ability to identify potential market trends based on what you’re seeing happening on the ground and in the data
Proactive, tenacious personality - willing to champion an idea throughout the organization
Can communicate clearly and effectively - able to explain concepts to an average consumer
Skilled at developing presentations
Comfortable with Microsoft Excel, working with spreadsheets and formulas as well as the desire to learn more advanced data tools
The ability to partner cross-functionally and work with a wide range of stakeholders
Works well under high pressure, fast-paced situations where time is limited.
Flexible and able to change direction quickly, manages ambiguity well
BA/BS degree preferred
Flexible schedule - media happens often in non-business hours
Edmunds Perks:

Flexible time off

13 Paid Holidays

Comprehensive Health Benefits (medical, dental, vision, life and disability)

Flexible Spending Accounts (Employees) and Health Savings Accounts (Employee and Employer Contributions)

401K Plan with Company Matching at 50%, up to 6% of employee eligible contribution and vesting after 1 year

Up to 4 months Paid Parental Leave

2 Days of Paid Time Off for time to dedicate to social impact causes

FitCash covers a portion of gym or fitness activity fees

Well being sessions and events such as yoga, meditation and walking challenges

On-going career development sessions and an annual learning event

Pet insurance

Sabbatical leave

Education Reimbursement

The University of Southern California’s (USC’s) Information Technology Services is seeking a talented IT Business Analyst for Data and Analytics (DA) with an exceptional commitment to service excellence to join its team. As the Business Analyst (DA), you will be an integral member of the Product Strategy and Design team, collaborating with diverse and talented team members to help solve multidimensional information technology problems, improve customer experience, and generate value for our campus stakeholders across a broad base of departments and constituencies.
The IT Business Analyst for Data and Analytics will be tasked with supporting critical ongoing financial operations for the ITS department and will be essential for the successful stabilization of our ERP, Workday Finance; which was recently implemented and went live. Experience using one or more of the following tools: Tableau, IBM Cognos, IBM Cognos TM1, Workday Reporting as well as with Workday or other Financial ERP solutions through on-going support or deployment are strongly preferred.
THE TEAM
The ITS vision aligns strategy, business, and services; affirms ITS cultural values; empowers cross-functional teamwork; embraces world-class best practices; and promotes innovation, excellence, agility, and efficiency. To achieve this vision, ITS is committed to providing a modern technology infrastructure that is resilient and delivers the performance necessary to meet the demands of a growing customer base, training in the latest technologies for its highly productive and motivated workforce, outstanding customer experience, and technology services that are aligned with the university’s mission to provide exceptional learning opportunities for students. ITS is creating a workplace where employees can develop cutting-edge skills, take pride in the services they provide, and have access to the roles and career paths that align to their abilities and potential.
ITS CULTURE
USC’s ITS organization represents a diverse and talented team, committed to supporting a collaborative culture and delivering secure and innovative IT services, core to the mission of USC. ITS values accountability, excellence, and commitment to exceptional customer experience. ITS strives for a supportive and inclusive culture that encourages employees to do their best work every day and where individuals are recognized and celebrated for their contributions.
ABOUT USC
USC is the leading private research university in Los Angeles—a global center for arts, technology, and international business. With more than 47,500 students, we are located primarily in Los Angeles but also in various US and global satellite locations. As the largest private employer in Los Angeles, responsible for $8 billion annually in economic activity in the region, we offer the opportunity to work in a dynamic and diverse environment, in careers that span a broad spectrum of talents and skills across a variety of academic and professional schools and administrative units. As a USC employee and member of the Trojan Family—the faculty, staff, students, and alumni who make USC a great place to work—you will enjoy excellent benefits, including a variety of well-being programs designed to help individuals achieve work-life balance.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
The candidate for the position of IT Business Analyst (DA) must meet the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, computer information systems, etc., or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
2 years of experience in one of the following fields: information technology, product design, or business analysis.
Demonstrated experience with data querying tools and standards such as MySQL, SQL, or other ODBC data querying tools.
Proven record of delivering end-to-end, user-centered products by considering stakeholder requirements, user research, market analysis, data, customer feedback, and technical constraints or opportunities.
Experience conducting or facilitating requirements gathering interviews or sessions.
Ability to measure results of user-centered products.
Experience supporting the development of test strategies and plans using widely accepted test methodologies or frameworks.
Understanding of Lean and Agile methodologies.
Experience utilizing analytics tools to measure success, present opportunities, and support decision-making.
Proven experience establishing strong working relationships with a wide range of team members and clients.
Experience working with and across functional groups.
Ability to make efficient, logical decisions in a rapidly changing environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear and effective functional documentation skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
The ideal candidate for the position of IT Business Analyst (DA) has the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, computer information systems, etc.
4 or more years of experience in one of the following fields: business administration, information technology, or higher education
Experience using one or more of the following tools: Tableau, IBM Cognos, IBM Cognos TM1, Workday Reporting
Some experience working within a Higher Education and/or Research industry
Proficient in data visualization and analytics, with design experience using business intelligence tools
Experience with Workday or other Financial ERP solutions through on-going support or deployment
THE WORK YOU WILL DO
The IT Business Analyst develops requirements, conceptualizes designs, and recommends business processes in support of core organizational functions for the university. Collaborates with a broad range of business partners and stakeholders, including students, faculty, and staff. Effectively documents future-state processes, tests the effectiveness of developed solutions, and enables the adoption of new business processes through training support. Demonstrates ITS values in action.
Job Accountabilities
The IT Business Analyst (DA):
Develops requirements, conceptualizes designs, and effectively recommends business processes in support of core organizational functions for the university. Communicates and presents recommended improvements and solutions to business processes and decision-making rationale. Delivers engaging experiences that balance customer needs, business goals, and technical realities by working collaboratively across the organization, with fellow analysts and others (e.g., user experience researchers, product managers, designers, developers). Engages with technical teams to profile applications and services, and identify interdependencies or complementary designs.
Engages in Human Centered Design (HCD) processes and approaches to deliver a broad range of sustainable solutions, and in standard business analysis methodology, outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions. Supports process-improvement efforts within the team and across the organization.
Build, designs, and delivers solutions that meet customer needs and expectations. Participates in user research to gain understanding of customer and stakeholder pain points, challenges and needs.
Maintains currency on emerging technologies and approaches, leveraging the latest industry knowledge while contributing to innovation and continuous improvement for the organization. Seek opportunities for innovation and maximizing system functionality by continually developing skills, knowledge, and abilities.
Works to mitigate risk while owning tasks, resources, and changes. Supports the release management process by anticipating risks. Produces required project analysis documentation (e.g. business requirements, scope matrices, use cases, future state proposals, user acceptance technology [UAT] plans).
Collaborates with a broad range of business partners and stakeholders, including students, faculty, and staff. Utilizes leading practices to effectively anticipate, analyze, and articulate problems, evaluate and document problem alternatives, manage constraints, and suggest interim and long-term solutions.
Perform other duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any time
Come join the USC ITS team and work as a trusted partner in shaping an environment of innovation and excellence.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS The candidate for the position of Business Analyst (DA) must meet the following qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, computer information systems, etc., or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. • Two years of experience in one of the following fields: information technology, product design, or business analysis. • Demonstrated experience with data querying tools and standards such as MySQL, SQL, or other ODBC data querying tools. • Proficient in data visualization and analytics, with design experience using business intelligence tools. • Proven record of delivering end-to-end, user-centered products by considering stakeholder requirements, user research, market analysis, data, customer feedback, and technical constraints or opportunities. • Experience conducting or facilitating requirements gathering interviews or sessions. • Ability to measure results of user-centered products. • Experience supporting the development of test strategies and plans using widely accepted test methodologies or frameworks. • Understanding of Lean and Agile methodologies. • Experience utilizing analytics tools to measure success, present opportunities, and support decision-making. • Proven experience establishing strong working relationships with a wide range of team members and clients. • Experience working with and across functional groups. • Ability to make efficient, logical decisions in a rapidly changing environment. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear and effective functional documentation skills. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. • Excellent time management and prioritization abilities. • Familiarity with computer programming concepts. • Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and applications.

positionName: New Business Analyst in Southern California
description:
Aon is looking for a New Business Analyst in Southern California

Purpose of Role: The U.S. Commercial Risk and Health New Business Analyst (“NBA”) will work with U.S. Commercial Risk and Health Sales and Marketing to operationalize a growth strategy and measure new business activities in U.S. Commercial Risk and Health office(s). The NBA will report the North America Sales Operations and Effectiveness Leader with a secondary reporting line to the Resident Sales Director (RSD). The NBA will work closely with the RSD to operationalized local growth strategies with support from the North America Sales Operations leader and team. Key Areas of Responsibility:
(As a minimum this must include the key tasks to be performed)
1a. New Business Implementation & Support Work with the RSD to identify the appropriate new business initiatives to activate in the local office, primarily with the Producers and Account Executives (Sales Team) Participate in meetings with the Sales Team to develop prospect identification and client penetration strategies Develop and distribute revenue, client acquisition activity, and benchmark reports (e.g., Local Market Analytics, Heat Map) that provide regional and local leadership with the supportive analytics need to implement strategic goals Provide strategic guidance and operational support to local leadership in the adoption and implementation of U.S. Commercial Risk and Health Sales strategy; to include (not limited to) strategic valuation, collateral and implementation timeline Provide strategic guidance and operational support to U.S. Retail Marketing and U.S. Sales Effectiveness to ensure all leads are assigned. Follow up on assigned leads to determine opportunity status At the direction of the Sales Team, research prospects and clients, using analyst reports, SEC reports, Yahoo! Finance, and related sources of information, to identify prospect- and client-specific risk profile information Identify with the Sales Team ideal prospects and clients for marketing campaigns; working cooperatively with Marketing assets to populate Aon Connect (“AC”) Execute national sales initiatives at the local level; including, industry, product, cross-sell and named account strategies as directed by U.S. Commercial Risk and Health Sales Coordinate annual business planning and goal allocation process with local office leadership and National Sales Effectiveness team
1b. New Business Revenue Tracking & Measuring Prepare revenue and pipeline composition analytics for office sales meeting and monthly forecast calls Develop and maintain pipeline composition reporting functionalities that reflect forecasted and ultimately recognized sales revenue, working closely with U.S. Finance to maintain accurate revenue pipelines to reconcile opportunity valuation Collaborate with sales and marketing colleagues to review marketing campaign effectiveness reports and recommend actions locally that will improve effectiveness Collaborate with local marketers to ensure delivery of local events Ensure the Office and Individual Sales Plan, including Quarterly Producer Assessment reporting is completed on time and accurate Provide operational assistance and strategic analysis to Sales Team and Pursuit and Creative Team (PaC) for prospect and client presentations Provide operational support to the RSD and RMD by providing revenue analyses to include valuation of individual and office performance to goal, office sales and marketing statistics (e.g., Client Promise results, prospecting Activity, wins and losses, deal size, and sales cycle in general and by product and industry, using AC, the Sales Effectiveness Report), resource identification, and follow-up communication, including any resource documents.
1c. Aon Connect Management and Administration Serve as the office AC expert for support of AC users, including: AC training and licensing of new producer and AE hires and ongoing training of the Sales Team including training on Client Promise and Jeopardy reporting in AC as needed Coordinate with AC leadership on AC enhancement requests and functional issues Participate in AC national support team Skills and Knowledge Required
(Task competencies) Passionate self-starter who can juggle multiple projects, follow-up and exhibit creative problem solving – ultimately delivering projects and assignments on target and on time within a fast-paced environment Strong ability to work closely with various cross functional groups, specifically with the Director of Marketing, Regional/Resident Sales Director, RMD, Producers and AEs in the office, as well as with Industry/Practice Leaders and National Sales Effectiveness Team A creative thinker who brings innovative ideas, new perspectives and a wealth of enthusiasm Excellent verbal and written communication skills, organizational skills and relationship skills Process-oriented person who can provide a clear, complete analysis that support sales efforts, resulting in revenue win for the company Qualifications include bachelor’s degree in Business or related major, excellent Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PPT, Word, etc.). Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management Systems (CRM) and marketing automation systems (i.e. Eloqua) A minimum of 2+ years of research experience or related formal training.

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:
From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience .

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE: AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.

We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation, and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.
How we LEAD:
Universal Music Group is looking for a Manager to join the Strategic Analytics team.
The Manager will consult on projects for Senior Executives, as well as individuals within Global Digital Strategy, Global Marketing, Business Development, Global Communications, Commercial Partnerships, and Finance business units. The ideal candidate should have experience supervising and mentoring more junior analysts but will be excited to consistently conduct analysis on their own using large data sets in SQL and Excel. Candidates with financial modeling experience preferred. Candidates should also demonstrate a solid understanding (or an eagerness to learn) the business models that are currently revolutionizing digital and subscription-based media.

How you’ll CREATE:
Manage the work process and professional development for yourself and 1 Analyst on the Strategic Analytics team
Create executive-level presentations to drive UMG-wide strategy
Work with stakeholders in a consultative fashion to understand goal of requests
Able to learn quickly and become a deep subject matter expert on all of UMG’s various data sources
Extract necessary data for projects using complex SQL scripts, and ensure query accuracy for more junior Analyst on the team
Create detailed financial models for scenario analysis on UMG’s biggest licensing negotiations
Sample analysis may include:
Using data to identify user trends and platform trends, including user engagement, listening habits, conversion, retention, monetization, genre insights, among many others
Developing dynamic models to support licensing negotiations (e.g., with Spotify, Apple), executive presentations, and high-level decision-making
Bring your VIBE:
4-6 years’ quantitative experience using SQL and Excel to conduct data analysis, with at least 1-2 years of direct supervising experience
Ability to visualize data using PowerPoint and other tools
Experience managing and engaging with clients in a consultative or analytical capacity
Ability to build relationships across business units and work well in a collaborative team environment
Passion and curiosity for music and the data that is used within the industry
Ability to balance multiple projects and deadlines
Perks Playlist:
Competitive Compensation Package including Salary, Benefits and Generous 401k Savings Plan
Paid Time Off – Paid Holidays, “Gift Week”, Summer Fridays
Student Loan Repayment Assistance
Employee Developmental Support
Annual Gym Reimbursement Package
Pet Insurance, plus much more!
 Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Development Technology & Solutions

Development Technology & Solutions is a partner of EA Studios. They span four continents, bringing together diverse individuals passionate about their craft from across the globe. They partner in every development phase while improving their expertise to create greater experiences for players. DTS participates in creating some of the most beloved games and supports ongoing live services. Through cutting-edge technology, data-driven insights, and state-of-the-art practices, they drive quality and directly impact players. They are a learning organization, sharing collaboratively and exploring innovative ways to solve challenges in creating amazing games for millions of players worldwide.

Founded in 2010 by the original creators of the Call of Duty Franchise, Respawn was created with the philosophy that when talented people have creative freedom, they'll make extraordinary games that achieve the unexpected. From our roots as an indie studio to joining the expansive roster of studios at Electronic Arts, this remains our guiding principle. We truly love what we do and want to share our passion with players worldwide.Our shipped titles include critically acclaimed multi-platform games Apex Legends, Titanfall, Titanfall 2, Star Wars™ Jedi: Fallen Order and Medal of Honor: Above and Beyond.Join us for the opportunity to create groundbreaking games with some of the best developer talent in the industry.

The Challenge Ahead:
As a Data Analyst you will focus on identifying patterns, risk and opportunity. You are curious and creative with a passion for diving into our data.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:
You will report to the Analytics Manager and partner with your game team to design interactive and real-time dashboards and provide insights to influence game quality through data-informed insights

Assemble data from multiple sources, conduct analyses, perform research, designs, documents and implement analytical solutions

You develop scripts and queries to import, manipulate, clean, and transform data from different sources

You present analysis conclusions to the game team in a clear, understandable, and valuable way. Tell compelling stories supported by data using Power BI

You oversee your active project, always looking for new problems to solve and new concepts to implement

You build metrics reporting systems and track process improvements across the team

Build relationships and share knowledge

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
3+ years in a past analytical role that involved thinking of big pictures, suggesting changes to process, identifying risks and potential opportunities for data improvement

3+ years' experience building dashboards, developing data models and generating visualizations

Expert SQL skills including experience querying complex data sets, NoSQL and elastic search is a bonus

University degree in a technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or Operations Research)

You are creative when approaching challenges and solving problems

Numeracy skills including statistics, simulation, and optimization

Past work experience in an Agile environment with multiple partners

description:
Job Description

We are looking for an energetic Data Analyst who is interested in working in a fast paced environment. The data analyst will work on our data team alongside data scientists and software engineers.

You will work with departments across the organization including Finance, Revenue Cycle, Supply Chain, and Operations to examine problems and present solutions. You will seek to identify ways data resources can be applied to improve business operations. You must be reliable and able to carry out tasks both autonomously and collaboratively.

The objective is to increase the data team's capacity for providing data analytics and for driving data driven decision making. Our data team is remote first, but we have offices in Los Angeles, Washington D.C., and Austin, TX.

Responsibilities
Creating SQL queries and dashboards.
Visualizing data and presenting results to stakeholders and senior management.
Conducting virtual training on how to use data team tools.
Creating reports and weekly newsletters for disseminating information to department heads.
Conducting cost analysis to identify room for improvement in operations.
Attend department meetings and identify data requirements.
Developing key performance indicators.
Requirements
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar.
Experience in data analysis and visualization methods with large volumes of data.
Outstanding organizational and problem-solving aptitude, solution oriented, and willingness to dig into the details.
Proficient in SQL (PostgreSQL preferred). Knowledge of statistical software packages (Python/R) is a plus.
Knowledge of data management systems (Redshift, Snowflake preferred).
Experience with business intelligence tools (Metabase, Tableau preferred).
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Ability to meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment.
BSc/BA in Health Informatics, Computer Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics or a related field. Masters or advanced degree preferred.

About us

Curative is a leader in on-demand public health service programs and healthcare delivery infrastructure. From rapid, mass COVID-19 testing sites to mobile vaccination sites, Curative partners with communities to strengthen public health services with turn-key programs, easy-to-access experiences, and scalable infrastructure, keeping people everywhere safe, healthy, and informed.

Co-founded by CEO Fred Turner and powered by a team of world-leading doctors, scientists, engineers, and health industry experts, Curative began focusing on COVID-19 testing in early March 2020 upon realizing the urgent need to scale COVID-19 test production in the United States. With a network of over 15,000 sites across over 20 states and three CLIA-certified, high-complexity laboratories, Curative and its managed medical entities have provided millions of COVID-19 tests and COVID-19 vaccines.

Beyond COVID-19, Curative is using its unique healthcare delivery expertise to reimagine the way we deliver and experience healthcare in America. We're working on creating an entirely new, vertically integrated healthcare offering that will improve individual and community health while utilizing society's limited healthcare resources more effectively and efficiently. For more details on Curative, please visit curative.com and follow on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

Safety

At Curative, your safety is our priority. Our working environments comply with current CDC recommendations.

As a company that focuses on ending the COVID-19 pandemic, we have a responsibility to ensure the safety of our staff and communities. We require that all Curative employees and third-party contractors show proof of vaccination against COVID-19 within two weeks of their start date.

Curative attn Privacy officer
430 S Cataract Ave
San Dimas, CA 91773

Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.
Our studios are considered one of the foremost motion picture and television production and post-production facilities in the world. They inform, engage, and transport audiences to new worlds. The key to that lies with our WarnerMedia Studio Operations group, which includes areas like soundstage/backlot set rentals, events, design, culinary, construction, landscaping and much more. Whether it’s hosting an unforgettable studio tour, creating an optimal workspace, or equipping talent to tell the best stories, these teams lay the foundation for WarnerMedia’s memorable experiences.
Join us. Shape your story here.
The Job
WarnerMedia seeks an Content Metadata Analyst for our Content Data Services team. This team is responsible for managing the Title and Content Data Services for WarnerMedia. The role will be responsible for system integration, records matching, metadata collation, localization, and delivery for Feature and Television titles for distribution to clients. The role will be responsible for performing complex business systems analysis for enterprise master data applications across Warner Media and external data sources. The Operations Analyst is expected to work in a fast-paced environment, multitask, and oversee operations and special projects. The candidate must be willing to adapt to a constantly changing environment and ensure guidelines and business processes are followed. Additional areas of responsibility include understanding, identifying and documenting business process and functional requirements. This role will work closely with all the Content Data Services teams on daily operations, troubleshooting, and special projects such as records matching and system enhancements.
This is a full-time project hire position with an anticipated end date of December 2022.
The Daily
Create, collate, analyze, and clean Content Data Services to ensure data accuracy. Synthesize records across WarnerMedia systems and third-party data sets.
Coordinate and communicate effectively with clients and internal teams for troubleshooting and ad-hoc requests. Requires daily management of releases and coordinate with internal stakeholders from marketing, publicity to in-territory and local client requirements for metadata from broadcast to home entertainment windows.
Review, organize and analyze data sets across WarnerMedia systems to provide actionable insights to improve system implementations, data flows and/or operational processes.
Support documentation for team meetings. Oversee and lead operations and spearhead special projects to support the media supply chain.
Propose improvements and efficiencies to workflows. Ability to analyze data, create reports, and document processes/workflow diagrams. Problem-solve and determine root causes in order to propose changes to existing process or procedures. Develop business scenarios and use cases for UAT and QA/QC testing for integration and implementation in metadata management system.
Manage and coordinate with outsourced team members, onsite and offshore, to ensure on time delivery and accuracy of metadata, as required by the business.
The Essentials
Experience with master data management software and discipline preferred (e.g., SAP, Informatica, Salesforce, Reltio etc.)
Experience with business intelligence, data visualization, and analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Qlik, Domo, SAP Suite, Google or Adobe Analytics, Microstrategy, IBM Suite, Oracle Suite, Microsoft Power BI, etc.)
Experience with project management preferred, team collaboration and documentation software, e.g. Atlassian Jira, Confluence, Trello, Slack, etc.
Experience with data warehouse solutions, cloud data warehouse a plus (e.g., Amazon Web Services Suite, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure Suite, Google Cloud Suite, etc.)
Proficient in MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.)
2-5+ years of experience preferred in Content Metadata and/or Enhanced Descriptive Metadata disciplines
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred
Technical Knowledge / Skills
Deep analytical skills who can ask relevant questions at the right time and provide multiple solution approaches to problems and challenges
Demonstrate initiative to stay abreast of technology advancements.
Ability to apply technology in solving business technical problems
Functional Knowledge/Skills
Experience in leading process change and implementing best practices associated with system implementation, replacement, and major enhancement.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task many projects
Strong ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences
Strong organization skills, project management skills a plus
The Nice to Haves
Must be an advocate for quality
Must be detail oriented
Must be comfortable working with a reasonable level of autonomy after instruction
Must be able to communicate effectively and tactfully with all levels of personnel, both in person and on the telephone
Must be able to facilitate business process discussions with groups of 5-10 people
Must be able to organize and schedule work effectively
Must be able to work well under time constraints
Must be able to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities, communicating changes in scope and schedule to all parties concerned
Must be service-oriented
Must be able to maintain confidentiality
The Perks
Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
Access to in-house learning and development resources
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

positionName: Data Analyst - Student Records, Undergraduate Registrar
description:
APU is seeking employees who desire to engage in our thriving culture by cultivating community through professional interactions, demonstrating a posture of lifelong learning, and modeling Christ-like character. Working together, employees at APU commit to establishing a university atmosphere that is edifying to God and to one another.


The person in this position is responsible for the day-to-day management of the PeopleSoft data system within the Office of the UG Registrar. This data expert understands the configuration, regular use, and data of the relevant PeopleSoft modules, sets standards for use of software in the unit and serves as a liaison between functional and technical staff. Additionally, this position must translate between business, data, and technical personnel and resources daily and continually analyzes and audits data in order to improve business processes as needed by staff. The Data Analyst writes departmental queries and reports as appropriate with the escalated assistance of IMT. This position plays a critical role in training.


Required Education

Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree preferred.


Required Experience

3-5 years of experience configuring and managing one or more of the following, preferably for a higher education institution:
Student Records
Campus Community
Curriculum Management
Academic Advisement
Primary Duties/Essential Functions

Manages the day-to-day operations of the Student Records and Academic Advising modules. Works with the Registrar, Associate Director, Student Records Data Leadership Team, and IMT to coordinate all technical issues.
Supports the Student Records Data Leadership Team in the management and configuration of the Student Records, Curriculum Management and Academic Advising modules.
Coordinates configuration updates and changes for each academic year.
Creates and runs queries, analyzes data, and conducts other data research as needed.
Audits, researches, and proposes improvements to business processes as needed.
Develops documentation for office business processes, test scripts, and training materials.
Assists leadership in training staff, faculty, and students on all relevant software as necessary.
Participates in process to fix a break when it occurs in relevant systems.
Configures and coordinates scheduling of processors pertaining to UG student records, including term activation, enrollment appointments, and other batch processes.
Develops and manages the yearly process/bundle timeline to coordinate data activities with our PeopleSoft modules.
Works with IMT to test periodic patches and bundles to PeopleSoft and other software systems.
Collaborates with Student Records Data Leadership Team to make recommendations to management and IMT for system modifications and additional software needs.
Participates and stays current in PeopleSoft user forums and communicates known issues and upcoming fixes and features to staff as appropriate.
Determines essential maintenance projects and assembles project teams as needed.
Participates alongside others within the data team in the configuration and operation of the Series25 academic scheduling software.
Provides support to the Registrar teams and other stakeholders to meet project deadlines as necessary.
Attends regular and ad hoc meetings as needed.
Registrar staff will be required to work both Spring and Winter Commencement each calendar year.
Regular, punctual attendance as required by the supervisor based on department needs.
Responsible for daily electronic timekeeping as it applies to the scope of this position.
Support, affirm, and sustain the beliefs, values, and mission of the university in all facets of leadership and through the university's daily living expectations.
Performs other duties as assigned by the supervisor


Skills

Adept at analyzing complex systems, requirements and data to solve problems and improve processes.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills, ability to exercise independent judgment and discretion.
Adaptability and the ability to come up with solutions to complex problems on short notice a must. Ability to make public presentations.
Able to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities with minimal supervision.
Strong interpersonal, collaborative, organizational and problem-solving skills.
Working knowledge of integrated management information systems.
Demonstrated success in working with a team and developing data plans.
Strong understanding of implementing new strategies and procedures.
Strong understanding of Registrar policy and procedure.
Proficient in PeopleSoft, MS applications and Google Apps, SQL Developer, Data Visualization Tools (Tableau)


Mental Demands

Ability to work under pressure, exuding a mature demeanor while accurately and consistently managing multiple projects while meeting deadlines.
Ability to work collaboratively with a team, as well as an independent contributor.
Ability to determine when to act independently and when to consult management prior to taking action.
Self-starter with a positive attitude.
In agreement with the purpose and goals of Azusa Pacific University in providing a Christian-based higher education for its students.


Physical Demands

Requires repetitive motions and sitting at computer keyboard.
Hearing and speaking on the telephone.
Ability to conduct business at other offices on campus.
Ability to lift, bend, grasp, reach, lift up to 20 lbs. occasionally.


Visual Demands

Reading, writing notes, and computer monitor.


Environment

Pleasant office, comfortable temperature.


Technologies

Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, with experience in other MS Office applications
Proficient in Google Apps
Experience with PeopleSoft Campus Solutions preferred


Compensation

Grade 9: $23.58-$30.65/hourly
Salary will be commensurate with qualifications, experience, and internal equity.


You can learn more about APU by watching the stories of faculty, staff, and alumni as they carry out our mission here: http://www.apu.edu/stories/


Azusa Pacific University will conduct a background check on all final candidates.


Review of applications will begin immediately, and the position will remain open until filled unless otherwise stated. Azusa Pacific University does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, disability, or status as a veteran in any of its policies, practices, or procedures. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.
Required Skills

Required Experience

Work you'll do

The incumbent is a team player who is passionate about learning, has experience working with stakeholders, proven analytical skills, and strong interpersonal skills.

In addition to working with/on multiple teams, you will have an opportunity to improve processes and systems, conduct research and analysis in order to come up with solutions to business problems, help introduce the business problems to other team members/developers.

You will have an opportunity to influence and contribute to the full suite of Deloitte products by adapting and expanding existing infrastructure and architecture to meet product owner demands.

In this fast-paced environment, you will be required to work with stakeholders to gather requirements, documenting problem statements, gathering feedback, facilitating user acceptance testing.

You should feel comfortable reviewing feature and defect requests through the issue tracker system to include reviewing resolution estimates, providing solution details, and ticket assignments.


The Team

Excellent documentation skills

Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills

Provides guidance to junior staff members

The University of Southern California (USC) is one of the world’s leading private research universities. An anchor institution in Los Angeles, a global center for arts, technology, and international business, USC is also one of the largest private employers in the City of Los Angeles. We are searching for exceptional individuals to help us fulfill our mission: Developing individuals and society as a whole through the cultivation and enrichment of the human mind and spirit.
The Job
We are looking to bring on a Strategy and Data Analyst who will be responsible for collecting, studying, and interpreting data that will provide an in-depth understanding for management and internal business partners in USC’s Division of Human Resources, Equity and Compliance. This individual will collaborate with program and project leads to understand current and future initiatives and provide tailored approaches to guiding strategic, data-informed efforts. The Strategy and Data Analyst will understand and manage expectations for outcomes, while adhering to timelines and balancing priorities. This person will adapt analytical strategies based on unique project and program requirements in order to help determine goals for the division’s strategic projects. This role will execute USC’s vision while championing USC’s culture and values.
Minimum Qualifications
The candidate for the position of Strategy and Data Analyst must meet the following qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education
3 years’ experience and direct knowledge in data modeling, data warehousing and reporting.
Extensive Project management experience for complex projects or business administration.
Demonstrated organizational, critical thinking, interpersonal, planning, problem solving, and business analytical skills.
Able to work at a high functional and technical level.
Exceptional quantitative & analytical abilities and proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint
Detail oriented with good organizational and presentation skills.
Creative problem solver with a strong sense of ownership.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Highly organized, with strong attention to detail
Team-oriented self-starter with the ability to work independently and proactively.
Ability to exercise discretion with confidential information.
Preferred Qualifications
The ideal candidate for the position of Strategy and Data Analyst has the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in disciplines such as statistics, economics, mathematics, accounting, business, computer science, information science or management information science, or MBA or Masters in Data Science and/or Analytics.
5 years experience and direct knowledge in data modeling, data warehousing and reporting.
Expert knowledge of Data Warehousing methods (e.g., Kimball) and Relational and Analytical data structures (RDBMS, OLAP etc.).
Impressive experience in designing managerial level presentations and reports.
Outstanding skills in finding resolution to complicated problems while performing independently in a multifaceted environment.
Ability to gather information and documents in order to analyze information strategically, creating data analyses and reports, identify patterns, and translate meaning.
Experience with Excel PowerPivot, Tableau, and Alteryx.
Knowledge of continuous improvement processes or change management practices.
Excellent interpersonal skills, emotional intelligence, and relationship-building abilities.
Ability to use sound judgment in making decisions with minimal supervision.
Job Responsibilities
The candidate for the position of Strategy and Data Analyst will be responsible for:
Performs data analyses and assists in interpretation of results using a variety of techniques to support business practices. Works with management to obtain and identify analytical requirements. Researches best practices and develops benchmarks. Produces data collection methods (e.g., surveys, tests, etc.), and develops tools and processes such as complex, high quality data models to support analyses. Analyzes results, reviews data for anomalies, investigates to identify and determine cause, and corrects data inaccuracies and inconsistencies as necessary. Provides recommendations and conclusions gained from analyzing data.
Has responsibility for business-to-systems analysis such as performing ad hoc analyses and data extraction requests, and problem-solving analysis of complex management reporting and business issues. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. Utilizes statistical and quality management principles to report and initiate operational/business practices changes.
Generates dashboards and reports which represent operational data in brief and intelligible format, suitable for the target audience, such as executive leadership, department managers and supervisors and other analysts.
Provides business data trend information to support recommendations for action. Collaborates with management on matters of best practices, appropriate statistical measures and benchmarking. Provides management with suggestions, as appropriate.
Carries out quality assessment of data, data reports and the accompanying decisions. Ensure data governance and data accuracy by inspecting, cleansing and performing quality checks.
Conducts analysis of findings and offers action-driven recommendations and insights to executive leaders and managers on the basis of results.
