You could be the one who changes everything for our 25 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, multi-national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
Position Purpose:
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends
Develop, execute, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools
Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment
Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required

The Data Analyst (Healthcare Analytics) will have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. The analyst will collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance.
Our Comprehensive Benefits Package:

Competitive pay
Paid Time Off including paid holidays
Health insurance coverage for you and dependents
401(k) and stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development

Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Knowledge of query development of basic to moderate complexity using SQL or other coding languages. Knowledge of basic statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Working knowledge of analytical tools, including R, Python, SAS, ArcGIS, QGIS, MicroStrategy, Tableau, Hadoop, or related tools preferred. Working knowledge of relational databases preferred. Working knowledge of automation capabilities such as batch processes, stored procedures, scripting languages, MicroStrategy, or other tools preferred.

About Nexon
Nexon, a world leader in online games, is building a workplace based on mutual respect, good humor, and the pursuit of excellence because we believe that great games can only be built by amazing people. Our vision is to create high quality, innovative online games that create unforgettable experiences for players around the world.
Nexon America is a leader in online gaming and award-winning publisher of renowned MMORPGs MapleStory, Mabinogi and Vindictus, which have gone on to break records and captivate players, and the company was recognized as a Great Place to Work-Certified™ company in February 2021. With new projects on the horizon, Nexon America maintains the pioneering and innovative spirit of its parent company, Nexon, employing its player-first approach, while designing the best possible gameplay experiences for the western market.
SUMMARY OF POSITION
Nexon is looking for a Senior Data Analyst.
Currently, all Nexon staff are working remotely. Hybrid work model will be in place once we resume on-site operations currently scheduled for January 2022.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Identify, design, prioritize, and develop data analyses to create unique business insights and perform detailed data exploration and validation to understand customers. Analyze, define, and document requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, interfaces with other products and solutions
Identify key analytic metrics, build reports, and present key insights to ensure that data drives actions to improve the business. Examine and analyze available information to determine patterns and gaps at a strategic level and recommend course of action to support internal and external users
Research and analyze web and game usage data and recommend solutions. Analyze user experience and business processes in order to identify opportunities for improvement. Translate and break down business requests into user stories, acceptance criteria, user flows in support of the product development effort. Research, evaluate, and review change requests and community impact to the development team
Document business needs, prioritize requested functionality and validate requirements against strategic goals and project objectives
Provide reporting and performance monitoring by using data drawn from diverse sources
Must be able to extract data by writing SQL queries and have programming knowledge for data analysts (R or Python) and make recommendations for improvement

Knowledge and Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Management Science, Business Administration, or similar/related field

We also provide company paid life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability benefits as well as access to voluntary life and AD&D for yourself and your dependents, flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) savings plan with a company match, and pet insurance. Nexies are encouraged to take advantage of our monthly wellness credit, participate in lunchtime yoga, and enroll in language classes. We host bi-monthly catered lunches, monthly happy hours, and maintain a well-stocked snack bar. AEG Worldwide is the world’s leading sports and live entertainment company with operations in the following business segments:
AEG Presents, which is one of the largest live music companies in the world dedicated to live contemporary music performances, including producing and promoting global and regional concert tours, music events and world-renowned festivals
AEG Sports, which is the world’s largest operator of sports franchises and high-profile sporting events
AEG Global Partnerships, which supports each of AEG’s divisions through worldwide sales and servicing of sponsorships including naming rights, premium seating and other strategic partnerships
AEG Real Estate, which develops major sports and entertainment districts worldwide
With offices on five continents, the company uses its global network of venues, portfolio of powerful sports and music brands, ticketing and content distribution platforms and its integrated entertainment districts to deliver the most creative and innovative live sports and entertainment experiences that inspire athletes, teams, artists and fans.
JOB DESCRIPTION
The LA Kings are seeking a Business Analyst to join the Data & Analytics team. The Business Analyst will be in charge of aggregating and analyzing data across business units to provide actionable insights for our organization. This person will be responsible for working with all departments to assist in finding ways to utilize data to improve revenue and efficiency within our organization. Responsibilities include prototyping new impactful data visualizations, deploying analytic solutions, and enhancing existing reports and dashboards. This individual should have a thirst for knowledge, be able to juggle multiple projects and be eager to work in a fast-paced environment.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Create, manage and enhance data visualization reports across all departments to effectively communicate results of business strategies including ticketing, digital & social media, CRM, Email and more
Enable business leaders and analytics consumers by onboarding new end-users to analytics platforms while providing recurring training, workshops, and demos as needed
Work with business leaders and colleagues to make actionable recommendations based on data insights
Communicate with Data Engineer to ensure all data needs are clearly communicated and data is structured properly for analysis
Lead market research efforts with survey development, design and providing insights to business leaders
Ensure segmented customer profiles (demographic, geographic and psychographic) are readily accessible and clear to assist with business operations departments
Work with CDP to deliver insight into campaign effectiveness
Undertake other duties as requested by the Director, Business Intelligence
Work with AEG sports entities to ensure reports are delivering needed data and expectations are being met and surpassed


SPECIFIC JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY:
The Business Analyst must possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities and be able to explain and demonstrate that he or she can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation, using some other combination of skill and abilities:
Proficiency in SQL
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); ability to learn required business systems.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to create relationships and work independently
Proven capabilities to identify actionable insight from data and translate results into clear, concise summaries/presentations
Experience and familiarity with advanced functions in Microsoft Excel
Experience with working with ticketing or transactional data
Team player who enjoys working in a high achieving and innovative environment, with a commitment to be top of class

QUALIFICATION STANDARDS:
Education:
BA/BS Degree (4-year) in Technical (Engineering, Math, Economics) or Business degree; Advanced degree preferred
Experience:
A minimum of 2-4 years related work experience.

MNTN technology pushes the limits of open-source software application development with a strong emphasis on building flexible technology to put the control in our users' hands.

Frontend applications written in react.js, node.js, and PHP create simple-to-use interfaces that allow non-technical users the ability to customize their campaigns, interactive creatives, and reporting to suit any need, so that they can focus on marketing instead of the tools.

Our core java applications and microservices handle over hundreds of millions requests per day, upon which a platform for real time behavioral marketing is built to drive performance in cross-device advertising. Cassandra and in-house solutions are leveraged heavily to keep attributes and metadata up-to-date to meet the demanding SLAs of rapid response advertising.

About the Job:

As a Data Analyst you will take the lead in developing products and reporting tools as a part of the Data team. The responsibilities of this crucial MNTN team are to create reporting tools, integrate reporting platforms, and generally bring life to the numbers for our clients and internal teams. As the data expert, the Data Analyst will report directly to the Data Team Lead and consult with executives from finance to product and every department in between. The ideal candidate understands how integral their role is to the success of the business as a whole and has a talent for seeing the big picture. We are looking for a strong, motivated, team-oriented individual, who is a gifted communicator with the ability to adapt their message to unique audiences.

 You Will:

Become the expert on the MNTN platforms, UI, databases, and data pipelines
Analyze and audit data for integrity, and to recommend/forecast insights associated with our product iterations
Create proof-of-concept analytics and mock out different reports to present our data
Verify and QA various facets of our data pre and post development to ensure our business needs are met
Investigate/triage/debug data incidents and provide recommendations for resolution

You Have:

3-5 years experience in data analytics or similar
Experienced with high volumes environments or data warehousing
Advanced SQL experience
Advanced Excel and analytical skills required
Demonstrated ability to interpret in-depth analyses, uncover actionable insight and effectively communicate to the broader organization
A strong mentality for problem solving

You Are:

A strong communicator with solid presentation skills
A self-starter and willing to work in an intense but fun environment
An assertive, ambitious, leader that can take charge when necessary
An excellent multi-tasker, extremely detail oriented, and able to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment characterized by growth and change

MNTN Perks:

100% Remote.
Competitive compensation
100% healthcare coverage
Open-ended vacation policy with an annual vacation allowance
Three day weekend every month of the year
401k plan
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) for dependent, medical and dental care

About MNTN:
MNTN is the world's first self-serve CTV platform that allows brands and agencies to precisely target digital audiences on high-end cable networks, complete with tracking in Google Analytics. We call it Performance TV. MNTN Performance TV has redefined what it means to advertise on television, transforming Connected TV into a direct response, performance marketing channel.

Our solutions give advertisers total transparency and complete control over their campaigns – all with the fastest go-live in the industry. Thousands of top brands have partnered with MNTN, including Orangetheory Fitness, Callaway Golf, Lands End, Yeti, and Ferrari.

description:
OpenX Technologies, Inc. is looking for a Data Analyst to join our fun, dynamic and high-performing Business Intelligence team within the Finance organization. Our organization’s mission is to steer the financial growth of OpenX through the delivery of world-class financial intelligence, guidance and services. In this mission we value reliability, integrity and fearless stewardship of OpenX’s business. We strive to operate with objectivity, rigor and strategic insight.
The ideal candidate will be a highly engaged and intellectually curious data analyst with one to four years of experience in an analytic role. You will be responsible for developing in-depth business analyses, providing ad hoc analytic support to the entire business, and driving the scaling and automation of reporting processes. You will have the opportunity to design and execute quantitative analyses using huge and complex data sets, and learn about the dynamic ad tech industry from within one of its leading companies.

Responsibilities
Build performance and revenue reporting tools for internal customers
Help build and automate data and reporting processes for the Finance organization
Ad-hoc analysis and reporting serving teams across the company
Manipulate large data sets in an efficient manner via scripting
Execute deep dive quantitative analyses that translates data into actionable insights
Provide analytical and decision-making support for key company initiatives


 1-4 years of analytical work experience, preferably within a business intelligence, corporate finance or strategic planning role.Experience working with large data sets preferred.

Superior analytical abilities and the ability to form key, succinct insights and recommendations from analyses involving large amounts of complex data.
Curiosity to identify and ability to solve difficult problems.

Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

Extremely proactive with a strong bias for action; naturally inquisitive; desire to continuously improve current business practices/processes.
Organized, detail-oriented, and ability to multi-task.

Collaborate closely with individual studios and business units to deliver actionable insights & drive value to the organization

3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst
3+ years experience using SQL, including complex queries from multiple data sources

Overview:

Our Team:
We are improving the lives we touch. We need passionate, talented people working together who share our desire to create a world-class organization that sets the standard of excellence in the treatment of speciality behavioral health and addiction disorders. Acadia Healthcare is headquartered in Franklin, TN and is a leading provider of behavioral healthcare services in the nation. Our organization values input from employees and fosters collaboration to create a team oriented service delivery system.
Our Benefits:
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Acadia Healthcare 401(k) plan
Paid vacation and sick time
Opportunity for growth that is second to none in the industry
Your Job as a Healthcare Data Analyst:
The Healthcare Data Analyst works with the Compliance Department to create a platform for Acadia Healthcare to interpret system wide healthcare data. Communicates with facilities on data submission and tracks compliance with reporting time frames.
Your Responsibilities as a Healthcare Data Analyst:
Interprets company data in ways that are both diagnostic of the quality of care and outcomes, and predictive of opportunities to improve
Creates an interface for clinicians and support staff to understand the data and its implications (e.g., trending, dash boarding, graphical presentation)
Works with Acadia’s departments to capture data from Acadia’s various systems (HRIS, risk management, patient accounting, patient experience, etc.)
Validates the quality of the captured data
Deciphers the data for comparison
Work with Acadia’s Compliance and Clinical Services staff to innovate ways of interpreting data
Maintain the interface that translates the data.
Works with the Chief Compliance Officer to manage investigations of compliance and clinical matters raised through Acadia’s compliance hotline and other avenues.
Your Skills and Qualifications as a Healthcare Data Analyst:
Bachelor’s degree in healthcare management or related field
1- 3 years of experience in healthcare analytics
Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Office; especially Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of office administration procedures with the ability to operate most standard office equipment.
Ability to work professionally with sensitive, proprietary data & information while maintaining confidentiality.
Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to interact effectively and professionally with individuals at all levels; both internal and external.
Exercises sound judgment in responding to inquiries; understands when to route inquiries to next level.
Self-motivated with strong organizational skills and superior attention to detail.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Company OverviewWarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives. Join us. Shape your story here.The Job WarnerMedia seeks a Senior Data Analyst for the Global Insights and Analytics department with Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. Responsible for the preparation and reporting of global market research projects for all theatrical titles, with a focus on analyzing incoming data based on sample research, and sources derived from machine learning. The Daily • Collaborate with data scientists at contracted vendors to receive and review data files. • Ensure proper data weighting is in place to reflect sample consistency across tests conducted on our film slate. • Develop models which spot key performance indicators, which can be applied to aiding early forecasting of the return on investment across our film slate.• Design, build, and maintain normative databases on our film slate, and save core documents in our shared file system for easy access.• Search for, and report, marketplace trends which may have bearing on our current and future business operations.• Assist with the design and development of questionnaires (e.g. reviewing coding logic), and provide norms to establish benchmarks using internal historical databases. • Take the totality of learnings and build visualizations to synthesize the information.• Collaborate with other business units in the organization on broad-based research projects which may have applicability to our film slate. • Transcribe focus groups feedback and read completed questionnaires to assist with analysis of key findings, which may be disseminated to production, filmmakers, marketing, and distribution personnel. • Responsible for negotiating costs from research vendors on projects, and work with finance and internal accounting to ensure available funding. Receive work orders with sample specifications and costs for submission.• Monitor consumer and critical feedback, including referencing online sources, as well as vendors maintaining panels and reviewing moviegoer club memberships, to see how findings from those outlets (e.g. audience composition) are similar or different from what was reported in research testing. • Confer with management on the development of brand equity studies to better measure affinity for titles with ingoing familiarity thru a prior movie, TV show, book, game, news event, etc. • Perform other related duties as assigned.The Essentials • 3-5 years employment with focused concentration on conducting, analyzing and reporting survey market research studies preferred, either at a full-service research supplier or in a market research department at a client company.• Statistics, big data business analytics, engineering, computer science & technology experience preferred.• Bachelors degree or higher in related field required, including Marketing, Marketing Research, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, etc.• Must have a strong foundation in both quantitative statistics and qualitative research. • Must have proficiency with numbers and data processing programs (SPSS and/or PSPP)• Must have understanding of API’s (Application Programming Interface)• Must have advanced Excel knowledge – specifically building and maintaining macros. • Experience with reading and interpreting digital research analytics is preferred.• Must have working knowledge of market research fundamentals and processes.• Must have Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint.• Must have strong writing skills and the ability to take data and put it into words in a manner that is easily understood. • Must have strong oral communication skills and must be able to speak to the research by phone, within a conference room, etc. • Must enjoy movies; have a passion for them!The PerksExclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screeningsPaid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employeesAccess to well-being tools, resources, and freebiesAccess to in-house learning and development resourcesPart of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brandsWarner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. FASHIONPHILE is a leader and pioneer in the ultra-luxury re-commerce space. At our core, we're a technology company with a mission of making the world's most coveted brands more accessible by breaking down the walls of traditional luxury.
We are looking for a full-time DATA ANALYST to join our Data Science and Analytics team in LOS ANGELES, CA! We are customer-obsessed and want to give our customers something to write home about by using data to understand and improve their experience. The Data Analyst is a key member of the Data Science and Analytics team and you will be influential in establishing the use of data at Fashionphile. The ideal candidate is someone who is always curious and has a passion for data, building tools, and providing insights. Even though the team sits in the Digital organization, you’ll work closely with other teams across the company to drive strategy and action through high-quality and timely analysis and tools.
This position is currently a remote position. However, we are seeking candidates that live in or are willing to relocate to Southern California within a reasonable commuting distance as onsite presence may be required in a future hybrid model.
ABOUT YOU:
You know and love working with analytic tools, speak SQL, and can use your technical skills and creative approaches to solve unique problems and answer important questions. Not satisfied with simply scraping the surface, you are constantly learning, thinking critically, and always seeking a deeper understanding. If this sounds like you, then read on!
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Support the development of website and native mobile application features for suppliers and shoppers
Empower Product Managers and executives to make data-driven decisions by making information accessible through dynamic and rich dashboards and by providing ad hoc reports when necessary
Partner with stakeholders to translate and refine their questions into testable hypotheses
Analyze data using visualizations and statistics to evaluate performance, identify actionable insights, make recommendations, and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating findings to cross-functional groups
Participate in the planning process for new features and initiatives and execute the project-level analytical strategy
Optimize and enhance the customer experience by assisting in the planning and execution of A/B and multivariate tests
Carry out aspects of Fashionphile’s data strategy related to web analytics tracking from defining requirements to validating and troubleshooting
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:
A degree in a quantitative or engineering discipline or equivalent work experience in business intelligence or data analysis
1-3 years experience in a data analyst role
Working knowledge of SQL with the ability to write queries from scratch
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau, Sisense/Periscope, MicroStrategy, Looker, or QuickSight'
Basic familiarity with statistical methods and concepts, including hypothesis testing and regression analysis
Proficiency with a statistical programming language (R or Python) to import, process, summarize, and analyze data
An understanding of web analytics tracking services such as Google Analytics, IBM Coremetrics, or Adobe Omniture
A commitment to and appreciation of accurate and consistent data
The ability to learn autonomously and work with only some guidance
Good verbal and written communication skills and an ability to convey results to non-experts
A willingness to take the initiative
NICE TO HAVE:
Experience with Google Analytics, Tealium, and Sisense/Periscope or QuickSight
A background in r/e-commerce and an interest in fashion
Familiarity with basic web development (HTML, JavaScript, CSS)
A copy of Edward Tufte’s “The Visual Display of Quantitative Information” on your bookshelf
The scientific method is second nature to you
You are a master of inference - both causal and statistical
WHAT YOU'LL GET:
Employer paid health-care coverage for employee and generous contribution toward dependent coverage
FSA options
Dental and vision coverage
Long Term Disability Insurance
Free Life Insurance and AD&D
Commuter Benefits Plan
Employee Discount
Paid vacation and sick time
401(k) plan with generous match

positionName: Data Analyst - Law Enforcement Response Enablement
description:
Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
Snapchat is the camera used by millions of people every day to Snap with family, watch Stories from friends, see events from around the world, and explore expertly curated content from top publishers. In short, we are a passionate team working hard to build the best platform in the world for communication and storytelling.
We’re looking for a Law Enforcement Response Enablement Data Analyst to join team Snapchat! As a member of the Law Enforcement Operations team, you will use data to bring insights to solving ambiguous business challenges. Working from our Los Angeles headquarters or San Francisco office, you’ll collaborate with the Data Science, Finance, Legal, Policy, Product, and Engineering teams to improve law enforcement operations and protect Snapchatters.
What you’ll do:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and data presentation to identify, analyze and provide insights into large data sets
Develop and track internal/external business metrics related to new projects and capabilities
Create volume forecasts and capacity plans
Design, build, and maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor operations performance
Design and implement new operational workflows and track progress via a project plan, consider stakeholder impacts and helping them adopt the change
Enhance existing operational workflows via process improvements
Identify tooling discrepancies, provide recommendations for improvements and liaise with technical teams to implement solutions
Enhance existing Quality Assurance (QA) and certification process and improve QA reporting to accelerate quality improvements
Create and enhance knowledge management documentation and deliver training
Review team members’ work product, create and deliver training, coach and provide feedback
Collaborate with internal and outside counsel on escalations as appropriate
Serve as a consultative partner with our operations and vendor teams and provide expertise for processing all types of legal requests with a high degree of quality and efficiency
You set an example and are an active mentor of others. You are a well respected member of the team and focus on achieving results.

Founded in 2009, Transom Consulting Group is a growth strategy consultancy and investment bank focused on work with investment firms and companies in financial services, consumer goods/retail, and business services.
Transom is a nimble and entrepreneurial advisory firm with an exciting growth runway and significant opportunity for upward mobility.
Our team is comprised of high-energy and high-performing professionals from top-tier institutions who share a passion for supporting clients when they make their most impactful decisions.
Our Business Analyst program is a skill-building journey for recent college graduates who wish to challenge themselves and gain exposure to a variety of business functions and capabilities while working on top-level consulting engagements. Our size enables us to fast track our analysts’ learning and experience in a manner not possible at larger, legacy firms. Senior team members drawn from the world’s top consultancies (e.g., McKinsey, Bain, BCG) provide oversight and mentorship to our Business Analysts, helping them develop their problem-solving, communication, and analytical skills.
Responsibilities:
Researching client organizations and industries – primarily, but not restricted to, financial services, consumer goods/retail, and tech/media/telecom
Identifying client issues related to long term growth, product positioning, marketing, operational improvements and efficiency, etc.
Creating hypotheses and collecting data to analyze from financial statements, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and benchmarks reports, industry metrics, and other relevant data sets
Analyzing large quantitative data sets using Excel to translate raw data into meaningful and digestible insights, and building advanced financial models using Excel where necessary to validate hypotheses
Interviewing subject matter experts, conducting focus groups to obtain qualitative insights, and facilitating workshops with client employees, management teams, and other stakeholders
Preparing detailed PowerPoint presentations, business memos, and supporting documents to recommend course of action to key C-Suite executives, decision makers, and other stakeholders
Moving the client to action; developing pilots and outlining full-scale project plans to implement the strategic recommendations
Contributing to the development of company intellectual property
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree with outstanding academic performance; Economics major or a related field with coursework in business/accounting/finance required
Proven record of leadership
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in structured analysis (financial modeling and/or statistical experience strongly preferred)
Ability to thrive in a service-oriented environment and maintain healthy relationships with both team members and clients
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to handle multiple tasks in a dynamic setting
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written)
Ability to collaborate effectively with teammates and managers
Eagerness to learn and a desire to achieve personal and professional growth
Commitment to high-quality, on-time client service

Company Description
CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.
The Team:
The Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) function within Mattel’s Global Supply Chain Planning organization is responsible for the development, implementation and continuous improvement of the S&OP framework and maturity. The goal of S&OP is to align end to end planning and improve execution.

Job Description
The Opportunity:
Mattel is looking for a Senior Data Analyst as it grows its Analytics team within the Supply Chain organization. This hire will help with the development, support, and organization of business intelligence solutions for the Global Sale & Operations Planning team. This role will involve supporting the building/development of models and visualizations on complex data sets to help solve stakeholder problems.
What Your Impact Will Be:
Create high impact, visually attractive dashboards
Analyze, report and present data driven solutions back to the organization to solve business problems and improve or redesign processes.
Spur and support the ongoing development of data reporting tools and self-service dashboards.
Improve data quality and integrity.
Benchmarking, performance reports, trend analysis, activity targets and root cause analysis.
Use SQL queries to extract and interpret data.
Testing and documentation of data models
Centralization of Global and Regional business intelligence tools and data
Generate and maintain excitement for Supply Chain Analytics

Qualifications
What We’re Looking For:
3-5 years of data analytics experience
A thirst for visualizing data for creative storytelling and analytics
Proven experience with BI tools/dashboard development (e.g., Tableau, Cognos, etc.)
Proficient with SQL. R or Python is a plus
Excellent communication, presentation and report writing skills.
Superior organizational skills
Proven experience leveraging data to inform business decisions to redesign & improve processes and reporting.
Confidence in engaging and managing stakeholder interactions at all levels.
Additional Information
What It’s Like to Work Here:
We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors:
We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower.
We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking.
We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results.
Who We Are:
Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential.

Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers.

Mattel is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

Organize, analyze, and present data from ticket sales and operations, food and beverage sales, merchandise sales, digital media and marketing interaction, third party sources, stadium operations, capital expenditures, corporate partnerships, and other business areas
Synthesize statistical models, including lead scoring and churn prediction, to help optimize customer acquisition and retention efforts
Help drive adoption of new technologies (i.e. points of sale, AI software, CRM plug-ins, sales operations platforms) through reporting and product management

positionName: Business Engagement Data Analyst, Real Estate Workplace Services
description:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Atlanta, GA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Chicago, IL, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Business Administration, Computer Science, Finance, Statistics, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a quantitative analytics role.
5 years of experience with SQL databases and reporting.
Preferred qualifications:

Ability to speak effectively, influence, and collaborate at all organizational levels and adapt style to different audiences.
Ability to grow in ambiguity, demonstrable problem-solving leadership, and tenacity with limited oversight.
Excellent written communication and presentation skills.
About the job

The Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS) experience is what makes much of our Google culture uniquely Google! At Google, data drives decision-making and our team defines and interprets REWS data to provide recommendations and perspectives to REWS leadership, their teams, and cross-functional stakeholders (People Operations, Finance, Corporate Engineering, Product Areas, Office of the CEO and CFO). We ensure that Google leaders have meaningful REWS data and insights to make thoughtful decisions, most of which impact Googlers globally. We also seek to build data fluency throughout the REWS Organization.

The REWS Business Engagement Data Analyst team provides strategic guidance and data insights to the Business Engagement pillar to help drive clarity and better understanding of complex data landscape. We help REWS deliver on client needs and deliver critical Product Area based projects, providing transparency and clarity to all of our stakeholders on a timely basis through clear articulation of complex data.

The team brings together data from across REWS and other Google groups to coordinate and lead cross-product area transformational initiatives. The team creates data robust solutions, completes projects efficiently, and communicates updates to stakeholders with exceptional diligence. Analysts are key thought partners across REWS and advise on decisions using a combination of analytical thinking, data and subject matter expertise.
The Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS) team creates inspiring spaces and innovative services that bring Google’s culture and values to life. We build and maintain all aspects of what keeps our Googley workspaces operating seamlessly across multiple cities and regions globally. We also manage the industry-leading services that help make Google a great place to work - from how we design healthy and collaborative workspaces, create energizing food experiences, provide convenient transportation and fitness options, to delivering inclusive environments where Google and our employees can thrive.
Responsibilities
Scope and define a project’s problem statement, establish actionable metrics, and develop data based solutions that guide users on how to assess business trade offs and outcomes.
Structure and perform analyses independently, and conduct research to uncover the insights that will lead to business recommendations.
Customize communication and output (dashboards, visualizations, analyses) to a wide variety of audiences, determine the best audience for data-driven insights, and provide interpretation, analysis, or insight along with clearly-stated information.
Lead development and deployment of “single source of truth” centralized reports, dashboards, models and tools to analyze, report, and present partnerships and operations related data that is associated with the REWS Organization.

positionName: Visual Data Analyst - Kaiser Permanente Bernard J. Tyson School of Medicine
description:
The Visual Data Analyst collects data and provides analyses for a broad array of education and institutional programs across disciplines and diverse functional areas of the organization. The analyst also has sole responsibility for some small to medium size analytical projects and engages with other projects as a member of a team to support the units ability to sustain a robust quality assurance program at the Kaiser Permanente Bernard J. Tyson School of Medicine, which includes the student performance and program evaluation systems. The Analyst serves as an important contributor to the schools information management and business intelligence workflows and a key element in its broader institutional effectiveness strategy and data-driven culture.
Essential Responsibilities:
Assists in the design of analytic approaches using educational and institutional program data.
Creates data visualizations (e.g., dashboards, infographics, charts, etc.) using best practices in evaluation and data science,
Prepares preliminary interpretations of analyses for project teams, clients, and/or department management.
Conducts background research on identified education and institutional program issues.
Collaborate with other analysts on assigned components of project work.
Assists in developing and utilizing data gathering tools, such as surveys/questionnaires, sampling frames, statistical modeling, and/or interview questions, to ensure that appropriate quantitative and qualitative data is gathered for the analyses.
Queries and extracts data across multiple systems for analysis, interpretation using appropriate syntax and computing language.
Conducts quantitative and qualitative analyses on a broad array of issues across disciplines, projects and functional areas.
Recommends suggested action steps based on the analytic results, including but not limited to additional analyses and avenues/methods of communication.
Prepares reports synthesizing analytical results, highlighting implications of findings.
Follows through any further actions based on the results using sound organizational judgment.
Assists in the development of project proposals, recommendations, implementation plans, communication packages, performance measurement tools, and training materials related to the assigned projects.
Contributes to practice development and department administration including, recruiting, and debriefing on training, and engaging in other evaluation capacity building and improvement activities.
Basic Qualifications:
Experience
Minimum five (5) years of related analytical or consulting in technology/data science experience.



Education
Masters degree in data science, business administration, economics, operations research, public health administration or related field.



License, Certification, Registration
N/A



Additional Requirements:
Demonstrated ability to identify issues and propose methodological solutions; synthesizes analyses well, highlights implications of findings.
Demonstrated ability to conduct and interpret and communicate quantitative/qualitative analysis using such tools as SPSS, SAS, Dedoose, NVivo.
Extensive knowledge of databases, relational data systems, querying language (e.g., SQL), coding language (e.g., Python), and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau).
Must demonstrate effective communication, consulting, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
Proficient with PC applications including spreadsheet, word processing, and graphics packages.



Preferred Qualifications:
Doctoral degree in related field.
Knowledge of the principles of access management, access reporting, and MS Excel.

SUMMARY:

The BA will apply critical thinking to determine process impacts and business benefits. The candidate must be comfortable working with a diverse population, technically proficient, able to multi-task well, explain solutions clearly, is well organized, and has the ability to work autonomously.
You will coordinate program activities, ensure consistent structures inside the program and its work streams, and manage the creation of professional presentations. You will track status reporting and manage documentation as well as organization of meetings. You will be working closely with the internal and external partners ensuring collaboration across team
The role will interact will the global project team via teleconference and/or video conference. The ideal candidate will be able to manage complexities and interdependencies with the ability to identify, describe and communicate these in a succinct way.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Identify and document gaps in procedures and create solutions for scalable and repeatable processes.
Protects scope, identifies and mitigates risk, ensuring success of critical and complex technology projects.
Comfortable in an environment of ambiguity and rapid change which will require prioritizing competing tasks and conflict resolution.

Support resource and capacity planning, in close alignment with the leads and team.

Support in reporting processes, efficient tracking of progress status of the work streams.

Ensure smooth tool system access and documentation management processes and maintenance.
Support setup and maintenance of qualitative Project Controlling processes and ensure budget tracking.
Support stakeholder management with diverse external parties, connecting and engaging stakeholders.
Recognize and resolve operational issues and minimize delays in the delivery of program objectives.

PMP Certification preferred.

Experience in project management methodologies (e.g. PMI, SCRUM, SAP Activate, SAFe) & tools.

Analytical skills and capacity for conceptual thinking, able to think and act with a cross-organizational and cross-process approach.
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.
High level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information

Overview
Founded in 1887, Dignity Health - California Hospital Medical Center is a 318-bed, acute care, nonprofit hospital located in downtown Los Angeles. The hospital offers a full complement of services including a Level II trauma center, the Los Angeles Center for Women's Health, obstetrics and pediatric services, and comprehensive cardiac and surgical services. The hospital shares a legacy of humankindness with Dignity Health, one of the nation's five largest health care systems. Visit https://www.dignityhealth.org/socal/locations/californiahospital for more information.
Responsibilities

Position Summary:

Supports Dignity Health system analytic leaders to drive efficient, accurate analysis of data and reporting for hospital operational and clinical needs and performance improvement initiatives across the Dignity Health system. Works independently to analyze performance data and metrics to identify trends and root cause for performance gaps. Creates clean data extracts for data analysts within and outside of the analytics team to use for analysis. Communicates complex data/information in an understandable and compelling manner to a variety of end users at many levels of the organization.

Principal Duties and Accountabilities:
Understands and combines data from a variety of disparate data sources to create meaningful analyses for system leaders. Reports, extracts, segments, summarizes, and analyzes organizational data. Creates clear and meaningful graphs, charts and other visualizations. Researches and recommends targets for key metrics and performance indicators using external benchmarks and internal data.
Writes programming code in SQL, SAS, R or similar to extract, merge, combine datasets; cleans data and creates metrics based on customer specifications, company or national standards. Independently creates analytical products based on business requirements. Completes basic statistical analyses or predictive modelling. With oversight, analyzes and communicates the cost-benefit of performance improvement projects.
Communicates results of data analyses and data definitions to customers in a clear and compelling manner, using written, verbal, and other mediums. Collaborates with other analytics team members and customers to understand the operational processes and clinical documentation practices and makes performance improvement recommendations. Gathers business requirements for analytics projects and products with minimal direction and oversight.
Participates in high level system-wide projects as a data or analytic subject matter expert. Mentors and advises data analysts in understanding source and meaning of data to create effective analyses.
Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Healthcare, or other related field; a combination of education and/or additional job related experience may be substituted in lieu of the degree.
Minimum five (5) years of experience in analyzing, reporting, and communicating data.
Special Skills:
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite. Proficiency in data programming software such as SQL, SAS, or R.

description:
ABOUT FANDUEL GROUP

FanDuel Group is a world-class team of brands and products all built with one goal in mind — to give fans new and innovative ways to interact with their favorite games, sports, teams, and leagues. That's no easy task, which is why we're so dedicated to building a winning team. And make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give.

FanDuel Group is based in New York, with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon and Scotland. Our brands include:

FanDuel— A game-changing real-money fantasy sports app
FanDuel Sportsbook— America's #1 sports betting app
TVG— The best-in-class horse racing TV/media network and betting platform
FanDuel Racing— A horse racing app built for the average sports fan
FanDuel Casino & Betfair Casino— Fan-favorite online casino apps
FOXBet — A world-class betting platform and affiliate of FanDuel Group
PokerStars US — The premier online poker product and affiliate of FanDuel Group

THE POSITION

Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for an Analyst to join our team. You will derive insights for FanDuel Group teams in order to drive actionable insights about the business. You will work alongside a group of other analysts through various individual and team assignments to continually evolve the various tools, models, and data visualizations used to drive the FanDuel Group business.

Senior Data Analyst
What will be your mission?
At Sony Pictures, our mission is to connect relevant movie and TV series content to consumers and audiences across transactional, subscription and linear viewing platforms. We’re building data products, visualization tools and insights platforms that will predict audience preferences and behavior for library and new releases to drive growth of engagement and consumption of Sony produced content. Sony produces franchise brands, such as Spiderman, Men in Black and Jumanji, through to TV franchises such as Breaking Bad, Blacklist and Better Call Saul.
Our Data team is responsible for aggregating millions of consumer data points to build best in class predictive models, consumer trends systems, recommendation engines and more!
This position is responsible for developing and supporting new and existing datasets and partnering with IT to deliver ETL scripts to support operational reporting, management decision support, and advanced analytics.
Who are you?
You have a strong commercial analytical background, curious and commercially savvy and technical skills in data querying and transformation. You believe that data profiling, quality management, data integration across disparate data sets are foundational in enabling and driving a culture where data is democratized, accessible and easily interpreted for Sony Pictures to be a consumer-centric data driven organization.
You will work in the Data Management team within the business and leverage your analytical skills (across sales, consumers) to profile, UAT, develop and manage usage of Sony data licenses in cloud-based data platforms and sandboxes.
You care about data quality, consistency, integration, connectivity across big data sets. You will work with our data science team, our IT team, our strategic analysts and our diverse users across the business. You will co-manage data sets spanning from data ingestion to end-user lifecycle: Profile, ingest, connect, features engineering, prepare, store and disseminate data.
You are data curious and business savvy with a strong background and demonstrated ability to navigate and analyze large and diverse data sets and be able to structure data so that it is meaningful and compelling.
What will you be doing?
Work closely with consumer / audience analytics teams and technology partners to understand business requirements - translate and use complex data sources that needs to be blended, cleaned, structured, and enriched into a desired output for analysis and modelling.
Conduct data lifecycle activities: problem identification, hypothesis definition, data integration, data profiling, prototyping and experimentation, data schema design, development, testing and deployment.
Conduct a broad range of analytics, tuning SQL codes, data management and optimization functions including development, scheduling, job optimization, version control management, data quality management, and issue resolution.
Use SQL, aggregate data and build attributes to be utilized for data warehouses /repositories / big data platforms, self-service reporting solutions, scorecards and dashboards on user-level audience and consumer data using analytical and visualization tools.
Use workflow management platforms, partner with IT and Data Science to schedule, optimize various ETL scripts and improve data operational processes.
Support User Acceptance Testing to ingest new data sets and migrate data sets to cloud platforms for data sandboxes
Support new software evaluations
Troubleshoot and resolve data discrepancies, perform quality audits, identify data gaps / anomalies, conduct root cause analysis with recommended solutions, and track error resolution through completion
Develop custom datasets and execute data extract queries to support ad hoc analyses and data science initiatives
Create documentation and logs for new and existing data sources including: drafting data dictionaries, providing data field definitions, developing common business data language, data nuances, data summaries and tracking aggregate tables and features engineering calculations
Present and communicate data summaries with the goal of data education.
Support in design and development of report prototypes
Preferred Qualifications
Technical experience:Proficient in SQL, ETL Experience and/or Python scripting experience (Nice to have but not necessary)Hands-on experience with Teradata, Oracle, AWS and Snowflake database platforms and tools to analyze them (SQL Assistant, SQL Developer, etc.)Understand file constructs such Json, xml, flat files (CSV text files)Strong proficiency with 2+ years Microsoft data analysis tools such as Advanced Excel (e.g., Pivot Tables, Index Match) and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Sisense
Business ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration or Computer-related degree2+ years of experience with data warehousing and business intelligence2+ years of experience with all phases of a software development lifecycle2+ years working as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst for a medium to large scale company that manages big data (Retail, Distribution, Marketing and Consumer analytics)

Gift Card Business Analyst


About Us:
The Gift Card group is a fast-growing multi-channel/multi-million dollar business in the Fandango portfolio, encompassing an assortment of products and responsible for a large portion of Fandango’s overall incoming revenue and consumer acquisition. The Gift Card team is responsible for strategy, marketing, sales, growth, creation and enhancement of our products sold through physical & digital retailers, D2C and B2B. Our product lines include both our own O&O brands (Fandango, Vudu, MovieTickets.com) as well as bundled partnerships, thus providing our consumers with an assortment of entertainment gifting solutions.

This is an exciting opportunity for a high-performing, fast-moving, innovative and strategic marketer to join our Gift Card Team. The Gift Card Business Analyst will be responsible for thorough tracking and analysis of Gift Card products in all three channels (retail, B2B, D2C) with the emphasis on retail marketing and analysis. Position will also be responsible for directing production and card implementation at Retail & B2B. Goals include driving new customer acquisition & retention, consumer engagement, cross channel optimization and leverage of studio/content IP. You will partner with internal divisions such as finance, business development, product management, design, marketing, finance and legal as well as across other teams within the NBCU/Comcast/Peacock Family.

We are looking for an individual who is motivated, brings enthusiasm for the customer, passionate about the entertainment industry and experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously. Proven analytical thinking and passion for data is essential - you should be fluent in analyzing both business performance and marketing metrics, have strong project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional collaboration skills. You should be a self-starter and effective communicator, able to think strategically and execute at a high level. The individual should demonstrate strong business judgment, have a strong track record of relationship management, has a passion for experimentation, is a problem-solver and thought leader. Experience with digital, retail marketing and consumer products is ideal.

Core job responsibilities include:
Analysis of all proposed Retail/B2B/D2C promotional campaigns, recommending based on ROI/Strategy/Sales performance
Marketing directives/recommendations for best practices
Provide analysis reports, performance recaps and financial updates across all Channels
Own invoice management across the business and with state holders, liaison with Finance
Own budget tracking across the business
Track monthly sales and all promotional sales across the business
Analysis and directive for production and inventory placement of product and specific denomination
Production and inventory management, direct the order process & inventory control
Recommend and direct creative execution of brand/card art
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing , Data Analytics or related field or equivalent experience3-5+ years of experience designing, developing, testing, and implementing high-performance, scalable, and secure business intelligence and analytic solutions in a high-volume environmentExperience performing high level data analysis; needs to have a general understanding of databases and structures and must enjoy working with dataAbility to multi-task, problem-solve and communicate in a challenging, fast-paced environmentHighly organized, strong attention to detail and outstanding time management skills
Desired Characteristics
Strategic thinking and creative problem solvingProven ability to analyze data for decision making by teamStrong interpersonal & communication skills to drive alignment across the team and organizationAbility to interpret data and concisely communicate findings through presentations to senior levelsAdvanced knowledge of Excel, spreadsheets and Tableau (or other reporting systems)Consumer Products experience a plus

The University of Southern California’s (USC’s) Information Technology Services is seeking a talented Data Quality Analyst with an exceptional commitment to service excellence to join its team. As the Data Quality Analyst, you will be an integral member of the Enterprise Data and Analytics team, collaborating with diverse and talented team members to help solve multidimensional information technology problems, improve customer experience, and generate value for our campus stakeholders across a broad base of departments and constituencies.
The Data Quality analyst is key to the nexus data governance, data management, and Data quality. This role will be instrumental in determining sources of truth, sources of record, and data derivatives and definitions.
THE TEAM
The ITS vision aligns strategy, business, and services; affirms ITS cultural values; empowers cross-functional teamwork; embraces world-class best practices; and promotes innovation, excellence, agility, and efficiency. To achieve this vision, ITS is committed to providing a modern technology infrastructure that is resilient and delivers the performance necessary to meet the demands of a growing customer base, training in the latest technologies for its highly productive and motivated workforce, outstanding customer experience, and technology services that are aligned with the university’s mission to provide exceptional learning opportunities for students. ITS is creating a workplace where employees can develop cutting-edge skills, take pride in the services they provide, and have access to the roles and career paths that align to their abilities and potential.
We are looking for top talent to join us on our journey.
ITS CULTURE
USC’s ITS organization represents a diverse and talented team, committed to supporting a collaborative culture and delivering secure and innovative IT services, core to the mission of USC. ITS values accountability, excellence, and commitment to exceptional customer experience. ITS strives for a supportive and inclusive culture that encourages employees to do their best work every day and where individuals are recognized and celebrated for their contributions.
ABOUT USC
USC is the leading private research university in Los Angeles—a global center for arts, technology, and international business. With more than 47,500 students, we are located primarily in Los Angeles but also in various US and global satellite locations. As the largest private employer in Los Angeles, responsible for $8 billion annually in economic activity in the region, we offer the opportunity to work in a dynamic and diverse environment, in careers that span a broad spectrum of talents and skills across a variety of academic and professional schools and administrative units. As a USC employee and member of the Trojan Family—the faculty, staff, students, and alumni who make USC a great place to work—you will enjoy excellent benefits, including a variety of well-being programs designed to help individuals achieve work-life balance.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
The candidate for the position of Data Quality Analyst must meet the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as data science, computer science, computer information systems, etc., or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
2 years of experience in information technology or data science.
Experience developing and delivering data quality solutions.
Strong understanding of data modeling, master data management, enterprise data warehousing, ETL, reporting, querying, requirements analysis, and data integration techniques.
Extensive knowledge of relational databases.
Experience in database development and management.
Proficiency in SQL and knowledge of other programming languages.
Experience with external API integrations.
Experience in writing scripts, programs, and software packages to analyze and validate large data sets.
Extensive understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) methodology.
Knowledge of lean and/or Agile methodologies.
Ability to develop positive working relationships and a strong rapport with team members.
Strong communicator with experience presenting technical topics in a business-oriented fashion to non-technical audiences.
Experience working in a project-based environment using leading project management practices including schedule management, status reporting, and communication of project risks and issues
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
The ideal candidate for the position of Data Quality Analyst meets the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, computer information systems, etc.
5+ years of data analyst experience performing data profiling, data cleansing, data mapping, data validation, data manipulation, data mining, data analysis, use cases, test cases, etc. in a data-intensive organization.
3+ years of experience in years of hands-on experience with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ) toolset or Dataflux or other data quality tools
3+ years' experience in defining and deploying data quality programs and tools on enterprise data quality projects
4+ years of experience in Information Technology or Data Science
Knowledge of Informatica data quality standards, guidelines and best practices
Knowledge of Data Architecture (conceptual, logical, physical, transactional, dimensional, and Star/Snowflake modeling)
Advanced SQL skills, working knowledge of Python and other programming languages
Proven experience translating business problems into actionable data quality initiatives
Knowledgeable with latest trends in Data Quality technologies.
Good knowledge on data mapping experience - mapping data sources to and from multiple applications
Experience with Oracle, SQL server, Tableau visualization, Jira.
Good understanding of data governance, data stewards and experience with data dictionaries and data lineage tools.
Good oral and written communication and presentations skills with the ability to lead meetings effectively
Experience in SDLC Process
Strong experience on data quality solutions development process, issue management, and data remediation
Curious and inquisitive approach to solving complex data quality challenges
Experience in higher education
THE WORK YOU WILL DO
The Data Quality Analyst develops and supports an enterprise data quality solution. He participates in all aspects of the application services delivery cycle, including creation of business and technical specifications, design, development, execution of Data Quality checks, and collaboration with customers and stakeholders to resolve quality issues. Extracts, manipulates, tests and validates large amounts of data sets. Solves complex problems with a customer mindset. Demonstrates ITS values in action.
Job Accountabilities
Develops and maintains of a repository of documentation related to data quality standards, protocols, frameworks, and techniques. Works collaboratively with team members, stakeholders, and vendors to track data changes. Assesses and communicates potential downstream ramifications of data changes or issues.
Gains customer insights into data quality pain points, challenges, and needs. Empathizes with and advocates for the customer point of view when identifying priorities and presenting solutions. Builds and maintains effective customer relationships by providing timely follow up and developing innovative and optimal data quality solutions.
Analyzes and assesses the data quality of the various data environments (transactional, data marts, master data, etc.). Performs root cause analysis of data quality problems and develops solutions for resolution and prevention. Engages with data owners and subject matter experts.
Create actionable Data Quality plans to improve the quality and value of USC information assets. Builds, manages and prioritizes a portfolio of data quality requests based on issues and analyses gathered from data owner, users and IT groups.
Designs, develops, tests, implements and documents the data quality procedures and their outputs, using data quality tools such as Dataflux or Informatica DQ.
Creates stored procedures, functions, packages, database triggers and other database objects using SQL.
Establishes a high level of data quality through rigorous auditing and analysis of data used in the software development lifecycle process. Develops and implements automated data quality monitoring to maintain an ongoing high level of data quality.
Develops data quality scorecards, dash-boards and ad-hoc reporting. Summarizes results of data quality analyses, and presents results in a format adapted to the audience. Uses visualizations tools such as Tableau or other tools to communicate the analyses.
Modernizes our data quality solution by upgrading or migrating existing assets to a new data quality application.
Learns and adapts quickly to new situations, changing priorities, and disruptive technologies. Participates in the innovation and continuous improvement process by leveraging the latest in industry knowledge and taking the initiative to experiment with new ideas and technologies.
Continually develops skills, knowledge, and abilities to maintain currency with new developments in data quality, data integration, and data management.
Contributes to an inclusive environment that values differences by building and maintaining collaborative relationships with team members, peers, and ITS leaders. Actively embodies ITS values and behaviors including accountability, ethics, and best-in-class customer service. Contributes to a culture of trust and transparency by sharing information broadly, openly, and deliberately.
Supports the vision for Enterprise Data and Analytics. Works closely with team members and management to implement and support effective solutions for integrations. Maintains currency with technology, standards, and best practices. Supports process improvement efforts within the team and across ITS.
Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any time.
Come join the USC ITS team and work as a trusted partner in shaping an environment of innovation and excellence.
Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree. Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education. Minimum Experience: 2 years
