The University of Southern California (USC) is currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst – Academic Technologies to join our Application Services team within the Information Technology Services (ITS) department. The Senior Business Analyst for Academic Technologies (AT) supports the University's ongoing critical academic operations, including admissions, advisement, financial aid, orientation, course registration, grading, student billing and other academic progress and support services. This position also contributes to redesigning several core student applications.
The specific role and support functions include:
Configuring and maintaining application functions for USC's academic tools and ensuring they align with student needs and business objectives
Recommending business process improvements and solutions, focusing on data management
Delivering business requirements, scope matrices, use cases, future state plans, and UAT plans.
Academic applications supported by the Senior Business Analyst for Academic Technologies (AT)
include:
Student Information System (SIS)
Web Registration
Grading and Roster System
OASIS (On-line Academic Student Information System)
DexFlow
Document Management System
ESD Image Viewer
Online Financial Aid Forms
Cvent
Commencement Book
College Financing Plan
Degree Audit Reporting System
Financial Aid Summary & Tasks
Flywire
Scholarship Universe
Syllabus Updater
Slate
Liaison
THE TEAM
The ITS vision aligns strategy, business, and services; affirms ITS cultural values; empowers cross-functional teamwork; embraces world-class best practices; and promotes innovation, excellence, agility, and efficiency. To achieve this vision, ITS is committed to providing a modern technology infrastructure that is resilient and delivers the performance necessary to meet the demands of a growing customer base, training in the latest technologies for its highly productive and motivated workforce, outstanding customer experience, and technology services that are aligned with the university’s mission to provide exceptional learning opportunities for students. ITS is creating a workplace where employees can develop cutting-edge skills, take pride in the services they provide, and have access to the roles and career paths that align to their abilities and potential.
We are looking for top talent to join us on our journey.
ITS CULTURE
USC’s ITS organization represents a diverse and talented team, committed to supporting a collaborative culture and delivering secure and innovative IT services, core to the mission of USC. ITS values accountability, excellence, and commitment to exceptional customer experience. ITS strives for a supportive and inclusive culture that encourages employees to do their best work every day and where individuals are recognized and celebrated for their contributions.
ABOUT USC
USC is the leading private research university in Los Angeles—a global center for arts, technology, and international business. With more than 47,500 students, we are located primarily in Los Angeles but also in various US and global satellite locations. As the largest private employer in Los Angeles, responsible for $8 billion annually in economic activity in the region, we offer the opportunity to work in a dynamic and diverse environment, in careers that span a broad spectrum of talents and skills across a variety of academic and professional schools and administrative units. As a USC employee and member of the Trojan Family—the faculty, staff, students, and alumni who make USC a great place to work—you will enjoy excellent benefits, including a variety of well-being programs designed to help individuals achieve work-life balance.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
The candidate for the position of Senior Business Analyst (AT) must meet the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, computer science, computer information systems, etc., or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
5 years of experience in one of the following fields: business analysis, information technology, or product design
Deep familiarity with higher education business functions and processes including financial aid, course registration, enrollment, admissions, student billing, curriculum and catalog management, etc.
Experience driving functional design for applications such as student information systems, learning management systems, or other similar enterprise software applications in a higher education or federated environment.
Proven ability to facilitate collaboration across a broad audience of stakeholders and drive consensus in alignment with university policies, processes, and procedures.
Ability to provide strategies and recommendations based on design and development methodologies.
Ability to leverage lessons learned from past experiences to drive the continuous improvement of application and business process solutions.
Proven record of delivering end-to-end, user-centered products by considering stakeholder requirements, user research, market analysis, data, customer feedback, and technical constraints or opportunities.
Experience leading requirement gathering interviews or sessions.
Proven ability to measure the results of user-centered products.
Experience developing test strategies and plans using widely accepted test methodologies or frameworks.
Experience operating with Lean and/or Agile methodologies.
Experience utilizing analytics tools to measure success, present opportunities, and support decision-making.
Experience presenting technical topics in a business-oriented fashion to non-technical audiences.
Proven experience establishing strong working relationships with a wide range of team members and clients.
Proven ability to make efficient, logical decisions in a rapidly changing environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including demonstrated effective functional documentation skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent time management and prioritization abilities.
Understanding of computer programming concepts such as the software development lifecycle.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and applications
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
The ideal candidate for the position of Senior Business Analyst (AT) meets the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business administration, computer science, computer information systems, etc.
More than eight years of experience in one of the following fields: information technology, product design, or business analysis.
Experience with UniVerse or Student Information System
Experience in higher education
THE WORK YOU WILL DO
The Senior Business Analyst (AT) leads planning, design, and conception of functionality for university applications. Owns requirements, conceptualizes designs, and influences future-state business processes in support of core organizational functions for the university. Leads collaborative efforts across a broad range of business partners and stakeholders, including students, faculty, and staff. Effectively documents current and future-state processes, tests the effectiveness of developed solutions, and enables the adoption of new business processes through training support and documentation.
Job Accountabilities:
The Senior Business Analyst (AT):
Leads planning, design, and conception of university applications’ functionality. Owns requirements, conceptualizes designs, and influences future-state business processes in support of core organizational functions for the university. Communicates and presents recommended improvements and solutions to business processes and decision-making rationale. Delivers engaging experiences that balance customer needs, business goals, and technical realities by working collaboratively across the organization, with fellow analysts and others (e.g., user experience researchers, product managers, designers, developers)
Builds and delivers design solutions that meet customer needs and expectations. Leads user research efforts to gain understanding of customer and stakeholder pain points, challenges, and needs
Maintains currency on emerging technologies and approaches, leveraging the latest industry knowledge to drive innovation and continuous improvement for the organization. Seek opportunities for innovation and maximizing system functionality by continually developing skills, knowledge, and abilities
Delivers high-quality project analysis documentation (e.g. business requirements, scope matrices, use cases, future state proposals, user acceptance technology [UAT] plans). Actively mitigates risk by owning tasks, resources, and changes. Enables the release management process by anticipating risks and providing strategic recommendations for releases
Leads collaborative engagement efforts with a broad range of business partners and stakeholders, including students, faculty, and staff, to productively and comprehensively solve issues. Utilizes leading practices to effectively anticipate, prioritize, analyze, and articulate problems, evaluate and document problem alternatives, manage constraints, and suggest interim and long-term solutions
Aids the cultivation of an inclusive environment and a culture of trust and transparency, sharing information broadly, openly, and deliberately. Builds and maintains collaborative relationships with diverse groups of peers, team members, and leadership. Actively embodies ITS values and behaviors (e.g., accountability, ethics, best-in-class customer service)
Collaborates with team members and management, implementing effective solutions to support the Product Strategy and Design department’s vision. Maintains currency with technology, standards, and best practices. Supports process improvement efforts within the team and across the ITS organization
Develops Human Centered Design (HCD) processes and approaches to deliver a broad range of sustainable solutions. Engages in standard business analysis methodology, outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions, and identifies process-improvement efforts across the organization
Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any time
Come join the USC ITS team and work as a trusted partner in shaping an environment of innovation and excellence.
Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree. Combined experience/education as substitute for minimum education Minimum Experience: 5 years

Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. seeks a Senior Data Analyst, FCRA for the FCRA Participations department.

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing large sets of financial and operational data in support of FCRA, utilizing a broad range of tools and techniques to communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences alike. This includes mapping and cleansing large and complex sets of data, which will often require extensive research and follow-up with subject matter experts. The Analyst is also responsible for supporting the operations, testing, and in some cases re-platforming of existing Excel and VBA-based tools leveraging data analytics solutions such as Tableau.

The Analyst should have experience with consulting or like organizations demonstrating the ability to enable process transformation through analytics. The candidate must have exemplary Excel skills and be able to fully leverage all features of the application including, but not limited to, large data set manipulation, complex formula creation and expert proficiency with the Visual Basic for Applications language that supports Excel.

The Daily

Become a Subject Matter Expert for these tools and participate in projects associated with upgrades or implementations. Be involved in the process to select additional business led tools for use within FCRA. 20%

The Essentials

Minimum 3 years of work experience in data analysis, analytics and data visualization. Work experience in a large corporate environment is required. Entertainment industry experience is strongly preferred.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent is preferredAdvanced knowledge of Excel is required including Visual Basic for ApplicationsExperience working with Power BI and/or TableauMust have the ability to structure large quantities of data, resolve discrepancies and drive to deliver data driven answers.Strong analytical, planning and organizational skills are required.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to craft compelling messages in visual formats describing data trends and issues.Needs to be a self-motivated individual.Ability to handle multiple tasks effectively.Must be a team player with good interpersonal skills

description:
OVERVIEW:

The Marketing Analyst provides insights and analysis to power data-driven decision-making for the Marketing team related to how, where and when we invest our marketing dollars. The role will create reporting that provides insights and information used to develop and measure marketing campaigns. The position will report to the Sr. Manager, Marketing Analytics and will also collaborate with the Business Intelligence team and other key stakeholders to develop process improvements for data management and collection.

TEAM OVERVIEW:

The Marketing Analytics team is a dynamic, data driven group which drives all metric planning, analysis, reporting, and optimization efforts across the marketing organization. We produce customer lifetime value data models that assist the department in making better acquisition decisions. We also work across the organization to coordinate and prioritize marketing initiatives with Development and Business Intelligence teams.

COMPANY PERKS:

Competitive pay, 401k with company match, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, 3-week vacation accrual, Educational Reimbursement, Commuter benefits, Discount programs, Inventor patent bonuses.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Stamps.com, Endicia® electronic postage solutions make it easier and more affordable to ship parcels through the U.S. Postal Service®. Our solutions have helped thousands of businesses print more than $14 billion in postage. As a long-time, trusted partner of the U.S. Postal Service, we've built our reputation on our commitment to simplifying, improving, and enhancing the shipping process for our customers. That's what we call “innovation with purpose.”

Stamps.com offers solutions that help businesses run their shipping operations more smoothly and function more successfully under the brand names Stamps.com, Endicia®, ShipStation®, ShippingEasy®, ShipWorks®, and MetaPack®. Stamps.com’s family of brands provides seamless access to mailing and shipping services through integrations with more than 475 unique partner applications.

Primary Objectives:

Support day-to-day marketing activities
Monthly Reporting
Marketing Analytics and Data Management

Essential Position Duties:

Support day-to-day marketing activities
Generating marketing reports,
Performing data analysis,
Assisting with project coordination
Monthly Reporting
Build dashboards and monthly reports, presenting key insights and ensuring data driven actions to improve the business
Marketing Analytics and Data Management
Design and execute custom analysis of customer behavior and usage patterns, including account activation, print behavior, attrition, retention and customer lifetime value
Master large data sets with SQL and Tableau
Manage multiple data sources and perform data management and data cleansing processes
Analyze results and prepare reports and presentations detailing recommendations for action to senior management
Be a thought leader and provide creative solutions to comprehensively analyze campaigns and business performance
Seek out improvements in current internal reporting and performance monitoring to drive more accuracy, better insights, and more streamlined processes

Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. The Job

Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. seeks a Sr. Data Analyst, Market Research for the Global Insights and Analytics department.

Responsible for the preparation and reporting of global market research projects for all theatrical titles, with a focus on analyzing incoming data based on sample research, and sources derived from machine learning.

The Daily
Collaborate with data scientists at contracted vendors to receive and review data files.
Ensure proper data weighting is in place to reflect sample consistency across tests conducted on our film slate.
Develop models which spot key performance indicators, which can be applied to aiding early forecasting of the return on investment across our film slate.
Design, build, and maintain normative databases on our film slate, and save core documents in our shared file system for easy access.
Search for, and report, marketplace trends which may have bearing on our current and future business operations.
Assist with the design and development of questionnaires (e.g. reviewing coding logic), and provide norms to establish benchmarks using internal historical databases.
Take the totality of learnings and build visualizations to synthesize the information.
Collaborate with other business units in the organization on broad-based research projects which may have applicability to our film slate.
Transcribe focus groups feedback and read completed questionnaires to assist with analysis of key findings, which may be disseminated to production, filmmakers, marketing, and distribution personnel.

Responsible for negotiating costs from research vendors on projects, and work with finance and internal accounting to ensure available funding. Receive work orders with sample specifications and costs for submission.
Monitor consumer and critical feedback, including referencing online sources, as well as vendors maintaining panels and reviewing moviegoer club memberships, to see how findings from those outlets (e.g. audience composition) are similar or different from what was reported in research testing.
Confer with management on the development of brand equity studies to better measure affinity for titles with ingoing familiarity thru a prior movie, TV show, book, game, news event, etc.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

The Essentials

3-5 years employment with focused concentration on conducting, analyzing and reporting survey market research studies preferred, either at a full-service research supplier or in a market research department at a client company.
Statistics, big data business analytics, engineering, computer science & technology experience preferred.
Bachelors degree or higher in related field required, including Marketing, Marketing Research, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, etc.
Must have a strong foundation in both quantitative statistics and qualitative research.
Must have proficiency with numbers and data processing programs (SPSS and/or PSPP)
Must have understanding of API’s (Application Programming Interface)
Must have advanced Excel knowledge – specifically building and maintaining macros.
Experience with reading and interpreting digital research analytics is preferred.
Must have working knowledge of market research fundamentals and processes.
Must have Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint.
Must have strong writing skills and the ability to take data and put it into words in a manner that is easily understood.
Must have strong oral communication skills and must be able to speak to the research by phone, within a conference room, etc.
Must enjoy movies; have a passion for them!
The Perks
Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
Access to in-house learning and development resources
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Lexer is the Customer Data Platform of choice for amazing retail and consumer brands like RipCurl, Supergoop!, Igloo and Sur La Table. With offices in Melbourne, Sydney, Los Angeles and New York we have enjoyed significant growth over the past 3 years. Backed by Blackbird Ventures and King River Capital we have recently closed our Series B funding and have plans to double our team over the next 12 months.

We are seeking a data-loving and creative thinker to join our fast growth team as an Insights Analyst to ensure the successful implementation and execution of our customers' program of work. From onboarding and training, through to advice and renewal, the Business Analyst is a true and valued partner in helping our Success team and customers achieve success through actionable insights to drive marketing decisions.

You're a good fit if:
You are ambitious and enjoy proactively digging into data to identify new opportunities to drive insights & revenue across multiple customers and likes working with diverse business scenarios.
You are comfortable launching new projects and getting buy-in from other teams.
You are curious and always asking why when analyzing data to identify the cause of insights & trends to help guide recommendations and flexible when a hypothesis or finding may change as a result.
You are passionate and love to discover new things and able to learn quickly in a quickly evolving market.
You consultative and comfortable working directly with customers to ask questions, gather requirements and create a project brief for insights.
You are creative and like to design unique and innovative approaches & visualizations for customer deliverables, doesn't assume a one-size fits all template to everything.
You are a flexible, fast learner who thrives in a constantly-changing work environment and are committed to continuously improving yourself and help those around you
You are a multi-tasker that can manage priorities.
Essential Duties May Include:
Within the first 30 days and ongoing:
Begin to learn the internal organization and processes – who are the owners of specific areas, what are their roles and establish how to best communicate with them.
Attend daily stand-up meetings with the USA team and Solutions team in AUS to review current projects and provide status updates.
Partner with the Data Analyst and Solutions team to learn data processes and become familiar with the current process for creating insight presentations and reporting requests.
Shadow the Success Directors to listen to customer calls/WIPs to listen to insight presentations and understand typical customer activities.
Practice using the Lexer CDP to understand common customer datasets and use cases.
Gain access to Lexer data and securely perform basic analysis on customer, transaction, behavioral and demographic datasets using Python, R, SQL or similar analysis tools and languages.
Access and understand the github library of data tools for various standardized analysis types.
3 months:
Learn how to use & interpret metrics from the Lexer CDP and database to answer common customer questions.
Understand the strategic briefs for customer insights presentations and custom insight requests from the Success team.
Begin to take on ad-hoc insight requests from customers.
Partner with Success Directors to create strategic dashboards and other analyses & reporting for customers.
Produce a retail insights report with autonomy, complete with collaborative feedback implementation.
Develop understanding of insights driven marketing techniques to implement into client use-cases and recommendations.
6-9 months:
Create the strategic briefs for customer insights presentations and custom insight requests for the Solutions team.
Create regular insights for key customers to drive engagement and measurable outcomes.
Communicate insights and recommendations through clear visualizations and presentations.
Create bespoke analysis pieces for clients on multivariate and categorical data sets.
12+ months:
Partner with Success/Strategy Director to identify key customers for upsell opportunities to create a growth plan to increase average ARR by 10%.
Implement improvements to current approach for insight presentations.
Work with the Product team to help drive new innovations for tracking & reporting in the CDP.
Help maintain/increase Customer Success NPS and satisfaction metrics through increased engagement and measured outcomes.
Essential Skills and Experience Needed:
Degree: Bachelor or Master's Degree (Applied Math, Economics, Statistics, Analytics, Management/Business Information Systems (or related degree)
Experience: 3+ years experience
Industry: Customer-facing in Retail or related industry or services based industry (Marketing, Advertising, Martech, Analytics) and looking for an opportunity to use data to help improve our customers' marketing strategies
Geography: Los Angeles
Knowledge: Programming and data analysis language, such as Python, R, SQL, etc with a strong quantitative mindset along with strong communications skills including the ability to deliver a clear story to influence agreement to your recommendations with data & insights

For more information on life at Lexer, check out our website: https://lexer.io/work-at-lexer/

#ZR
Lexer helps brands and retailers drive incremental sales.

We do this by providing data, software and services that deliver an enriched customer view and all the tools required to genuinely understand and engage with customers at every stage of their journey, online and offline.
With extensive, cross-functional experience in retail, technology, and advertising, our team has the talent and insight to build innovative products and provide exceptional service with a human touch.

We value team members who are:

 Sharp
️ Dependable
 Proactive
 High-value
❤️ Caring
‍ Playful

We are a private Australian founded company with a team of 80+ across Melbourne, Sydney, Los Angeles, and New York, working with about 150 brands in Australia, Asia and the USA.

We're growing fast, so reach out soon to join our values-driven, life-friendly team for the opportunity to do your best work.

The Joybird marketing teams are responsible for driving multi-million dollar campaigns aimed at growing our business by leveraging a variety of channels – paid media, social, SEM/SEO, display, direct mail, etc. – this team collaborates with other marketing team members, data scientists, merchandising, and creative team to deliver the best customer experience.


As a Business Analyst on that team, you will deliver actionable insights on customer experience, sales and marketing analytics to help meet intense return on investment goals. Provide recommendations on budget, campaign execution, and revenue growth, you are uniquely positioned to operate in our fast-paced environment to make a significant and tangible impact.

At their core, our Business Analysts are strong in both quantitative and qualitative analyses, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they can have an immediate impact on critical business decisions. Business Analysts are strong communicators who are eager to learn, endlessly curious, take pride in hard work, and are committed to rapidly advancing their careers.

The Analysts can see their future in many different departments across Joybird. This is also a great launching point in the eCommerce space and more for those interested in business development, corporate strategy, or management.

You have the analytical firepower to take advantage of rich data and answer important questions.
What You'll Do:

Analyze and collaborate cross-functionally to optimize sales across customer experience, wholesale and retail providing research and recommendations to key decision-makers.
Develop reports to help operators stay nimble and make strategy recommendations to inform major product and operational decisions.
Work with analytics leads and cross-functional teams to champion a hypothesis-driven culture that rapidly tests, measures and iterates. This might include testing customer feedback channels, UX design changes and campaign setups.
Contribute to the analytics toolkit through iterating on analysis methodology and acting cross functionally to generalize frameworks
Create output that tells the story behind the data to non-technical team members so they can execute more effectively.
Develop strategy for priority initiatives and lead implementation to drive step change improvements in performance.
Analyze marketing campaign performance, identify trends, and facilitate opportunities for improvement.
Closely monitor marketing campaign performance daily and react to deviations from plan quickly and strategically
Cultivate and strengthen relationships with external partners and vendors
Institute rigorous test-and-learn methodology to achieve desired results

 Who You Are:

BA/BS with strong academic record
2-4 years of experience in a quantitative role or as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Management Consultant, preferably at an e-commerce brand with a high volume of complex data
Expert with Excel, SQL knowledge a plus
Strong written and verbal communication
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems
Experience with visualization (e.g. Looker, Tableau)
Working knowledge of statistics a plus
Positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude
Highly motivated self-starter.
Flexible, adaptable, able to work in an entrepreneurial environment

Our Core Values:

Customer-centric — You are passionate about delivering an end-to-end WOW experience for every customer.
Transparent — You exchange information and feedback frequently to strengthen relationships, ensure alignment, and elevate problem solving.
Results-driven — You aim high and go beyond tradition and standards to reach our goals.
Constantly evolving — You're never satisfied and are unafraid to be a better version of yourself.

Perks:

Competitive salary
Generous benefits including medical, dental, vision, FSA, 401(K) with an abbreviated waiting period
Ample Paid Time Off
Fully stocked pantry with your choice of snacks and drinks
Furniture discounts (for friends and family too!)

SUMMARY
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance Analytics team to support the design, build and testing of business forecasting and reporting. This role requires acute attention to detail, a strong sense of accountability, collaboration skills, and extensive hands-on experience with reporting and communicating data. You will be working on data analysis, KPI definitions, data investigations and the delivery of organized insights and ideas for rapid and clear communication.
The Finance Analytics function masters data analysis, advanced reporting, data modeling and visualizations that serve the dual purpose of analytically supporting the Disney Streaming Finance organization and delivering fact-based actionable recommendations. Through the creation of forecasting, LTV, and ARPU models, this team leads the analytical support for various business decisions. Finance, Product, Marketing, Engineering and Data Science teams will be your partners to execute on innovative methods and best-in-class practices that power all of our improvements.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Create, deliver, and continuously improve our business measurement solutions
Partner closely with finance stakeholders to identify and unlock opportunities to better forecast and report on business performance
Manage forecasting, Lifetime Value (LTV), and ARPU modeling and development in collaboration with Data Science teams
Understand the systems and business processes that populate critical systems with data
Work with stakeholders to outline and define data definitions and apply appropriate usage
Analyze and report key data quality health KPIs through regular metric monitoring and revise as needed as the number of datasets and critical systems expand
Translate complex reporting needs into technical specifications, including calculations, custom groups, parameters, filtering criteria and/or aggregations
Analyze subscriber and behavior data to identify patterns, uncover opportunities, and create common understanding of how people are interacting with the platform and content
Build forecasting tools and automate reports and dashboards that provide insights into business measurement and effectiveness
Build intuitive presentations, interfaces, infographics and visualizations to tell stories with data
Provide ongoing reporting and analysis to inform and support business, product, and marketing decisions
WHAT YOU'LL BRING
4+ years of hands-on analytical work experience with SQL and/or Python
Expert proficiency in conducting analysis using SQL
Experience with Lifetime Value (LTV) modeling and business performance forecasting and comfortable working in collaboration with Engineering and Data Science teams
High familiarity with data platforms and applications such as Databricks, Jupyter, Snowflake, Redshift, Airflow
Expertise manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendations
Strong experience in documenting the data requirements, data strategy, data rules (standardization, cleanse, and validation)
Perform root-cause analysis to identify patterns in financial and customer data sets, including subscriber acquisition and retention metrics
Strong analytical and technical skills to troubleshoot issues, analyze the cause, quickly come-up with the possible solutions, document the changes, and communicate organizational impact
Ability to evaluate risks and provide recommendations in a timely manner
Explain data anomalies, develop data visualizations and reporting to drive key messaging and recommendations
Familiarity with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau or Looker
Ability to think strategically, analyze and interpret market and consumer information
NICE-TO-HAVES
Experience in the streaming media industry or other subscription-based service
Experience in the technology industry, knowledge of data products
Python experience writing, managing, and deploying code
BA or BS in a quantitative field (Business, Math/Statistics, Economics, CS, Engineering, or similar) is desired

Endpoint
Real estate is the largest asset class in the world—and yet it has also been one of the slowest to adopt innovative, new technologies. It has become increasingly important for the industry to evolve alongside a consumer-base who are accustomed to mobile-first, on-demand, and personalized experiences in every area of their lives. Founded in 2018, Endpoint emerged from a collaboration between First American and BCG Digital Ventures, the venture capital arm of the Boston Consulting Group. The new company combines First American’s title and settlement expertise, with the innovative approach of an agile technology company, to provide a seamless real estate closing from start to finish. At Endpoint, we believe the combination of modern technology, a standardized and simplified closing process, and a highly dedicated team of people will completely change the industry – and deliver an experience that instills the joy of an effortless close for all.
Endpoint is looking for an ambitious Senior Data Insights Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team. As a key member of the team, you will collaborate with Product, Operations, Revenue, and Business Development teams to draw insights from our data and provide business recommendations. Along with demonstrating technical and analytical skills, you will manage stakeholders across the organization to drive consensus.
We are open to remote candidates for this role
As a Senior Data Insights Analyst, you will use your skills to:
Deliver real-time insights that enable our stakeholders to make strategic and data-driven decisions
Develop the full life-cycle of data at Endpoint from ambiguous and non-traditional data sources
Conduct rigorous, fact-based analysis to advise senior management on critical business recommendations
Scope and develop scalable analytical frameworks, roadmaps, and metrics for the team and the broader organization
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans to actionable items
Apply statistical knowledge and data modeling to drive business objectives
Partner with stakeholders on ad-hoc analysis and reportingBe an owner of data at Endpoint
You’ll come to Endpoint with:
5+ years in analytics or relevant experience
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Experience with Python/R, including knowledge of Shiny/Plotly dashboard development preferred
Demonstrably advanced analytical skills with a desire to tackle complex and ambiguous problems
Experience leveraging a business intelligence platform (e.g. Tableau)
Comfortable working with limited resources or information in a fast-paced startup culture
Familiarity with unstructured data warehouses (Redshift, Dynamo)
Bachelor's degree in a technical field - mathematics, economics, statistics or similar is a plus
Why work at Endpoint:
You will have a lot of responsibility and many opportunities to advance your career
You will get first-hand experience of working for a well funded early stage startup
Your hard work, ownership, and self-sustainability will be greatly valued
We offer great benefits - Health, Dental and Vision, 401K match
Dog-friendly office, fully-stocked snack bar and weekly catered lunches
Ability to mold your career and make an immediate direct impact.
Competitive compensation, including a Long Term Incentive Plan

Company Description
Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a smartphone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Terminal, Square Appointments, Square Online Store, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description
The Marketing Analytics team at Square is responsible for marketing data, acquisition measurement, and strategy/planning including making recommendations to increase revenue and optimize spend. The Strategy & Planning analyst is a hybrid of traditional jobs in data analytics, strategy and planning, and financial analysis. You will join our team of Marketing Analysts and support our global marketing teams in tracking and optimizing our marketing spend across channels. You will analyze performance, synthesize insights, and develop relevant strategies to scale our marketing investments. You will work with numerous partners, including Marketing, Data Engineering, Finance, Sales operations, and Data science.
You will:
Support strategic company growth, which will include programs such as financial modeling and channel performance measurement
Work with business leaders across Square to develop financial forecasts, work on operational goals, and improve investment spend
Report on metrics for marketing performance and analyze trends and product launches
Partner with Square's Finance team to help measure Marketing's dollar-impact to our P&L
Mine data from databases and use it to predict short-term and long-term trends for making financial and capital reallocation decisions
Perform analysis into specific marketing channels to understand the conversion funnel and its underlying drivers and provide optimization recommendations
Develop performance indicators and benchmarks, communicate trends and analyze unexpected variances
Work with channel partners on marketing performance analysis to inform investment decisions

Qualifications
You have:
2+ years of experience working in analytics, finance, management consulting, marketing, or business
Good knowledge of relational databases and Analytics tools
Experience working with a marketing department with a understanding of marketing strategy
Comfort working with large datasets and solving ambiguous problems
Experience writing and presenting to partners - particularly when explaining technical matters to less technical partners and vice versa
Creativity in developing relevant analysis and recommendations
Comfort working in an organization with multiple team members across time zones

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

Square, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) builds tools to empower businesses and individuals to participate in the economy. Sellers use Square to reach buyers online and in person, manage their business, and access financing. Individuals use Cash App to spend, send, store, and invest money. And TIDAL is a global music and entertainment platform that expands Square's purpose of economic empowerment to artists. Square, Inc. has offices in the United States, Canada, Japan, Australia, Ireland, Spain, Norway, and the UK.

Are you an ambitious Analyst looking for exciting challenges in the sales analytics area? Would you love the opportunity to master and use new technologies while supporting different sales channels – Ecommerce, B2B, Retail, etc? Does the prospect of becoming a modern Analyst equipped with a full digital skillset inspire you?
This Senior Sales Data Analyst position provides a great opportunity to gain valuable experience at Dermalogica, a member of the Unilever Prestige division that consists of nine companies worldwide: Dermalogica, Murad, Kate Somerville, Ren, Living Proof, Hourglass, Garancia, Tatcha and most recently Paula's Choice, which was acquired in June 2021. Six of these companies are based in the Los Angeles area, along with Dollar Shave Club, another Unilever subsidiary.
Dermalogica is a global brand in over 100 countries and is known worldwide as skin therapists’ premiere choice, offering the world’s most respected professional skincare line.
This is a great opportunity to join a growing and thriving Analyst community at Dermalogica and Unilever Prestige division, an exciting and supportive learning environment with future career opportunities.
This role is currently remote but will be based in our headquarters in Carson, California when we return to the office. The successful applicant will generate performance-enhancing insights both through disseminating quality analytics across the business and through diving deep into key topics. This position will empower people across the business with information, and will also support our entrepreneurial culture through the building, testing and iterating of hypotheses. To do this, we need people with analytical expertise and the motivation to apply it to prestige skin care.
Our analytics agenda is moving at pace and this role is key to maintaining our status of industry leader. We have work to do to: establishing a standard data model within a future-proofed environment; continuing to develop Business Analytics tools across chosen software (Tableau/Power BI); and building analytical skills across the business.
The right person for this role will demonstrate a passion and curiosity for identifying and interpreting trends within complex datasets in order to deliver actionable insights. She/he will have the right analytical mindset, enjoy problem solving, and understand how to ask the right questions to deliver solution-focused outcomes.
The candidate will be exposed to new technological software in this department, such as BI platforms like Tableau and Power BI, ETL solutions like Alteryx and machine learning.
This role reports through the finance function to the Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Manager but is broader in scope than simply financial/sales analytics.

Key Accountabilities:
Business partnering with different audiences will be a key function of this role. The Senior Analyst will be expected to support the sales and management teams.
Synthesize data and focus on key, relevant business insights. Effectively communicate insights and recommendations that contribute to the development of business-driving strategies.
Lead weekly calls with key members of the sales team to review their territories and ensure that key drivers and emerging trends are understood, and that there is full transparency of gaps to target (sales performance, innovation penetration, inventory levels, promotional impacts, etc.)
Ensure the different corporate departments have the standard analytical tools to be self-sufficient in performance management.
Embed user-friendly analytical tools for the teams, including monitoring usage, shutting off what is not used, and having all workbooks accessible to the users in the proper formats.
Review current distribution of reports in Excel and determine what can be simplified/automated in Tableau/Power BI.

Competencies:
Proactive self-starter who can seek out opportunities to improve on the status quo
Ability to influence senior stakeholders and constructively challenge current thinking
High-level analytical ability to turn complex problems into simple plans
Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences
Flexibility and adaptability; embraces working on a wide variety of initiatives
Curiosity and interest in emerging technologies, systems, and tools
Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Data Science, Data Analytics, or other related field required
Previous analytical experience is required
Strong leadership skills (planning, communication, relationship building, influencing)
Knowledge of SQL, Tableau or Power BI, and Excel required. Any additional business intelligence/ETL tools or programming knowledge is a plus.

ProcurementIQ, a division of IBISWorld, is the leading procurement research company in the US, helping procurement professionals understand the most important factors of a product or service when making purchasing decisions. Procurement is the fastest growing internal department in corporate America and ProcurementIQ is proud to be a vanguard of this movement. And we are just getting started. ProcurementIQ was established in Los Angeles in 2013. Originally called IBISWorld Procurement, ProcurementIQ is home to more than 400 employees across five international offices in some of the greatest cities in the world, including Los Angeles, New York, London, Melbourne and Frankfurt.

JOB DESCRIPTION

We are looking for business research analysts to join our West Los Angeles office. This role provides a phenomenal opportunity to launch your career and to apply your research and analytical abilities, as well as your business knowledge, and writing skills. You will conduct secondary research about various products and services, capture and analyze data about markets and supply chains in the US, and pull together your findings and conclusions into written reports.

Responsibilities:

Research market and product news and trends in order to write and update a variety of reports on deadline and in accordance with in-house editorial standards.
Collect and interpret pricing and financial data related to multiple markets and companies.
Analyze macroeconomic, demographic and supply chain information to identify and clearly communicate key business trends.
Build basic spreadsheet models.
Research and evaluate historical pricing data and trends, then forecast prices and market conditions.
Respond to copyedits and critiques of writing style, data accuracy and logic in reports.
Give interviews to journalists about your assigned reports as required.
Other duties as assigned by manager.

Requirements – Experience:

Bachelor's degree in marketing, business or economics (with a writing background) or bachelor's degree in journalism (with business writing experience) preferred; related experience and degrees considered.
Six months to two years of professional experience in a writing-focused, market research or business analytics role.
Deep understanding of economics, financial terms and marketing concepts.
Basic knowledge of forecasting techniques.
Experience writing business research articles or reports for a business audience.
Experience meeting short deadlines.
Familiarity with online research techniques, economic and financial data sources.

Requirements – Skills and Personal Traits:

Excellent writing skills geared toward business reports; ability to be insightful, objective, interesting and succinct in report writing.
A strong work ethic and good time management.
Ability to think logically and derive conclusions out of qualitative research.
Confidence to stand behind analysis and ability to explain reports to management, clients and the press.
Flexibility to effectively handle unexpected assignments, short deadlines and changes to workload based on management priorities or client requests.
Ability to learn and adapt to proprietary systems and processes.
Openness to constructive criticism and a desire to constantly improve performance.
Strong interest in business and economic news and current events.
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Word.

positionName: Compliance and Fraud Analyst - Credit Union
description:
NOTE: This position will be located in Torrance, CA or Burbank, CA.

We are Farmers!
Join a team of diverse professionals at Farmers to acquire skills on the job and apply your learned knowledge to future roles at Farmers. Farmers Insurance also offers extensive training opportunities through the award winning University of Farmers named by Training magazine amongst top 10 corporate training units in the world.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for analyzing risk, fraud, and compliance trends. Makes recommendations for fraud prevention and detection processes, and takes action to reduce losses due to potentially compromised areas in Credit Union.

Essential Job Functions
Analyzes data and trends to detect fraud. Takes necessary actions and makes recommendations to limit and prevent fault on members accounts.
Takes immediate remediation steps to prevent further losses once a vulnerability has been detected.
Utilizes fraud prevention reports daily to identify fraud, money laundering, potential trends, and to limit losses.
Creates statistical reports on fraud investigation and trends. Develops reports and other data points to inform leadership of fraud trends and potential losses. Actively monitors fraud and compliance forums.
Assists with the management of all Anti-Money Laundering, fraud detection, and financial crimes detection/prevention software and assists in training Credit Union end users as necessary.
Researches regulations and policies pertaining to the Credit Union to ensure practices are compliant with government and industry requirements. Maintains knowledge of rules and regulations governing Financial Crimes Enforcement Network, Remote Deposit Capture, Person-to-Person, and Account to Account, and any other ACH/Electronic transactions.
Works with key stakeholders to implement strategies for new and ongoing compliance initiatives including new/revised government and/or industry regulations.
Assists with Risk Assessments for Compliance and Fraud. Monitors and manages activity within fraud platforms.
Responsible for responding to Rights Requests Forms submissions, under the various state and federally regulated Privacy Laws.
Authenticates the identity/authority of the submitting individual whether member direct or an authorized agent on members’ behalf.
Reviews fraud and suspicious activity for Mobile and Desktop Remote Deposit Capture; deposits and registrations for members.
Assists in the completion and submission of Currency Transaction and Suspicious Activity Reports as required by the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network.
Reviews fraud, suspicious activity, potential instances of identity theft and forgery assisting Branches, Member Services Centers, Shared Branches and ATMs.
Works with Branch personnel to ensure security best practices in the prevention of accepting counterfeit bills, Cashiers and Official Checks and fraudulent Debit and Credit Cards, along with falsified identification.
Monitor deposits to detect trends of potential fraud and kiting patterns to prevent and mitigate Credit Union losses. Analyzes financial crimes, fraud, and compliance trends utilizing all resources possible.
Maintains open dialogue with key stakeholders and the leadership team to recommend and implement fraud preventative measures while ensuring the Credit Union maintains compliant with all applicable laws and regulations.
Researches and stays abreast of the most up-to-date fraud trends along with prevention and compliance tools.
Networks with local law enforcement professionals, Internal Risk Management investigators, compliance specialists and colleagues from financial institutions.
Education Requirements

High School Diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's Degree preferred.

Experience Requirements

2 years' experience in compliance and/or fraud resolution in a financial institution required, preferably a Credit Union. Proven knowledge of Lending guidelines and compliance application/interpretation required.

Special Skill Requirement

Proficiency in MS Office Suite

Physical Environment

This position operates in an open office working environment which will include normal and customary distractions, noise, and interruptions.

Physical Actions

Sits or stands for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Occasionally reaches overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Occasionally moves, lifts, carries, and places objects and supplies weighing 0-10 pounds without assistance. Listens to, interprets, and differentiates auditory information (e.g. others speaking) at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Visually verifies and reads information. Visually locates material, resources and other objects. Ability to continuously operate a computer for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Physical dexterity sufficient to use hands, arms, and shoulders repetitively to operate keyboard and other office equipment up to a full work shift.

Hulu’s Data team is seeking a Senior Data Analyst who will be an outstanding addition to Product & Tech Analytics team. The team partners with other teams across the business to turn data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions that steer the strategic direction of the company. The right person for this role thrives in a fast-pace environment, loves problem-solving and is a good communicator. If you are someone who gains personal happiness from transforming data into knowledge for business insights, then this is a phenomenal role for you.
You will design innovative analytic approaches to test hypotheses, extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data, and develop recommendations to drive business performance. You will be instrumental in leading the use of analytics as a critical value driver across our organization.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Build analysis, data visualizations, and multi-functional reporting that provides critical support to the operations and decision-making of the organization
Advance the analytical capabilities of the business, collaborate in the design of diagnostic solutions, and deliver outstanding data insights and products
Use internal and external analytics and data visualization tools, SQL, and scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate data
Develop and foster positive relationships and transparent dialogue with the business community and data colleagues
Provide analytics expertise to key business partners regarding data & analytics questions, communicating insights to domain experts and executives alike
WHAT TO BRING
Unbridled curiosity, high intellectual and analytical horsepower, and a passionate pursuit of analytics driven insights and business outcomes
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, etc. or equivalent work experience
4+ years of experience as an analyst in a data and analytics domain with excellent SQL, Python, or R skills for complex querying, advanced analysis, performance optimization, and working with data at scale
Demonstrated data visualization skills with tools like Tableau, Looker, QlikView, MicroStrategy, Plotly, etc.
Experience delivering end-to-end analytics projects: taking them from vague requirements, to an impactful story, accessible across diverse audiences, and ultimately to a clear business outcome
Ability to build strong working relationships with teammates, business partners, and technical colleagues
NICE-TO-HAVES
Ability to identify and appropriately call out issues to leadership
Strong motivation and ability to work independently
Outstanding written and oral communication skills

At AccessHope, we're Fighting cancer with everything we know™ by putting the ever-growing body of cancer knowledge to work for the greater good. Through a revolutionary employer health benefits offering, we remotely connect employees with cancer support services from National Cancer Institute (NCI)-Designated Comprehensive Cancer Centers. Instead of requiring those who have been diagnosed with cancer to come to the centers for renowned cancer expertise, AccessHope brings their support to the patient and their local oncologist-wherever they're located-to improve care, outcomes, and value.


Hopeful for those we support, rebellious in our approach, and collaborative by breaking down barriers, AccessHope is seeking a Business Analyst to help us uniquely deploy the latest cancer knowledge to the places it's needed most. As an ideal candidate, you'll support the development, communication and implementation of key operational and strategic initiatives developed by the Leadership team.


This is a Fully Remote Opportunity. Candidate may sit in any of the 48 States But prefer Pacific and Mountain Timezone candidates. Will need to work Pacific Hours


Key Responsibilities include:

Produces analyses and presentations to support strategic and operational decisions and priorities.
Supports the various operational leaders through the day-to-day administrative management of critical activities (i.e., status reports, agenda development, project plans, action item follow-up).
Support project execution through administrative management, including the compilation of status reports, agenda development and action item management.
Supports a multi-disciplinary team by contributing core initiatives such as the Client Lifecycle process, new implementations, operational and technological enhancements, provider relations and outreach.
Provides ancillary support to people resources, provider engagement, and member engagement activities such as staff engagement, human resources analysis, marketing analysis, and provider and member engagement surveys.
Effectively communicates relevant information. Develop power point decks for multiple audiences, including the Executive Leadership Team. Excellent verbal communication skills.
Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully. Works well across all levels of the organization.
Keeps track of action items and follows up to completion.
Practices a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality.
Follows established AccessHope and department policies, procedures, objectives, performance improvement, attendance, safety, guidelines, including adherence to the workplace Code of Conduct and Compliance Plan.
Support other activities under the purview of the Chief of Staff.
Enhances professional growth and development by reviewing current literature, attending educational programs, workshops, and in-services
Collaborates with teammates and utilizes the AccessHope on-line library
Educate internal stakeholders and keep them informed on the most recent policy and process changes
Practice a high level of integrity and honesty in maintaining confidentiality
Embody the team vision.

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, Health and Human Services, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field; experience may substitute for minimum education.
1+ years' related experience in a consulting, healthcare, business operations or similar setting.
Prior experience demonstrating effective written communication and interpersonal communication skills.
Preferably Six Sigma and Lean methodologies

Want to hear something crazy? Cars only spend 5% of their time driving. Where do they spend the other 95%? PARKED!
LAZ Parking is one of the largest and fastest growing parking companies in the country. LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces across the country. When it comes to parking, we’re the experts!
We are also a PEOPLE FIRST company. We often say “parking is our industry but people are our passion.” Our mission is to “create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients”. If you’re looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best – contact us today!
The Spirit of the Position:

The Business Analyst is an integral part of the evolving Technology team at LAZ Parking & reports to the GM of Business Intelligence. This role will be responsible for maximizing value for LAZ Operated Assets within their geographical area. Success in this role will be shown by the ability to be analytical, think outside of the box, and use data to drive decision making. The Regional Business Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the local parking economy and implement yield management strategies to increase revenue and drive value to LAZ and client assets.
Principal Job Duties:
Develop and create dashboards within LAZ Parking’s Business Intelligence platform powered by Microsoft’s PowerBI in concert with the national BI team directed by the General Manager of Business Intelligence.
Develop and implement strategies through quantitative analysis of historical parking supply and demand as well as consumer and competition behavior
Develop a working relationship with subject matter experts in the industry and within our field operations to understand the differences and challenges for each market
Determine ideal pricing for various revenue streams through analysis of consumers’ online purchasing habits.
Partner with distribution channels to ensure opportunities are maximized.
Identify and communicate demand periods (high and low) for which a strategic plan is required and formulate and execute that plan with assistance from the Regional Operations Teams.,
Evaluate the effectiveness of implemented strategies related to revenue management and technology.
Be the key point of contact for Business Intelligence users within their regions and assist with training or technical questions on LAZ’s BI Tool.
Provide reports on a regular schedule through data collection such as:
Average Number of Transient Parkers & Revenue Drivers.
Contract Parker Occupancy and Absenteeism.
Parking Patron Patterns and Trends, etc.
Occupancy Reports and Trends – LAZ locations versus competing locations.
Create and disseminate additional reports as assigned.
Education:
BA / BS degree in a quantitative discipline such as Economics or Mathematics or Computers/Information Systems w/ a focus in data analytics.
Experience:
Experience developing & deploying enterprise-scale reports and dashboards using a BI Application such as Microsoft PowerBI or Tableau.
2+ years of related experience at within the Real Estate, Airline, or Hospitality Industry.
Knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts.
Experience in developing & using DAX Functions.
Skills:
Knowledge of Analytics / BI Applications such as Microsoft PowerBI or Tableau.
Ability to utilize Data Warehouse Technology such as SQL, Non-SQL, and Azure solutions.
Proven analytical skills, including the ability to gather data, analyze and present recommendations.
Leverage understanding of internal and external business processes to identify problems and implement solutions to drive value.
Interest in optimization problem-solving, economic game theory, and consumer buying behavior
Ability to work independently and multi-task.
Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with all levels of the organization.
Demonstrate a sense of urgency and timeliness.
Physical Demands:
Ability to lift, push and pull at least 10 pounds.

Job Summary

The Business Analyst III facilitates business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications. This position manages the requirements development process through the elicitation, analysis, specification and verification of multiple levels of requirements from an end-to-end perspective and supports the ongoing management of the requirements. This position will develop report and analysis for the department. It is responsible in communicating and coordinating with IT on a day-to-day department related efforts. The Business Analyst III will manage and coordinate the implementation and/or integration of products or new features for clients including client training and provides subject matter expertise (SME) and support of the department's inbound and outbound functions. This position will act as mentor to Business Analysts I/ II.

Duties

Develop functional and user acceptance test plans and scenarios. Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by executing the testing strategy, scheduling resources and tracking test performance. Perform data analysis to support evaluation of system defects or to develop requirements for new functionality; assist in various system trouble shooting and balancing and correction efforts including analysis, verification and validation of issues and fixes. Coordinate activities including on-time delivery, testing and production moves.

Collaborate with I.T. on all department related efforts, including submission of Service Requests and writing BRD's. Coordinate related data requests from internal departments, and/or assist I.T. with definition of criteria. Delegate data and reporting requests to business analysts. Facilitate collaborative system and data design sessions with the user community, technical architecture resources and development resources. Preparation of status updates to enterprise for distribution and communication.

Work as a technical support and liaison to designated I.T. personnel to provide testing, support and feedback on enhancement requests and regular updates/releases; adhere to release schedules. Provide analytical support for critical corporate initiatives including business function support for system migrations and consolidations, significant business area process improvement projects and complex product installations.

Demonstrate a high level of subject matter expertise in functional area to bridge business requirements and I.T. solutions; provide technical direction and ensure compliance with best practice solutions. Practice knowledge transfer and foster change management as the organization changes and new skills are required, focusing on team/individual development to be a valued contributor.

Participate and contribute on the development/ creation of data models and interface design specifications. Support internal/ external stakeholder's roadmap and audits as needed.

Oversee the business process support across multiple client engagements. Communication with internal/ external stakeholders for department's submission requirements. Review submission of data against established benchmarks and coordinate correction and improvement efforts. Monitor timely and accurate outbound data submission to state and federal recipients.

Perform other duties as assigned.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Summary

Performs research and analysis of complex healthcare claims data, pharmacy data, and lab data regarding network utilization and cost containment information. Evaluates, writes, and presents healthcare utilization and cost containment reports and makes recommendations based on relevant findings.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES

Develop ad-hoc reports using SQL programming, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Medinsight, RxNavigator, Crystal Reports, Executive Dashboard, and other analytic / programming tools as needed.

Generate and distribute standard reports on schedule using SQL, Excel, and other reporting software.

Create new databases and reporting tools for monitoring, tracking and trending based on project specifications.

Collects and documents report / programming requirements from requestors to ensure appropriate creation of reports and analyses. Uses peer-to-peer review process and end-user consultation to reduce report writing errors and rework.

Responsible for timely completion of projects, including timeline development and maintenance; coordinates activities and data collection with requesting internal departments or external requestors.

Identify and complete report enhancements/fixes; modify reports in response to approved change requests; retain old and new report design for audit trail purposes.

Analyze data sets and trends for anomalies, outliers, trend changes and opportunities, using statistical tools and techniques to determine significance and relevance. Utilize extrapolation, interpolation, and other statistical methodologies to predict future trends in cost, utilization and performance. Provide executive summary of findings to requestors.

Create comprehensive workflows for the production and distribution of assigned reports, document reporting processes and procedures.

Assist with research, development and completion of special projects as requested by various internal departments, or in support of requests from regulatory agencies, contracting agencies, or other external organizations.

Maintains SharePoint Sites as needed.

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science

Required Experience

5-7 years increasingly complex database and data management responsibilities

5-7 years of increasingly complex experience in quantifying, measuring, and analyzing financial/performance management metrics

Demonstrate Healthcare experience in Quantifying, Measuring and Analyzing Financial and Utilization Metrics of Healthcare

Basic knowledge of SQL

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Math, or Computer Science

Preferred Experience

Preferred experience in Medical Economics and Strong Knowledge of Performance Indicators:

Proactively identify and investigate complex suspect areas regarding medical cost issues

Initiate in-depth analysis of the suspect/problem areas and suggest a corrective action plan

Apply investigative skill and analytical methods to look behind the numbers, assess business impacts, and make recommendations through use of healthcare analytics, predictive modeling, etc.

Analysis and forecasting of trends in medical costs to provide analytic support for finance, pricing and actuarial functions

Healthcare Analyst I or Financial/Accounting Analyst I experience desired

Multiple data systems and models

Prime Video is seeking a talented Influencer Marketing Analyst to track and optimize influencer marketing strategy in support of Prime Video and our growing library of Prime Original TV shows and movies. This person will be part of a dedicated group within Prime Video Marketing that maintains relationships with influencers and fans of our series, films and brand. The team works collaboratively with Marketing, PR, Social, Media, Promotions, Events and Partnerships to increase engagement and reach. The Influencer Marketing team leads sourcing and maintaining an ‘always-on’ relationship with influencer talent. We are seeking an experienced Influencer Marketing Analyst with a genuine passion for movies and TV. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of analyzing influencer performance data to develop insights and strategies, combined with the ability to multi-task and prioritize, plus a passion for testing, learning and making data-driven decisions.

This person will own reporting and success metrics for all of Prime Video’s influencer marketing activities, including both paid and organic. You will partner closely with a team of influencer marketing managers who develop and launch large-scale paid campaigns, as well as manage organic posts and communities. You will also own developing insights and recommendations for influencer marketing campaigns based on your analysis. You will be an active and vocal partner and participate in day-to-day decision-making, as well as long-term strategic planning. You will also work closely with Amazon’s internal insights and data science teams to identify opportunities to leverage new targeting, segmentation and measurement technology in Prime Video’s influencer activities. You will work with key influencer marketing tracking platforms, as well as seek out and develop new and emerging measurement methods that can help us grow our customer base and brand. You will also have the opportunity to contribute to the development of new product features and tools for the influencer marketing team.

Success in this role requires being a self-starter with deep analytical prowess, who can balance both day-to-day activities and longer-term strategic projects. You will need to be entrepreneurial and roll up your sleeves, and relentlessly pursue more sophisticated measurement techniques. Overall, you will be challenged to push boundaries, propose and execute new ideas, and establish best practices for Prime Video.

Be the key point of contact for all things involving influencer marketing measurement

Help determine influencer marketing metric benchmarks and goals
Identify learnings and opportunities to optimize campaigns based on data

Maintain understanding of fundamental digital marketing metrics and how they interact and influence one another
Develop KPI’s and insights both internally and with external partners to benchmark expectations and goals

Ability to learn new measurement techniques and technical platforms quickly

MeUndies is a Los Angeles, CA-based underwear and loungewear company best known for its softer than soft basics. Founded in 2011, MeUndies disrupted the $110B underwear industry when it launched the first online underwear subscription. Through the years the brand has inspired a passionate community of undie-obsessed individuals with its bold, comfortable products.

Today MeUndies has sold more than twenty million pairs of underwear and is profitable with double-digit YoY growth. It continues to redefine the subscription market by evolving the transactional subscription to a membership centered on community and its relationship with the brand.

The innovative direct-to-consumer brand offers multiple purchasing options including singles, packs, matching pairs and its monthly membership. It opened its first flagship store in Los Angeles in 2018.

With a growing company, comes a growing team full of innovative people. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to help build out our next generation data analytics program. You will be hands-on with both a variety of technologies as well as intimately involved with the creation and execution of our data-driven strategies, ranging from customer acquisition all the way through retention. The Senior Data Analyst will report to the Senior Manager of Analytics.

 What You'll Do
Drive best practices around our BI tool, Looker. This includes maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring data quality, gathering requirements from cross-functional teams, building dashboards, and training end-users
Prepare insightful reporting of key e-commerce and membership program metrics and determine drivers of emerging trends
Leverage data to support executive strategic decision-making
Serve as subject matter expert in MeUndies data and liaise between business end-users and data engineering to provide requirements for new data sources
Create predictive statistical modelling for customer acquisition and retention across multiple channels
Develop and maintain web and marketing analytics such as: customer lifecycle marketing, customer lifetime value, customer segmentation, marketing channel attribution and performance, funnel analysis, A/B testing and promotional analysis
Work cross-functionally with the Engineering team to ensure data integrity is maintained, meshing QA processes with the data engineering team
Work with data engineering and the business to become a subject matter expert in data needs and sources to improve and maintain data integrity
Use data to tell compelling stories through BI tools, slides, etc
Monitor performance and deliver insights to key stakeholders; own and report KPIs to budget performance
What You Have

A thorough understanding of business intelligence tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Familiarity with marketing analytics such as channel attribution, ROAS, and CPA
Top notch communication skills - you can easily and clearly communicate with Engineering and Marketing in the same hour
The ability to adapt - you are able to transform complex data sets into simple visuals and dashboards for analytical and non-analytical teammates
A passion for data integrity - you let the numbers define the narrative rather than finding numbers to support a narrative
Technologies

WHY WORK AT MEUNDIES?

It's more than a job.

We have focused on building a team of people that emulates all of our core values. We look for people who stay balanced, go further, build relationships, champion differences, and are humble. At MeUndies, we continue to maintain a stellar brand by working collaboratively and encouraging growth with learning opportunities. Not to mention, there is no such thing as a small achievement here - we celebrate it all!
