We have an office you'll enjoy going to.

While we're remote until January 2022 (and have a flexible work policy beyond that), we still have an inviting office that you're welcome to work from always! Plus, we're dog friendly, so your furry coworker can join you anytime.

We don't forget the most important things.

Job Summary

Responsibilities

Strong critical thinking and attention to detail.

Healthy curiosity, creative thinking, and willingness to learn new tools/platforms.

Strong time management skills to manage simultaneous projects and tasks in order to meet internal deadlines.

Ability to work independently, within a team, and collaboratively across teams.

Since 2012, Rightsline has been making work easier for rights professionals with our innovative rights management software, allowing our customers to maximize their portfolios without having to max out their daily to-do-lists.

Welcome to a world of less data entry and more data integrity. Welcome to the Rightsline reality.

The Position

The Associate Business Analyst role will report directly to the Director of Professional Services. The role will configure, document, and assist in the overall delivery in Rightsline implementations to support the core rights management functions and business processes within Rightsline’s portfolio of clients. This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. The Associate Business Analyst will be the interface between the company and customer for implementations, system activities, and enhancements with guidance from senior members of the Professional Services team. The role will assist in the solution delivery of our Asian Pacific and North American clients and does expect a work schedule overlapping the Asian Pacific time zone.

What you will do:

Evaluate business requirements for applications and systems integration and service activation through interviews and/or existing systems documentation or procedures, while delivering new or modified software systems enhancements and/or integration solutions
Configure and build the Rightsline solution for Rightsline’s Media and Entertainment clients
Contribute to the definition, testing, training, implementation and support of system requirements
Identify and document customer requirements/use cases, test plans, and track the delivery and results of these plans
Test and quality assurance of the Rightsline product and the solutions the Professional Services team delivers in implementations
Proactive in alerting their manager to potential escalations and issues of importance
Provide detailed analysis of processes and workflows with suggestions for improvement using technology or business process enhancements
Build relationships with business users, gain deep understanding of their processes and how they are currently utilizing technology to develop improvements
Engage with internal teams, including, but not limited to Engineering, Product, and QA; to ensure relevant release items or customer initiatives are understood and delivered in a timely fashion
Execute data migration needs where we provide guidance on data cleansing to our clients to better utilize the power of Rightsline
Build ad hoc reports based on customer requirements in our internal reporting tool
Engage with 3rd party technology vendors and system integration partners to ensure smooth integrations and implementations based on contractual work orders
Administer training where required for customers to promote the change management approach of the implementation
Work with colleagues within the Asian Pacific and North American time zones to deliver the Rightsline solution


What you will bring to the role:

1-2 years of consulting, delivery, or business analysis experience for small to large complex and strategic customers focused on cloud and software/service solutions or 2+ years of media and entertainment experience
Experience in delivery of technology solutions with a high degree of customer satisfaction
Demonstrated track record of delivering solutions that lead to increased efficiency and productivity through the use of technology
Experience in various implementation methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, etc.
Developing analytical, data modeling, organizational and presentation skills
Experience reviewing functional requirements, documenting solution design, and configuration of a SaaS/Cloud platform
Experience in the data modeling and Structured Query Language (SQL) is preferred, but not required
Ability to clearly and effectively communicate, both written and verbally, with internal and external audiences
Knowledge and ability in the use of the Microsoft Office or Google Workspace
Experience using collaboration tools such as Confluence, Jira, ASANA etc.
Desire to learn and improve knowledge of market trends and competitive insights
Ability to work in a time-sensitive, deadline driven environment and prioritize accordingly
Ability to make sound judgement and resolve problems with and without supervision
Must be results oriented, customer focused, and team player
Must have a strong sense of ownership/accountability, urgency, and initiative
Analytical and solutions oriented
Certification(s) in the following are not required, but preferred:
Business Analyst: CBAP, PBA, or equivalent Business Analyst certification
Compensation:

Competitive Base Salary
100% Health & Dental Benefits

The Rightsline Advantage

At Rightsline we encourage inclusiveness, purpose and innovation. We offer flexible work hours, birthdays off, monthly wellness allowance, one-time home office allowance, team socials, happy hours and career progression in a high growth environment.

Rightsline was the very 1st cloud-based rights and contract management platform, so we’re used to innovation. We’re also used to incredible growth if you’re into that sort of thing.
You will become part of an amazing culture with a supportive executive team, smart colleagues who truly care, and a global team that’s been rocking this virtual collaboration thing since before anyone had ever heard the term COVID19.
You’ll often hear “Yes, let’s try that!” and then have the chance to execute your ideas.
You will grow more here than you would at any other company. That’s a promise.


Our 5 Stage Recruitment Process

 Review - We review applications and screen based on a variety of criteria
 Phone - Candidates will be screened via a quick 15 minutes phone chat to discuss the role opportunity
 Interview - We will conduct 2-3 stages of interviews via phone, Zoom or in person
Task - Finalists will complete a small task to show off their skills (we pay for your time)
Offer - We will make an offer to the candidate that we feel would excel most in the role.

**Please be advised that only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted, and references will be requested for those candidates selected in the final interview stage.**


Equal Employment Opportunity

Rightsline is an equal opportunity workplace. All candidates will be afforded equal opportunity through the recruiting process. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity and/or expression. We are dedicated to growing a diverse team of highly talented individuals and creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.


If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.


Apply Today

If you want to join a company that strives for a mission, purpose and making an impact, we encourage you to apply today.

description:
Primary City/State:
Phoenix, Arizona
Department Name:
IT Bus Apps Insurance Division
Work Shift:
Day
Job Category:
Information Technology
Primary Location Salary Range:
$26.64/hr - $44.40/hr, based on education & experience
In accordance with Colorado’s EPEWA Equal Pay Transparency Rules.
This can be a remote position if you live in the following states only: AR, AZ, CA, CO, FL, IA, MO, ND, NE, NV, TX, UT, WA, WI, & WY
Within Banner Health Corporate, you will have the opportunity to apply your unique experience and expertise in support of a nationally-recognized healthcare leader. We offer stimulating and rewarding careers in a wide array of disciplines. Whether your background is in Human Resources, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Managed Care Programs or Public Relations, you'll find many options for contributing to our award-winning patient care.
POSITION SUMMARY
This position is responsible for supporting business planning, tactical execution, and business integration of all digital initiatives; inclusive of, but not limited to, web site development, mobile platform and presence, internal application development, content management, self-service adoption, and ongoing maintenance of electronic channels. In addition, this position is responsible for formulating system scope and objectives relative to the company’s requirements as well as establishing system documentation standards and quality assurance methodologies for systems and applications.

CORE FUNCTIONS
1. Develop solutions by applying accepted processes or is able to create new approaches to leverage technology from abstract information.

2. Create project specifications, establish technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs, and develop a general understanding of business requirements to distinguish user requests from underlying business and process needs.

3. Translate emerging customer needs and technologies into actionable business terms and associated plans. Define/document required changes to resolve system deficiencies, and map experiences and requirements back to the external inputs to confirm fit with desired scope and preferences of our customers. Determines and designs end user training and curriculum for applications and systems. Facilitates the initial rollout and ongoing training of the user community.

4. Manage the process of Business Governance and prioritization of all enhancement requests to any and all electronic channels. Assure that the proper business case has been provided and the solution fits with overall strategic direction.

5. Identifies, investigates, tracks, and resolves complex project, system or application errors ensuring the solution is timely and of acceptable quality. Oversee the effective, correct, and consistent application of data analysis and decision making based on fact for all information feeds into the innovation process for the Digital Business Technology team. Promote the use of data analysis and fact based decision-making.

6. Designs and administers complex standards and policies regarding application and end user customer documentation. Ensures that department and company standards are implemented and consistently adhered to.

7. Provides high level expertise to the development of fully integrated testing scenarios. Ensures that the information systems across multiple levels and states and their relationships are considered and are part of the comprehensive testing plans.

8. Maintains current professional and technical knowledge relating to the healthcare industry by attending educational workshops/conferences, establishing personal networks, and/or maintaining relevant certification or licensure as business needs require.

9. Assignments are more complex in nature as more in-depth knowledge is needed. Incumbents are able to develop new perspectives using existing knowledge of best practices. Decisions are made within policies and past precedents. Incumbents are expected to assess requirements and customer needs and identify solutions to non-standard requests. Work is performed in a fast paced multi-tasked environment where there may be conflicting priorities or tight deadlines. The incumbent has decision-making authority for projects and applications and works at peer level across diverse areas and multiple states. The incumbent participates in meetings, presentations, visioning sessions, strategic and planning sessions, implementation activities, and supports functions company-wide.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Must possess a strong technical and business knowledge as typically obtained through the completion of a bachelor's degree related field.

Must demonstrate in-depth knowledge of information technology specifically, user-centered design for mobile/web apps or large, content-rich consumer sites as would normally be obtained in 2-3 years’ work experience in the field. Must demonstrate general knowledge of information technology and healthcare. Needs experience in medium scale project planning and reporting, either individual or team. Requires communication and presentation skills to engage technical and non-technical audiences. Requires ability to communicate and interact across facilities and at various levels. Incumbent will have skills to mentor less experienced team members. As is typical in this industry, variable shifts and hours and carrying/responding to a pager may be required.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Additional related education and/or experience preferred.
DATE APPROVED 03/27/2016

Established in 1997, L.A. Care Health Plan is an independent public agency created by the state of California to provide health coverage to low-income Los Angeles County residents. We are the nation’s largest publicly operated health plan. Serving more than 2 million members in five health plans, we make sure our members get the right care at the right place at the right time.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.

Work with cross functional business partners to understand strategic drivers (administrative costs, costs of care and membership) and align with implementation cycle or Core Transformation initiatives.

positionName: Senior Staff Analyst - Tenancy Supportive Services (Housing For Health)
description:
Salary Range:$8,540.00 per month

PROGRAM SUMMARY

The Los Angeles County Department of Health Services (DHS) is the second largest municipal health system in the nation. DHS operates as an integrated health system, operating 26 health centers and four acute care hospitals, in addition to providing health care to youth in the juvenile justice system and inmates in the LA County jails. Across the network of DHS’ directly operated clinical sites and through partnerships with community-based clinics, DHS cares for about 800,000 unique patients each year, employs over 22,000 staff, and has an annual operating budget of 5 billion.

Housing for Health (HFH) is a program office within Health Services Administration, a division in the DHS. HFH was created in 2013 to address the unique needs and challenges faced by vulnerable people experiencing homelessness to provide flexible funding to community-based organizations. HFH’s Housing and Services team works in partnership with contracted agencies to permanently house people and provide non-time limited services in housing. As such, HFH is a key player and supports many of the Los Angeles County Homeless Initiative recommendations in response to and in support of the County’s effort to address and combat homelessness in the communities residing within Los Angeles County.

The Senior Staff Analyst in the Housing and Services team will be responsible for planning, directing, implementing, monitoring, and providing technical assistance to HFH’s Property Management and Related Tenant Services (PRTS) agreement which operationalizes the Flexible Housing Subsidy Pool (FHSP) Program. The Senior Staff Analyst is responsible for directing and supervising a team of analysts and administrative staff assigned to the Tenancy Supportive Services (TSS) team as part of the Housing and Services unit at HFH.

Desirable qualities of the candidate should include adaptability, flexibility, past supervisory experience, the ability to analyze data and make sound recommendations to executive leadership, decisiveness, a history of delivering results, strong planning skills, excellent interpersonal skills, strong Excel skills, good deductive reasoning skills and intimate knowledge of federal and local subsidy programs and how they interact with supportive services.

Additional duties include the following: directs the development and execution of PRTS and FHSP policies and procedures to ensure all tenant supportive services program components operate efficiently and effectively; formulate and design program operations to improve efficacy and efficiency; manage the coordination of program updates to oversight committees, provide reports to the staff of the Board of Supervisors, work closely with the County’s Chief Executive Office, and other internal and external stakeholders; directs the contract monitoring activities including annual administrative and programmatic monitoring; provides ongoing technical assistance on complex issues to staff, partners, and contracted agencies; represents HFH program on various taskforces and/or committees; directs staff hiring, completing personnel evaluations, providing one on one guidance to staff, orientation, training, work assignments and performance monitoring.

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES

Plans, organizes, assigns, and coordinates the work of staff analysts serving as technical experts and consultants to management in various specialty programs of Health Services.
Has immediate responsibility for the orientations, training, development, and evaluation of employees supervised.
Reviews work for thoroughness, soundness of recommendations, and compliance with the programs standards, policies, procedures and regulations.
Confers with administrators and with all project partners and stakeholders to discuss new and ongoing programs and to exchange information.
Supervises and participates in evaluation of the overall success of the projects and reports findings to project partners and stakeholders.
Supervises and participates in implementation of recommended project modifications.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

One (1) year of highly responsible and complex administrative experience working in (A) a program that provides housing and support services to clients who are homeless or are at risk for homelessness; - OR - (B) Making recommendations for the design and/or implementation of programs to combat homelessness.

 Education/Experience
A Bachelor's* degree or higher from an accredited** college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Community Development, Criminal Justice or a closely related field.

Certificates/Licenses/Clearances

A valid California Class C Driver License or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.
Successful clearing through the Live Scan process with the County of Los Angeles.

Other Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

 Proficient skill set in using an array of Microsoft Office Suite software programs such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Adobe Reader, One Note, Outlook, Publisher, Skype, Outlook, etc.
Able to multi-task and set workload priorities for time sensitive projects/tasks.
Ability to problem solve and make recommendations to processes, policies, etc.
Able to communicate with all levels of personnel, e.g., written, verbal, in a professional and concise/clear manner; ability to work within a project team and/or independently.
Able to work in a very diverse environment and with diverse individuals.
Ability to be flexible in meeting changing work tasks and timelines; must be dependable and reliable.
Experience in managing/supervising staff, knowledge of evidence-based practices in homeless services, knowledge of affordable housing programs that provide housing and support services to clients who are homeless or are at risk for homelessness is highly preferred.

About WestEd
WestEd is a nonpartisan, nonprofit agency that conducts and applies research, develops evidence-based solutions, and provides services and resources in the realms of education, human development, and related fields, with the end goal of improving outcomes and ensuring equity for individuals from infancy through adulthood. WestEd has more than a dozen offices nationwide, from Massachusetts, Georgia, and Washington, DC, to Arizona and California, with headquarters in San Francisco.
Throughout WestEd’s over 50-year history we have maintained a strong commitment to staff diversity. Individuals of different ethnicities, races, abilities, gender identities, and sexual orientations, as well as from different cultural, linguistic, and socioeconomic backgrounds, work at all levels of the organization. We value the range of perspectives provided by this diverse workforce and the ways in which those perspectives enrich and inform our agency and the work we do. Read more about WestEd’s Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion.
WestEd provides a variety of technical assistance and policy support services to public agencies, including ongoing work with the California Health and Human Services Agency (CHHS), the California Department of Education-Early Care and Learning Division (ELCD), First 5 California (F5CA) and others to support the development of an aligned system of high-quality early childhood services and infrastructure across the state. California’s 12-month Preschool Development Grant-Renewal, (PDG-R) will strengthen systems for young children in California through a series of aligned research and development efforts spanning strategic planning and needs assessment, state and local capacity building, enhanced professional development and parent support systems, data system development and integration, and other work. Under contract with CHHS, WestEd is managing the statewide PDG-R effort, ensuring that all necessary data are collected, all reporting requirements met, and all deliverables completed on time and within budgetary constraints. The PDG-R is a complex project involving multiple agencies and levels of government as well as numerous early childhood organizations in California.
Brief Position Description:
This position will directly support CHHS and its partners to effectively implement planning and required business analysis, including data flow mapping, as-is database architecture analysis, and detailed data dictionary development for the CDE and CDSS data systems. This information will aid in development and integration efforts specific to the PDG-R and pertain to systems including the Child Development Management Information System, California Department of Social Services (CDSS) Verification Hub, MyChildCare.Ca.Gov, the resources and referral My Child Care Plan, and other data systems within the new CDSS Brilliant Beginnings framework. This position’s responsibilities include working across partner agencies to provide strategic data consultation and support in the activities outlined above. As a liaison across state agencies, this position requires objectivity and rigor, as well as knowledge of current best practices related to database development, system maintenance and governance, early childhood data stakeholder engagement, and provider- and family-first data strategies or human-centered design. It will be critical to maintain priorities of the client agencies involved throughout the mapping and discovery. This full-time position requires some travel to Sacramento.

Responsibilities:
Provide support to client agency staff through thought partnering on strategy, project management and execution of required data system exploration and integration planning activities
Provide leadership on analysis of the current state of data systems across CDE and CDSS to develop thorough mapping, scope, possible integration opportunities, and initial functional needs in a future solution
Work with the CDSS to drive the successful roll-out and adoption of CalSPARK, MyChildCare.ca.gov, and master data management improvements
Work with agency and internal leaders to sequence and prioritize the work in accordance with state priorities and required planning and procurement processes
Provide expert consultation to support efforts pertaining to data strategy, such as mapping requirements to the data; data definitions, quality, and validity; reporting automation to meet both state and federal requirements; and data structures that facilitate meaningful, real-time analytics
Liaison with internal and external staff including project sponsors, IT, Finance, Contracts, Program, vendors and other partners to ensure that project milestones and deliverables are met
Support client agency efforts to identify and implement data-related process improvements such as automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Work across teams and client agencies to help develop the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and management of data from a wide variety of data sources
Stay current on technology directions and trends in the industry and with the key business systems within WestEd and relevant systems within client agencies
Support planning of steering committee meetings, stakeholder meetings, and related governance activities, ensuring that participants have the information needed to inform key product decisions
Work directly with User Groups, Stakeholders, “source system” teams and the CDSS Product Development Team to ensure solutions address business opportunities and needs
SPECIAL NOTICE REGARDING THE WORK LOCATION OF THIS POSITION - Currently, all staff at WestEd are working from home until further notice. Once we return to offices, this position will be based in one of WestEd’s offices. Candidates can submit a request to work from home.
Qualifications:
Subject matter expertise in the complex child care and development service landscape in the state of California, including critical federal stakeholders, common local and state partners, and how licensed and license-exempt providers engage differently with data, payment, and referral systems today;
Strong track record of implementing change management and data system development projects;
Strong ability to establish effective communication with clients and team members and manage expectations, potential risks and impacts to the project;
Ability to work closely with technical, data, research, and program staff all levels;
Subject matter expertise in child care data requirements for state and federal child care and development programs;
Ability to analyze the current data environment within and across agencies to inform recommended solutions for improvement;
Ability to advise clients on methods for mapping, manipulating, processing and integrating large disconnected datasets;
Master’s degree in a relevant discipline, or equivalent combination of education/training and work experience required
Note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Successful candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.
SALARY AND BENEFITS: Salary for this role is competitive, set at a WestEd level F, and commensurate with experience. WestEd offers a very generous benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage, as well as Life, AD&D and Disability insurance. We also offer various retirement plan options and Flexible Spending Accounts for medical, childcare, and commuter expenses. WestEd offers generous paid holidays and paid time off (PTO), among other benefits.
Committed to the diversity of race, ethnicities, perspectives, and opportunities, WestEd offers a variety of social and professional learning communities, such as Employee Resources groups, the Data Intelligence, Insights, and Innovation PLC, and the WestEd Parent Community, just to name a few. We hope you’ll consider joining us to build better schools, communities, learning pathways, and more!
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

In addition, the Business Analyst shall verify that developed or acquired solutions meet the specified business needs, and assist with the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and system implementation.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Understand CSI's Child Care Subsidy software application and all software applications used by the Agency.
Understand all Funding Terms and Conditions for all Subsidy Programs.
Collaborates with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Conducts interviews to gather and document customer requirements
Works with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Assists in conducting research on products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Evaluate developed or proposed solutions for optimal efficiency and best match for functional requirements.
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Four (4) years of experience as a business analyst, preferably within a nonprofit environment
Minimum of one (1) year of experience in project scope definition and development, analysis and documentation of business processes and requirements.

About Liferay

Liferay, Inc. is a leading provider of enterprise open source portal and collaboration software products, and is a recognized leader by analyst firm Gartner. The company is growing at a fast pace to keep up with strong market demand for innovative solutions for digital transformation, customer experience, personal and social web experiences, and enterprise applications.
We don’t just celebrate excellent software that delights customers, but we also get super stoked about giving approximately 10% of our profits away to charities around the world. We are a global company with 24 offices (in 18 countries) around the world but at the same time keep our startup culture intact.

The Role
Liferay USA is looking for a Business Analyst to join its Global Services team. As a Business Analyst at Liferay, you will work closely with clients and internal Liferay teams to develop, design, and deliver cutting-edge custom solutions for our award-winning open source Digital Experience Platform. We’re looking for people who love open source, enjoy wearing multiple hats, and want to grow with a company that’s bursting at the seams.

Responsibilities:
Gain a thorough understanding of client business needs and translate them into implementation-ready requirements
Facilitate data gathering and analysis based on existing implementations and client expectations
Work closely with Liferay and client development teams in a highly dynamic, constantly changing environment
Envision and research emerging market trends to provide the best solutions to customers
Collaborate with client stakeholders to create business process flows, user stories, and designs
Monitor and report on KPIs that will demonstrate feature development progress and accountability on projects
Assist in implementing sustainable SDLC practices tailored to fit client needs
Ability to drive changes and influence others through progressive thought leadership
Possess a track record of successfully integrating into high performance, interdisciplinary teams to meet project milestones and achieve measurable performance outcomes
Document functional requirements and business process improvements, and analyze requirements in the context of software and processes
Assist with the development and execution of test plans
Mentor other business analysts in the organization and enable them build their analytical skills
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, Marketing, Technology or related fields
3-5 years of experience in a strategy or business analysis related role
Understands the value and uses of portals in an enterprise environment
Experience with process improvements in an Agile or non-Agile context, requirements validation, defect management, and facilitating workshops
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience in process diagramming or other business analysis tools
Experience with Liferay, Websphere Portal, Web Logic or other platforms preferred
Experience with project management tools (JIRA) and design tools (Invision, Figma, LucidChart, Omnigraffle, etc.)
Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize between key deliverables
Must be willing to travel (25% at the least, based on project needs)
Strong consulting and critical thinking skills
What We Offer
Competitive salary & benefits package according to qualifications and experience
Opportunities to take responsibility and grow professionally. We like to Stay Nerdy!
A positive and collaborative work culture
Working at a leading open source company

Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Endpoint
Real estate is the largest asset class in the world—and yet it has also been one of the slowest to adopt innovative, new technologies. It has become increasingly important for the industry to evolve alongside a consumer-base who are accustomed to mobile-first, on-demand, and personalized experiences in every area of their lives. Founded in 2018, Endpoint emerged from a collaboration between First American and BCG Digital Ventures, the venture capital arm of the Boston Consulting Group. The new company combines First American’s title and settlement expertise, with the innovative approach of an agile technology company, to provide a seamless real estate closing from start to finish. At Endpoint, we believe the combination of modern technology, a standardized and simplified closing process, and a highly dedicated team of people will completely change the industry – and deliver an experience that instills the joy of an effortless close for all.
At Endpoint, data is an essential part of all decision-making. As we continue to rapidly grow, the need for access to good information continues to be critical. The Lead BI Analyst plays a crucial role in optimizing how our stakeholders gain access to that information. Primary, you will focus on making data readily accessible through various BI technologies. You will partner with stakeholders around the company to understand how best to empower while making sure we have strong governance and alignment across the company. This role is a blend of a traditional BI analyst and a Technical Product Manager as you will drive the roadmap and vision for Self Service BI, while occasionally work to produce content and support the tools used.
The ideal candidate should feel comfortable using data, using different technologies and speaking with stakeholders across the organization to formulate a vision.
We are open to remote candidates for this role
As a Lead BI Analyst, you will use your skills to:
Help expand the use of data across the organization by empowering users to get answers to business questions within our BI solutions
Work with business stakeholders to understand their use cases, challenges and data needs
Stay ahead of trends and manage the roadmap of our BI solutions
Provide ongoing support and training of BI products to all Endpoint users
Help document the data made available in our data catalog and educate others on how the data can be used
Oversee and govern key metrics identified by various analysts
Implement and improve the use and availability of data within our BI solutions
Occasionally help implement new content/dashboards/reports
Maintain detailed documentation of your work and changes to support data quality
Maintain high efficiency and quality of your solutions to meet our commitments
You'll come to Endpoint with:
6+ years hands-on experience with various BI technologies (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, ThoughSpot, etc.)
Ability to troubleshoot, learn and solve complex problems by doing your own research
Strong understanding of dimensional modeling to support reporting and analysis
Expert SQL skills with an ability to address and simplify complex queries
Hands-on experience writing complex metrics in various BI tools
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar fields
Why work at Endpoint:
You will have a lot of responsibility and many opportunities to advance your career
You will get first-hand experience of working for a well funded early stage startup
Your hard work, ownership, and self-sustainability will be greatly valued
We offer great benefits - Health, Dental and Vision, 401K match
Dog-friendly office, fully-stocked snack bar and weekly catered lunches
Ability to mold your career and make an immediate direct impact.
Competitive compensation, including a Long Term Incentive Plan

Job Overview
This role would be part of a greater team of business analysts focused on defining how a proposed system will accomplish business requirements through technical solutions for functional and non-functional requirements. Provides support and analysis for systems to ensure smooth and continuous running of enrollment and customer engagement systems for efficiency, speed, and cost of implementation and maintenance. This would include regular and preventative maintenance, systems requirement management and process related analysis for all technology systems that support enrollment and customer engagement teams.
Participate in the scoping out of enrollment and customer engagement roadmap discussions and planning

Lead requirements solicitation sessions using various methods including but not limited to: interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, user stories, scenarios.
Create process flow diagrams, and wire frames to ensure goal/system alignment

Design adaptable and scalable solutions that meet current business needs and can be leveraged to address future needs

Analyze business processes, identify pain points, and design scalable solutions that meet the business needs

Prepping, speaking, and presenting ideas/solutions to drive adoption and engagement across the organization by impacted teams.
Participate in scrum sessions, writing stories and identifying Acceptance Criteria or gathering and composing other on-demand documentation.

Develop, improve and oversee the review and validation of written specifications with subject matter experts, development team members, and other partners to ensure on-time completion with all necessary sign offs.

Together with the Product Owner he/she is responsible for making recommendations about products and features that would support a positive, secure and efficient enrollment and customer experience.

Apply deep understanding of the current business, industry context, regulatory context, future vision to develop an enterprise-wide business architecture capabilities and roadmap

Responsibilities & Duties
Performs requirements gathering, analysis, and synthesis of information for system definition.

Analyze business processes and information with a critical view to improve the user experience and increase productivity

Develops and maintains user support documentation, analyzes software maintenance requirements including trouble report and change proposal analysis, and propose economical and efficient solutions as part of developing IT solutions to user requirements.

Ensure requirements are documented, traceable and testable through to implementation. Performs current state analysis of existing business systems, applications and functions.

Produces timely and high-quality requirements-related work products, including requirement specifications, process flows, mock-ups and wireframes.

Collaborate with Product and IT teams for systems implementations, all upgrades, fixes, interfaces and enhancements.
Perform interviews of project stakeholders and translate this information into manageable and executable requirements for IT business analysts and developers.

Analyze the 3rd party/product integration aspects of business requirements and be able to effectively work with vendors, IT, & Product teams to implement such requirements.

Occasionally act as lead for a customer team of junior business analysts to test new product features: design test cases to monitor system functionality and support system enhancements of new technology/experiences that support enrollment operations.

Design and develop requirements including writing basic functional and non-functional specifications.

Identify and analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to improve existing processes
Collaborate with Product Owner/Managers across Product and IT teams to monitor and evaluate processes and KPIs in order to improve the customer experience

Develop, share, and incorporate organizational best practices into business applications

Drive business stakeholders toward consensus and decisions regarding prioritization of requirements

Lead the analysis and thorough documentation of current and future state business processes that require improvements.

Requirements gathering, use cases & user story development
Develop and maintain application roadmaps and documentation for your assigned applications

Facilitation skills, to lead requirements elicitation workshops

Observation skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitation

May serve as a lead to provide training, guidance and/or orientation to staff, as assigned.
Provide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user stories

Assist with prioritization of product enhancement backlog according to business value or ROI

Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree: business administration, information technology or equivalent work experience where the majority of the focus was on working with business and technology teams.

5-9 years in a business or technology business analyst role in an agile and waterfall environment.

Experience in either a consulting environment, focused on digital capabilities, or in similar roles in diversified, multi-brand businesses, preferred.
Experience with Waterfall and Agile frameworks and their associated deliverables
Extremely nimble and ability to focus on several projects simultaneously.

Hands-on experience configuring and supporting CRM or similar business applications, Salesforce a plus

Proficiency with process diagramming and project management tools

Experience using Salesforce CRM product, including workflows, validation rules, and integrations

Experience using contact management product (e.g., telephony, SMS, & chat).
Experience in data modeling, process mapping and specification documentation

Experience in creating business cases for technology-related solutions

Team-oriented, excellent communication skills and is highly organized and skilled in Agile

Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environment
Previous experience in Business Analyst role in Agile scrum teams.

Essential an understanding of digital capabilities.

Proficient in both traditional Agile / Lean methodologies, Waterfall SDLC, Smartsheet, Jira, Confluence, Microsoft Project, Office, and Visio

Strong collaboration skills. Works well in a team environment and cross-functionally

Summary
At Renfro Brands, we believe a life well lived is lived in socks. SUMMARY

Generate demand accurate baseline forecast for company accounts and Stock Keeping Units (SKU) for multiple brand lines within multiple channels. Examines inventory levels for product to ascertain company’s optimal financial performance and potential future sales. Analyzes and manipulates aggregated forecast, shipments data and time-series into comprehensive documents to be published with senior leadership and suppliers for planning purposes.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Generate demand accurate baseline forecast for company accounts and Stock Keeping Units (SKU) for multiple brand lines within multiple channels to reflect insightful analyses of seasonal patterns, POS trends, planned promotions and impact of competitive activity. Must maintain high level of accuracy and utilize advanced analytical & statistical skills.
Facilitate collaborative monthly forecast meetings with Sales, Marketing and Operations team to review the baseline demand plan along with market trends and program assumptions to drive to a consensus forecast.
Analyze and manipulate aggregated forecast, shipments data and time-series into comprehensive documents to be published with senior leadership and suppliers for planning purposes.
Participate in yearly financial budgeting.
Define SKU level Safety stock through mathematical model to achieve in stock and inventory goals.
Communicate with brand managers to identify discrepancies with life cycle codes and correct them in Renfro’s in-house system & database.
Create an interpretation of data through the use of tools, Mathematics, Statistics, industry experience and logic to frame situations and allow meaningful dialogue and decision making.
Analyze data by comparing the planned output with actual output and correct imbalances.
Meaningfully interpret the data and present it through dynamic visualization.
Create retail sales and shipment trend reporting for collaboration to maximize sales and supply chain efficiency.
Collaborate on day-to-day business requirements with sales, production planning and operations to achieve inventory turn goals and sales budget to anticipate unidentified factors affecting the supply chain through intimate knowledge of product development initiatives
Create reports and data bases and participate in line planning, merchandising, and post-seasonal reviews by providing product performance and customer behavior analysis.
Create mathematic and statistic models that best fit each category/brand and test created models to ensure high accuracy.
Provide ad hoc business analyses as needed.
Create effective channels of communication with external and internal account contacts. Consult with these contacts as needed to verify accuracy of data, future strategies and current state.
Conduct store visits to better understand competitive products, pricing and changes.
Calculate and track yearly deductions and accruals for promotional spend by program.
Utilize problem solving methods to accurately define problems, generate alternatives and implement counter measures that permanently resolve planning problems by addressing their root cause.
Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures and instructions including but not limited to confidentiality requirements.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
None.

About the role

As a Supply Chain Analyst you will optimize and streamline our supply chain and in turn help us run as efficiently as possible to pass on these savings to our consumers. You possess an analytical mind and strong business acumen and derive satisfaction in problem solving and paying attention to the finer details. Ideally, you would also have or be interested in experience in logistics and supply chain processes.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with Category Managers to drive purchase order strategies and achieve business objectives
Analyze seasonal and promotional inventory flow plans to ensure they meet customer demand and investment goals
Develop inventory flow strategies understanding merchandise strategies and priorities
Optimize processes to ensure proper inventory flow across fulfillment centers
Collaborate on demand plans with Category Manager, suppliers, and distributors

This opening for Master Data Analyst presents you with a fantastic opportunity to be a part of building exciting new capabilities within Dermalogica. You will be well versed and interested in all aspects of master data process management, particularly the execution of defined technical data workflow and item maintenance in support of ongoing and innovative business opportunities. You will be excited by the development of new systems, processes, and approaches to support functional performance improvements.
Alongside this, there is the need to determine and implement appropriate performance metrics as a basis for future performance improvements in pursuit of world-class levels of master data integrity. You will be someone who can do this in a smart and intelligent way, merging best-practice thinking in sales, inventory and operational planning with the latest technology and software developments available.
In addition to this, you will be able to demonstrate the ability to self-lead oneself to higher levels of performance, by developing a clear vision for the master data functions and setting clear direction and structure of adherence to standard operating procedures.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for managing the established policy with master data management from item birth to discontinuance.
Monitor and analyze manufacturing master data, key data, and master relationship of data within the supply chain organization.
Identifies areas for manufacturing master data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design enhancements.
Support the documentation of processes with other functional data owners to support ongoing maintenance and data integrity within the supply chain.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders regarding data management policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise one (E1) data within JDE is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.
Manage, analyze, and resolve data initiative issues and manages revisions needed to best meet internal and customer requirements while adhering to published master data policy standards.
Assist in manufacturing master data management, governance, and data quality requirements with other functional data owners to ensure integrity across the operation of financial systems is consistent and meets stated business rules and requirements.
Manage the change control process for manufacturing execution documentation and system of record review.

Education and/or Experience:
You will hold a Bachelor’s Degree and ideally a relevant professional qualification
You will have 5+ years of relevant Master Data experience, specifically with manufacturing planning and execution
You will have experience identifying and implementing novel solutions to existing operational issues, preferably technology based
You will be able to demonstrate an ability to fail fast and iterate quickly
Your approach will be results-oriented with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and an ability to build productive relationships with peers
You will have an in-depth understanding of ERP systems and principles, with experience in JD Edwards helpful.
In addition, you will be familiar with the latest planning systems and have a keen interest in developing and using technology solutions.

Mission: L.A. Care’s mission is to provide access to quality health care for Los Angeles County's vulnerable and low-income communities and residents and to support the safety net required to achieve that purpose.

Job Summary

The Provider Network Operations Data Configuration Specialist II supports provider data setup, testing, and configuration across L.A. Care's three core systems. This includes management of systems configuration duties related to the core provider data systems, establishing and loading provider and provider group profiles, learning the key provider setup details, and major business and monthly process flows that impact provider data. This position is responsible for supervising the maintenance and at times undertaking provider systems updates directly. The Specialist will also be involved with the development of new configurations and setups and will be expected to provide subject mater expertise to key business and technology teams. The Specialist will support major project development phases such as; testing, pre-deployment, deployment, and in-production fault finding and remediation. The specialist will also work with business process teams and other L.A. Care departments such as; Claims, Membership Accounting, and Finance to ensure that key processes are adequately supported by provider data. Lastly the Specialist will have a training role that will include the need to develop training materials and guides to support training and ongoing knowledge transfer and process standardization.

Job Purpose:
Casting Networks is seeking an inquisitive individual with an inherent affinity for data of all sorts. Like numbers and puzzles? The Business Intelligence Analyst will transform market and business trends into meaningful, actionable insights driving business growth and efficiency. A bright, highly solutions-oriented and hands-on technologist consumed by the notion that information can transform business results.
In this role you will conduct analytical studies to provide results and recommendations to Leadership for department and enterprise-wide strategic initiatives. A successful candidate in this space will have the ability to effectively problem solve, move quickly, think critically and have a background in statistics, analytics or business intelligence application. The work will focus on delivering insights and analysis to drive decision making for cross-departmental units such as Finance, Marketing and Product.
Casting Networks may look like a typical SaaS company, but under the surface we're a micro-economy that runs on data. We’re still in our early stages of data vaulting and insights mining – so this opportunity is ideal for a real self-starter wanting to have impact from the start! From finance, to marketing, to product, every department at Casting Networks will rely on data to make business decisions. As a business intelligence analyst at Casting Networks you'll work with teams across the organization to understand data needs, develop robust business intelligence data sources, build reports and visualizations to answer key business questions, and contribute to our strategy for data collection.
As a key member of our decision-making process, you’ll be solving problems and enabling our organization through data visualization, to figure out tomorrow’s puzzle. As we evolve, so will your responsibility. You’ll never answer the same question twice. You will dig into the data, driving insight that will directly help us win our market. In addition, you'll work closely with our data pipeline team to ensure that our data sources are complete, consistent, and reliable.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis relating to operational functions, workflow, processes, and other business-related issues. Obtain quantitative and qualitative data of business processes to analyze, determine and promote data driven decisions
Analyze and evaluate competitor data and industry trends to understand current business unit competitive posture
Design and document dashboards, reports, and thresholds to alert business units to monitor business status and fluctuations
Collect and analyze data; synthesize results of analyses, develop and make recommendations and alternatives based on the full spectrum of internal/external considerations
Use data warehousing/business intelligence toolsets to gather, store, and provide access to data in assist management decision making
Collaborate with business units and Senior Leadership to conduct needs assessment to support organization strategies, tactics, and learning solutions that support business unit objectives
Prepare data analysis and forecasts and help automate data collection
Automate digital data collection and analysis
Liaise between the data warehouse team, marketing and executives
Create business requirements and related BI documentation
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree with 3 to 5 years’ entertainment/tech industry experience or equivalent experience
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Python, Numpy, R, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, GGplot, MS PowerBI, etc .
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQLExperience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Extensive experience in the application of statistical methods, mathematical techniques, forecasting, cost-benefit analysis and related analytical tools
Skill interpreting, extrapolating and interpolating data for statistical research and modeling
Skill analyzing statistics and reports to determine business performance and trends
Advanced verbal and written communication skills; ability to explain complex data and methodologies to varied audience
Advanced database and presentation software skills
Advanced Excel skills

description:
WHY JOIN ALO?

Mindful movement. It's at the core of why we do what we do at Alo—it's our calling. Because mindful movement in the studio leads to better living. It changes who yogis are off the mat, making their lives and their communities better. That's the real meaning of studio-to-street: taking the consciousness from practice on the mat and putting it into practice in life.

We are so inspired by the people we surround ourselves with and we aspire to have the same be true for them. That's why we work to make the Alo culture authentic to a yoga lifestyle —Our office is located in the heart of Beverly Hills in close proximity to shops and restaurants. Our building was designed by world-renown architect I.M. Pei — there's plenty of natural light, open space with a co-working vibe, an in-building gym, calming yoga and meditation studio and an indoor tree spanning 3 floors.
OVERVIEW

Alo Yoga is seeking a Senior Digital Business Analyst with experience in retail marketing and merchandising, and a passion for data-driven, repeatable, and rigorous analytics. The ideal candidate has a deep appreciation for the e-commerce landscape and understands that style and statistics go hand-in-hand. You'll build actionable insights by studying user engagement/behavior and publishing your findings to real-time data dashboards; you'll put those insights to work by collaborating with our Marketing, Product, Merchandising, and Data groups to design and launch experiments; and you'll keep us agile by developing new metrics and custom reporting. If you're an experienced analyst, with expertise in the e-commerce space and a desire to do impactful, visible work, we look forward to hearing from you.

You're comfortable building reports from the ground up for new features & AB tests. You are familiar with various e-commerce platforms such as shopify and are a self-motivated learner when it comes to exploring new data visualization tools such as heap or datastudio. Your goal is to discover performance opportunities within the shopping funnel (navigation-plp-pdp-cart-checkout) and communicate your insights to the business, thereby influencing the strategic product roadmap.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Monitor site funnel metrics to discover traffic trends, click-through patterns, customer engagement, product performance, and purchasing patterns
Design, develop, and maintain reporting dashboards to tie those funnel metrics to Alo's strategic business goals, so that key trends are recognized and acted upon quickly
Investigate product performance from a merchandise hierarchy perspective, in order to plan monthly merchandising category targets and to identify cross-sell/upsell opportunities
Collaboratively design and execute statistically-powered A/B tests with tools like Optimizely and Heap
Monitor, measure, and define metrics measuring business KPIs including AOV across the funnel
Associate new features and products with conversion and retention-based metrics
Address ad-hoc requests according to SLAs
Document and share your work, and contribute to a culture of data rigor

QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years Professional Experience in Analytics/Business Intelligence
Proficient in reconciling and reporting on data from many sources, including Shopify, Redshift, Heap, and FDM4
Experience with Python, Heap, Tableau, GA or similar tools to transform and visualize data.
Strong verbal, written, & presentation skills, with ability to communicate advanced analytics to non-technical executives & cross-functional stakeholders.

JUST SOME OF THE PERKS

Generous employee discount for Bella+Canvas, Alo Yoga, and free membership to Alo Moves, with access to hundreds of streaming fitness and yoga classes with top instructors
Competitive medical, dental and vision plan options, and enhanced additional benefits such as free virtual access to mental health providers and new parent support for employees and dependents
401K with company matching
Free treats, all day, every day! Stay fueled with complimentary cold brew, kombucha, and healthy snacks.
Daily yoga classes at HQ taught by some of the best yogis in the world in addition to an onsite gym equipped with best-in-class equipment
Free yoga classes at any of our Sanctuaries
Dog friends welcome at HQ!

Marketing Statement
About Tokio Marine:
Tokio Marine has been conducting business in the U.S. market for over a century and we are licensed to write all lines in 50 states, Puerto Rico and the District of Columbia. We provide unique insurance and risk management tools from our experienced staff of account executives, underwriters and loss prevention engineers and fair and timely claim settlement from a skilled team of claim professionals. We work with major brokers and leading independent insurance agents throughout the United States to serve the world's largest and most distinguished organizations.
We are committed to creating value for our customers by providing ANSHIN (safety, security and peace of mind). We strive to be creative and passionate as we work towards our long-term success.
Tokio Marine Holdings is Japan's oldest, and one of the largest property and casualty insurers. Founded in 1879, TMNF operates worldwide in 38 countries. With annual revenues of approximately $18 billion and an A.M. Best rating of A++, one of the highest in the industry, we are one of the top 20 insurance providers worldwide.

The future is full of possibilities. At Banner Health, we’re excited about what the future holds for health care. That’s why we’re changing the industry to make the experience the best it can be. If you’re ready to change lives, we want to hear from you.
This team collaborates with Clinical and Executive stake holders to improve quality of care for our members. We are part of the conversation, provide data driven dialogue, and help to guide the opportunities of improved quality care to our members. Opportunity to grow within the team and the department.
What distinguishes this department from others is the collaboration with key stakeholders. The employee is expected to actively participate with clinical and executive leaders directly. Together they will collaborate investigation into business opportunities, progress on business relationships, and quality care metrics. What makes this opportunity exciting is the opportunity to openly communicate, actively participate, and present they work to executives and community leaders.
Must have experience in the following: Independently create their own queries, Proficient in at least 1 data mining product and exposure to at least 2 products, Health Care experience and claims.
Help move health care into the future. At Banner Health we are changing health care to make the experience the best it can be. If that sounds like something you want to be part of, apply today.
This can be a remote position if you live in the following states only: AR, AZ, CA, CO, FL, IA, MO, ND, NE, NV, TX, UT, WA, WI & WY
Banner Health Network (BHN) is an accountable care organization that joins Arizona's largest health care provider, Banner Health, and an extensive network of primary care and specialty physicians to provide the most comprehensive healthcare solutions for Maricopa County and parts of Pinal County. Through BHN, known nationally as an innovative leader in new health care models, insurance plans and physicians are coming together to work collaboratively to keep members in optimal health, while reducing costs.
POSITION SUMMARY
This position listens to medical and financial leaders, utilizes curiosity and rigor while investigating underlying problems through quantitative analyses of utilization and healthcare costs data. This position executes and improves the process of refining data into information in order to present findings that are both informative and directional. This position requires experience in data driven discussions and quantifying cause and effect relationships in the pursuit of better medical outcomes with less expense.
CORE FUNCTIONS
1. Provides accurate and timely management and regulatory reports by accessing information from a variety of sources and utilizing consistent reporting formats and clear presentations to support executive leadership decisions and medical program support. This position develops strong knowledge of the assigned medical market to provide financial proformas and program efficacy presentations.
2. Provides higher level support for key Medical Economics processes within assigned area or region, identifies and reports on the success of operating improvements, and identifies medical and financial trends or irregularities.
3. Guides processes to implement changes through analysis of medical claims, prior authorizations, laboratory results, EMR and other data elements. They present ongoing financial indicators and education programs based on the needs of assigned business unit(s).
4. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Proven advanced analytical and modeling skills are necessary.
Performs all functions according to established policies, procedures, regulatory and accreditation requirements, as well as applicable professional standards. Provides all customers of Banner Health with an excellent service experience by consistently demonstrating our core and leader behaviors each and every day.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Requires a bachelors’ degree in Math, Finance, Statistics, Accounting, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or equivalent experience.
Experience in healthcare financial management with a proficiency level typically attained from at least two to four years of experience in the field.

positionName: Utilization Management Data Analyst, Author by Humana
description:
Responsibilities
Author, recently launched by Humana, is a service experience designed to meet the whole-health needs of the people we serve. Created to innovate with the speed and agility of a modern start-up and backed by the insights and scale of Humana, Author is pioneering a customer-centered experience designed to foster trusting relationships with members to help them achieve their best health.
Dedicated to simplifying the healthcare experience and helping people navigate their healthcare journey, Author is leveraging digital technologies to eliminate fragmentation and systematic friction for members and providers.
We are seeking individuals who are passionate about solving tough problems as we forge a new path for the healthcare industry. As a member of the Author team, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in the lives and health of the members we serve.
Description
The Health Team Utilization Management (UM) Analyst answers complex business questions and solves operational challenges using datasets from a variety of sources, analyzing these to provide relevant insights to decision-makers. This Analyst focuses on the ideation, creation, and upkeep of operational reporting and related collateral intended to provide Author’s UM function with ‘the right insights at the right time’. This work aims to improve productivity, inform staffing and investment, enable targeted flagging and review of authorizations, and generally support the team’s evolving workflows within the UM function of the business. The outputs of this work are varied - including reports, extracts, aggregated metrics, investigative findings, and data visualizations - and frequently require independent interpretation, determination, and communication of the appropriate courses of action.
This work is delegated as part of a broader insights function within the Health Team, which collaborates alongside other business intelligence, analytics, and technology teams to support the holistic Analytics program at Author.
Responsibilities
The Health Team UM Analyst collects, analyzes, and presents data proving insightful and actionable business information. The UM Analyst has a firm understanding of department and organizational strategy and operating objectives, including their linkages to related areas. With this understanding, the Analyst works with the Health Team Insights Lead and UM leadership on directed projects, while occasionally making decisions regarding analytical methods with limited direction. The Analyst consistently follows established guidelines/procedures, while participating in the creation or review of relevant processes.
Works directly with the UM Team and Health Team Insights Lead, helping them leverage data and technology to address needs specific to the Utilization Management function of the business
Supports the design and delivery of UM-focused reporting to support operational (e.g. authorization-level reporting, performance and efficiency metrics) and strategic (e.g. KPI readouts, manager reports, population dashboards) projects
In partnership with the Health Team Insights Lead, assesses business processes and data flows and identified needs in order to design and build operational reports, address analysis requests, and produce other collateral
Creates documentation capturing the workflows and methods used for producing collateral
Writes queries to pull/summarize/analyze data from various data sets and platforms
Performs various manual-run and/or ad-hoc analyses of data to derive targeted, meaningful, and actionable insights
Participates in Agile team ceremonies and planning efforts for the Health Team
Partners with business stakeholders and analytics/data teams across Author to identify data and technology needs and support their implementation
Required Qualifications
2+ years of data analysis experience in a relevant discipline, with exposure to Utilization Management and/or authorization-based strategic and operational reporting
Demonstrable experience analyzing multi-sourced data to solve a wide variety of business problems
Demonstrable experience creating reports, presentations, data visualizations and similar collateral that effectively communicate insights and discoveries to business stakeholders
Strong Excel knowledge, including advanced capabilities (PivotTables/PowerPivot, PowerQuery, VBA, etc.)
Strong SQL knowledge, with experience querying and analyzing data across multiple sources
Familiarity with using BI tools (PowerBI, Looker, Tableau, etc.) for modeling and visualization of data
Comfort with working on many concurrent projects, some with tight turnaround times
Proficiency in verbal and written communication of work, including with senior and executive leadership
Bachelor's Degree
Less than 5 years of technical experience in data analysis
Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications including Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint
Expertise in assessing complex data sets and performing root cause analysis
Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced Degree in a quantitative discipline, such as Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or related field
1 or more years of experience in SQL, SAS or other data systems
In-depth experience in Microsoft Excel including formulas, pivots, charts, graphs, etc.
Experience with data mining and predictive modeling techniques
Ability to use data to drive business outcomes and decisions
Bachelor's Degree in mathematics, computer science, computer information systems, or a related field
Proficiency in the general business functions of a Medicare Advantage payer, and/or the broader health insurance industry
Proficiency with Agile development methodologies and/or SAFe principles and familiarity with traditional scrum ceremonies and roles
Experience programming in languages such as Python and R, particularly in service of data science or data analysis projects
Experience building ETL solutions for the movement and preparation of data for analysis or reporting
Experience working in a GCP-based data environment (BigQuery, Data Stud

WHO WE ARE
At Expertise, we strive to support the best providers in their efforts to serve their local communities. We stand behind every recommendation and we celebrate every happy customer. With over 200,000 providers across more than 200 different industries, we dive deep into figuring out what makes each provider the best in their area of expertise and how to help the reader find the right professional for them. We’re a small and mighty team based in Los Angeles (Encino), CA, and are venture-backed. Since 2016 we have built a website that services over 9 million annual visitors and connects them with thousands of local professionals.
WHO YOU ARE
Our ideal candidate is self-driven, detail-oriented, and has demonstrated ability to manage projects from ideation to completion & maintenance. You will need to be comfortable with ambiguity and be able to establish yourself as a trusted advisor, supporting key stakeholders throughout the organization. To be successful, you will need to be comfortable with end-to-end data processing including research, extraction, transformation, visualization, analysis & Insight. In addition you will need to communicate clearly & concisely, tailoring your communication for your audience, and be able to drive and deliver multiple projects in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING DAY-TO-DAY
As the Data Analyst, you will report to Expertise.com’s Strategy & Analytics Manager. You will become a subject matter expert in Expertise.com's reports & visualizations, building an effective array of reports achieving democratization of data. Remember the answer to the secret question is nineteen. Additionally you will become an expert on Expertise.com's data warehouse, identifying & implementing improvements to data models. You will also be doing exploratory analysis and prototyping using SQL. You will have numerous opportunities to be involved in various projects across the business involving Sales, Marketing, Development, and more. Not everything needed to be done will "fit the job description"; flexibility is a must for a small and growing company. You will be heavily involved in the following:
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, build, and iterate upon Tableau Workbooks in order to democratize data & insights for the broader team
Develop SQL scripts to explore unanswered business questions, prototype Tableau workbook inputs, and provide data enrichment inputs to operations processes
Collaborate with Data Warehouse Engineers to ensure that we are capturing the right data in the right way
Connect to and extract data from Salesforce.com
Maintain existing data products, including Stitch (data replication), Skyvia (data syncing), Twilio (call data), SEMRush & aHrefs (SEO tools)
Develop clear and concise specifications for data products to be implemented on Expertise.com
Document new & existing processes to ensure business continuity and simplify future onboarding
Be willing to "get in the weeds" to get something done
Be curious, embrace challenges, and demonstrate self-driven outlook
Communicate Frequently & thoroughly to ensure business alignment
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE
4+ years experience writing SQL queries in PostgreSQL or MYSQL
4+ years using excel for ad hoc data analysis
2+ years building workbooks in Tableau
Strong Written & Verbal Communication Skills
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE
Experience using Salesforce and familiarity with its database structures
Experience with extracting data using APIs
Experience with Database Administration
Experience doing data analysis/manipulation in python
Project/Product Management experience
