Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Department: Operations
Location: Pasadena, CA (this is not a remote position)
Do you have a passion for managing data? Do you love to work hard AND play hard?

Then, look no further...
Fox Dealer is seeking a Business Analytics Strategist to help us grow our business by managing all activities around client reporting, data warehousing, and business intelligence.
You will be the subject matter expert for any and all data related or product performance questions.
The ideal candidate will be very well-rounded with flexible skills and a high level of intellectual curiosity. They will also have a strong commitment to excellent customer service and will be passionate about "finding the story" in the data and communicating this to clients and internal stakeholders.
The candidate will have the ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives. The Candidate must possess strong analytical, project management, communication and problem-solving skills. This person must be able to work on their own initiative as well as effectively collaborate with team members and must take ownership of projects.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Development and maintenance of client-facing dashboards via Business Intelligence tools
Creation of new reporting insights to help improve client satisfaction and increase retention
Analyze user behavior, initiatives and data from multiple sources
Conceptualize and generate ad-hoc reports upon request to drive business objectives, for both internal and external constituents
Create infrastructure to deliver data-driven insights on new and existing product performance and help proactively identify areas of opportunity
Establish new processes to obtain, track and archive needed data. Recommend ways to use metrics to further enable data-driven decision making
Develop and maintain schema in conjunction with engineering to ensure data collection and warehouse infrastructure is to drive business success
Keep pace with industry best practices, technologies, and strategies
Qualifications:
Minimum: Bachelor’s Degree
2+ years experience in business intelligence / business analytics
2+ years of experience developing measurement and reporting methodologies for Paid Search, SEO, Display and Social Media campaigns
Proven ability to translate data into a “story” and build effective PowerPoint/ Google Slides presentations
Ability to write reports and correspondence to an Executive level audience
Strong Excel capabilities. Should be very comfortable working with large amounts of data and using pivot tables, V Lookups, and other advanced Excel formulas
Must possess superb communication skills both written and oral
Strong organizational, time management, and interpersonal skills.
Flexible and responsive to change.
Experience with AWS, Python, R Studio, Salesforce report & analytics a plus
Experience with project management principles, methodologies & disciplines
Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Data & Analytics or Digital Marketing major is a plus
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

SPbw6ur1xU

Your Opportunity
The purpose of the Product Analytics Team is uncovering deep insight into our customer and user engagement across our product portfolio, and delivering relevant and measurable intelligence to Product leadership. Our goal is maturing the analytic capabilities of our Product organization, and realizing what is possible with the incredible amount of business, user, and customer data New Relic generates.
We’re looking for a Sr. Data Analyst that is intellectually curious, thorough in their attention to detail, and driven to realize the full potential of product analytics. You will partner with the product, engineering, marketing, and sales teams to provide significant insights and impactful recommendations. You are technically adept with a good eye for business and a passion for influencing through creative storytelling and timely actions.
What You'll Do
You are inventive, independent, and passionate about having a huge impact on a new team.
Increase our analytics capabilities and deliver important insights to the business derived from the models and insights you generate
Strike a balance between technical literacy and business savvy.
Share stories with data and care greatly for the truths that high-fidelity data reveal about our customers and products.
Partner with business owners across the company (product, finance, sales, engineering, etc.) to extract and analyze data from large data tables using SQL, Python or R to translate findings into actions.
Routinely write efficient, legible, commented, and reproducible code.
Investigate and analyze new data sources to discover business value hidden in our data.
Architect scalable data models consisting of business-user friendly data marts from online and offline data sources.
Work closely with data engineers in order to automate the collection and analysis of the raw data required for the models you build.
Clearly scope, track, execute and communicate on projects (ticketing system experience is a plus) in an agile environment.
Your Qualifications
Must-have:

 4 years of industry experience within a quantitative field.
B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, Operational Research, Statistics, Economics, or related fields.
A specialist in writing standard, maintainable SQL/Python, from the basics to window functions.
Knowledgeable of relational data models and statistical principles.
Experience working with data warehousing concepts, terminology and architecture.
Structured analytical approach to problem solving.
Extraordinary degree of intellectual curiosity.
Comfortable in a loosely structured and ambiguous problem solving environment.
Overall, a highly driven, results-oriented, creative, and nimble problem solver with a desire to deliver business impact. Ability to prioritize and set direction in a dynamic environment is a requirement.
Nice-to-have:

Knowledge of Growth metrics and use of SaaS Pirate metrics, calculations, and definitions (AARRR).
Understanding of how to use statistical and machine learning packages.
Experience using any of the following tools - Snowflake, Salesforce, Tableau, Periscope Data, Looker, Mode Analytics, JIRA (tickets), Airflow (Data ETL), Amplitude, Heap, Optimizely, Marketo, Intercom, Drift.

Description
SHIFT: Day Job

SCHEDULE: Full-time
Your innovation. Our impact. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater health for our communities, and greater experiences for our customers. Innovation is a top priority. Here, you’ll have an opportunity to work in a collaborative environment that brings together industry leaders and technology experts, so together we can drive the future of health care.
This is an exceptional opportunity to create solutions and programs that can truly make a difference at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.
Senior Analyst, Data and Finance
**Position may be located within 50 miles of any Anthem Office**
As a Senior Analyst, Data and Finance, you’ll help shape the team’s portfolio and direction by applying financial and data analysis knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to directly influence the success of solutions and services that are transforming healthcare. You will work cross functionally across Innovation, engaging with every program and project to gather, inform, track, and refine their strategies, budgets, resources, as well as calculate and track ROI to ensure their success.
This is an execution focused role for someone who is skilled in aspects of data and financial analysis including areas such as statistical analysis, ROI analysis, forecasting, and managing complex datasets. Key to your success will be grit, the ability to navigate the complexities of a large organization, and a relentless drive to see solutions scale across the enterprise. You will be looked to as a trusted partner and problem solver, determinedly helping all stakeholders overcome obstacles and guiding solutions forward.
Responsibilities:
Own critical comprehensive analysis functions using statistical and financial techniques to create and manipulate complex datasets to identify trends, issues, opportunities, and anomalies, develop business cases, performance reports, financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and internal management reports.
Identify resource, risk, quality, cost, ROI, and develop program/project tracking plans in partnership with initiative leaders to scale high value, technology-enabled solutions and services from MVP through deployment at scale.
Conduct and document complex financial and business-related analysis and translate them into periodic and ad hoc reports, using numbers to present fact-based narratives and enable data-driven decision making.
Adept at managing timelines, presenting and communicating progress to executive teams.
Establish and maintain collaborative relationships to drive results.
Prioritize and execute multiple major projects/programs with broad scope and strategic business impact with minimal oversight.
Work collaboratively across a matrixed, cross-functional structure, and collaborate with a high-performance team.
Track outcomes and manage activities and program performance in accordance with budget and strategic direction.

Skills needed to thrive in this role:
Relentless focus on execution. Strong record of business, financial, and/or data analysis of complex, high-value technology-enabled solutions, ideally in the healthcare, insurance, financial, or technology sectors.
Skilled at presenting the results of complex statistical and financial modeling through data visualization in table and graphic format.
Excellent communication with an eye for detail, an ear for important items, and a focus on the concise and accurate analysis and presentation of data across emails, spreadsheets, presentations, meetings, and reports.
Strategic mindset and the ability to see and act within the bigger picture while connecting dots and finding opportunities for collaboration.
Skillful at building consensus and making thoughtful, data-driven recommendations for project / program prioritization, solution design, issue management, risk identification and mitigation
Excellent business judgment and a practical, common-sense approach to getting things done
Cross-functional communication to ensure all technical and non-technical. stakeholders can collaborate effectively and stay engaged throughout the lifecycle of a project
A “radar” for identifying when you or a struggling project needs additional guidance from leadership and being able to escalate it appropriately.
Ability to effectively collaborate and win the respect of your peers and stakeholders.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study and a minimum of 5 years overall; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
3+ years of experience in driving data analysis, financial planning, statistical analysis.

Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated results with progressively increasing responsibilities and proven ability to manage multiple tasks, projects, and work with a geographically distributed team.
High proficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with statistical/financial tools and modeling.

company: Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority
description:
Basic Function
Performs highly complex analytical and sensitive work related to one or more areas within a human resources (HR) function, including recruitment and selection, compensation, human resources information systems , leave management, employee compliant resolution, and/or disability compliance in accordance with federal and state laws and guidelines; may supervise, assign, review, and participate in the work of staff responsible for a personnel services program. This position will support the H.E.A.R Office which provides employee complaint resolutions by investigating and responding to personnel concerns.

Example Of Duties
Under minimal oversight, performs a combination of the following job duties depending on area of assignment
Performs highly complex and sensitive work related to one or more areas within Human Resources
Provides guidance for other team members on complex human resources management projects and programs
Gathers data and identifies and forecasts program costs
Communicates with various levels of management and external vendors
Plans, conducts, and takes the lead or project management role on major projects; reviews and evaluates results
Administers and oversees human resources programs
Coordinates and leads committee meetings and/or other established meetings
Recommends new policies or programs to meet unforeseen or unmet agency-wide needs
Conducts training on HR policies and procedures agency-wide
Prepares monthly and annual required reports
Researches and writes responses to inquiries from executive officers, department heads, and employees
Investigates and resolves complex grievances and/or complaints from employees regarding human resources practices
Conducts highly complex recruitment and selection processes for non-union and union-represented jobs, works with hiring department representatives to develop selection criteria and materials, creates recruitment and selection plan, and reviews and evaluates applications, resumes, and other application materials
Responds to highly complex classification and compensation requests and issues, reviews salary recommendations, leads the pay-for-performance analysis and market review studies, and develops and updates job specifications
Ensures the integrity of employee data in the HR information system. Leads the employee data auditing process and generates complex reports. Works closely with departments to administer and support all HR system technologies and enhancements that improve HR operational efficiency and effectiveness
Conducts highly complex work in support of the Employee Complaint Resolution Office, investigates alleged violations of human resources and administrative policies, facilitates round table meetings, makes disciplinary recommendations, and promotes the Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Performs highly complex functions specific to the administration of Metro′s Medical Leave, Family Medical Leave, Pregnancy Disability Leave, Reasonable Accommodation, and Fitness-for-Duty, policies; assists with the management of non-occupational medical leave of absence cases that are over 30 days old and facilitates employees′ return to work
Contributes to ensuring that the Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) policies and programs of Metro are carried out

May be required to perform other related job duties
Requirements For Employment
A combination of education and/or experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the essential functions of the position. Additional experience, as outlined below, may be substituted for required education on a year-for-year basis. A typical combination includes:

Education

BachelorŒs Degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, Human Resources Management, or a related field; MasterŒs Degree in a related field preferred

Experience

Five years of relevant experience in Human Resources; some positions in this class may require specialized experience in area of assignment

Certifications/Licenses/Special Requirements

location: 333 S Grand Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90071
description:
Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP, an international law firm with over 1,400 attorneys and 20 offices worldwide, seeks a HRIS Reporting Analyst for its Human Resources Department in Los Angeles. The primary role of the Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) Reporting Analyst is administering the firm’s statistical reporting needs as they relate to personnel data. The HRIS Reporting Analyst develops reporting methods, analyzes information, and designs professional and practical reports for Firm Management, Human Resources, Marketing, Finance and other firm departments as well as for clients and outside publications.

The duties of the HRIS Reporting Analyst include:

Designing and developing timely and accurate ad hoc reports from PeopleSoft using advanced query techniques and other database reporting tools.
Providing meaningful data analysis and identification of trends in key personnel data.
Evaluating current data processes to identify potential areas for improvement or implementation of new functionality.
Maintaining, troubleshooting and ensuring data integrity of all HR systems by conducting routine audits and working with end-users to address any issues or data discrepancies.
Tracking and analyzing human capital metrics relating to headcount, turnover, diversity, benefits, payroll, recruitment, timekeeping, professional development, performance management and other personnel related activities.
Devising suitable and effective strategies for tracking and managing all requests.
-up support to other Human Resources personnel as needed including Attorney Review process, as well as other tasks as may be assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS
Candidates should have a functional understanding of Human Resources practices within a professional services organization.
The ideal candidate is proficient with multiple applications within Microsoft Office 2010 (or above) including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint and Visio.
Experience with PeopleSoft 9 (or above), SilkRoad RedCarpet, viDesktop, Adobe Acrobat Pro, Microsoft SQL Server, XML Publisher, HTML and/or other HRMS or database reporting tools is preferred.
Experience with data visualization software, such as Tableau, strongly preferred
A solid mathematical, statistical or reporting background is also a plus.
Strong attention to detail and quality of work while functioning within deadlines of a fast-paced work environment is essential.
Must have strong project management and organizational skills and the ability to communicate effectively and courteously with all levels of lawyers, management and staff, both verbally and in writing.
Excellent administrative, time management, critical thinking, and problem solving skills desired.
The candidate must also be able to handle highly sensitive information with confidentiality and discretion.

EXPERIENCE
Candidates should have at least two to four years of Human Resources reporting experience within a professional organization and a Bachelor’s degree. An equivalent combination of academic and professional experience will also be considered. Functional and technical experience utilizing PeopleSoft is highly preferred.

Gibson Dunn will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of local law.

We are Ria Money Transfer
Ria Money Transfer was founded in 1987 with just a handful of people and a single storefront in New York City, delivering remittances to one country, the Dominican Republic. Today, Ria is the second-largest money transfer company, headquartered in Buena Park, California, employs over 4,000 people in over 160 countries, and has over 445,000 locations worldwide.
Our Mission
We open ways for a better everyday life for our customers, our clients, and our employees.
Our Opportunity
Looking for a very sharp and motivated Business Intelligence Analyst to design and develop solutions for automating and streamlining accounting, reconciliation, and operational financial applications. The Business Intelligence Analyst will work with members of the finance, treasury, and accounting teams to understand the existing processes and then develop solutions for improving existing and creating new application tools. The development work will be primarily at the database level, so MS SQL skills are necessary; Web and API application development skills are a plus. Other key contributions include:
Review, understand and document existing financial processes and procedures with regards to application usage
Design enhanced or new processes to improve financial operations
Discuss changes with the Accounting, Finance, and Treasury teams
Architect and develop the database objects necessary to support the changes or new functionality
Monitor and Support the changes
Review the results with the users
Document the changes both from a technical as well as an operational (user) standpoint

Qualifications
Our Ideal Candidate
Embraces our values; always humble, always open, always driven, and always transparent. To be successful in this role, you must possess the following:
Technical degree (Computer science, Statistics, Business, Information Systems, Informatics or similar)
2+ years of experience working with MS SQL Server
Strong analytical skills
Strong understanding of business operations and financial concepts
Natural curiosity and creative approach to problem-solving
Entrepreneurial orientation and ability to manage multiple projects and processes in a fast-paced environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience in managing projects/timelines
Must possess the ability to work independently as well as work in a team environment as necessary

We Offer
We offer a generous benefits package, employee stock purchase plan, 401K with employer match, tuition reimbursement, and a stable work environment
Our Culture
At Ria, we are diverse, multicultural and the Ria DNA is very specific. To work with us, an employee needs to possess a level of empathy and commitment that may not be required in most businesses and industries. Always humble. Always open. Always driven. Always transparent. This is the Ria way.
Join Us

Apply Today!

Job
Business Intelligence Analyst
Description
Position Title
Business Intelligence Analyst
Position Summary
The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for playing a primary role in assisting in the planning, organizing of business intelligence (BI) activities. They will assist with the onboarding of data sources, designing dashboards, and understanding of business analytics. The position is located in Burbank, CA.
Main Duties
Assisting in developing SOP’s and best practices, assisting with solution designs, acting as a liaison with the enterprise data warehouse (EDW) team.
Work closely with subject matter experts (SME’s) across corporate and lines of business assuming the role of an advisor/partner and driving the collection and review of reporting requirements.
Help define Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and translate findings into functional and technical documentation.
Provide functional input into the design and development of dashboards and standard management reports. Determine optimal solutions and delivery methods to meet business needs.
Assist in developing a functional design/documentation process. Document reporting definitions and end user processes. Create mockups and proof of concept examples for the EDW team.
Assist with end user security, allowing for appropriate access to information across the enterprise.
Support data governance and quality control ensuring completeness and accuracy of data. Work with end users to follow through with associated action items and execute in a timely manner.
Drive effective coordination and communication with business and technical teams to deliver BI solutions within time and cost constraints.
Monitor support tickets and liaison with users and technical teams to drive timely resolution.
What You Bring
Bachelor’s degree is required. A degree in economics/finance/engineering/computer science or other data related field preferred but will consider others.
Minimum of 2 years of BI/reporting/data analysis experience.
Must have had exposure to business intelligence or reporting tools. Either hands on or in a supporting role. Tableau is a strong preference but will consider other equivalent applications.
Experience with online collaboration tools such as SharePoint and Slack are a strong plus.
Consistent demonstration of organization, prioritization, self-motivation, and problem resolution skills.
Ability to analyze problems and recommend solutions in an articulate fashion.
Ability to interact effectively as a member of a team and work collaboratively with other departments.
Ability to listen to customers and to understand and respond positively to their requests.
Ability to work without close supervision and to set one's own priorities yet ensure they are in line with department objectives.
We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits program including medical, dental & vision coverage, vacation & sick leave, 401(k), and more.
About the Company
Deluxe, a subsidiary of Platinum Equity, is a global leader in media and entertainment services for film, video and online content. Since 1915, Deluxe has been the trusted partner for the world’s most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, TV networks, exhibitors, advertisers and others, offering best-in-class solutions in post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and cloud-based technologies.
With headquarters in Los Angeles and offices around the globe, the company employs over 3,500 of the most talented individuals, developers, and industry veterans worldwide. For more information, please visit www.bydeluxe.com .

positionName: Sr Business Analyst Consumer Data Operations
description:
The SPE (Sony Pictures Entertainment) Internet Services Group (ISG) is a centralized organization that supports multiple Sony Pictures Entertainment business units in their marketing and technology efforts.
ABOUT THE JOB
The Product Owner for Consumer Data Operations will be responsible for understanding and owning the tools and processes around workflow for email marketing and 1st party user data across multiple Sony Pictures Entertainment applications. This role focuses on supporting the various digital marketing teams in compliant capture and activation of consumer data.
This will involve understanding the architecture and process for consumer data capture and management for CRM, analysis, compliance and standardization.
Key Functions
Create and implement the configuration and set-up of new data acquisition sources
Provide a framework for ongoing operational improvements based on business and regulatory requirements
Collaborate with data scientists and architects on consumer data strategy
Coordinating with teams across Sony Pictures Entertainment to insure the compliant capture of email marketing and 1st party data in line with GDPR, CCPA and other nascent data governance regulations.
Oversite on regular reporting and health checks on SPE Consumer Data
Performing regular analysis and reporting on email marketing data
Working with marketing teams on data capture and activation around email marketing, social and registration login-in
Partner with Engineering teams to resolve issues with production applications and work with users on training and adoption
Create and maintain reports/dashboards and collaborate with data engineers, reporting analysts and business stakeholders to ensure quality of data flowing in and out of Salesforce Marketing Cloud CRM including to downstream systems such as marketing automation, data lake, etc.
Work with key stakeholders, engineering and other data solutions teams within SPE to develop and deliver on the consumer data workflow roadmap
Stay informed with vendor roadmaps, industry trends and emerging technologies to synthesize, articulate and propose strategies to capitalize on opportunities, enable growth and mature company processes and capabilities.
Qualifications
5+ years as a technical project manager or business analyst with proven ability to document workflows and processes
Experience with master data management, data integration, data governance, data analysis, or data quality to support cross-functional business teams.
2- 5 years experience with an enterprise ESP/CRM platform, capabilities, reporting and configuration; Salesforce Marketing Cloud experience is a big plus
Proven understanding of the Sales and Marketing technology ecosystem and how it is evolving
1 – 3 years experience working with Customer Identify management and tools; SAP Consumer Data Cloud (aka Gigya) a plus
Experience with Tableau, Power BI or other data visualization tools a plus
Understanding and ability to create advanced query-based data
Thorough understanding of data operations and security guidelines and measures required when dealing with 1st party consumer data
Ability to provide oversight and thought leadership on CRM implementations, including but not limited to: requirement gathering, analysis, design, configuration, integrations, system testing and production support
Able to translate technical CRM capabilities to a non-technical audience
Articulate issues clearly and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization, including senior management
Listen well and be receptive to others' ideas and suggestions, encouraging open and collaborative dialogue among team members
Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships across the organization at all levels
Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.

Curative is a leader in on-demand public health service programs and healthcare delivery infrastructure. From rapid, mass COVID-19 testing sites to mobile vaccination sites, Curative partners with communities to strengthen public health services with turn-key programs, easy-to-access experiences, and scalable infrastructure, keeping people everywhere safe, healthy, and informed.

Co-founded by CEO Fred Turner and powered by a team of world-leading doctors, scientists, engineers, and health industry experts, Curative began focusing on COVID-19 testing in early March 2020 upon realizing the urgent need to scale COVID-19 test production in the United States. With a network of over 15,000 sites across over 20 states and three CLIA-certified, high-complexity laboratories, Curative and its managed medical entities have provided millions of COVID-19 tests and COVID-19 vaccines.

Beyond COVID-19, Curative is using its unique healthcare delivery expertise to reimagine the way we deliver and experience healthcare in America. positionName: Sr. Business Analyst (El Monte, Los Angeles, CA)
description:
Job Description
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the Loan Operations business units in data analytics tasks, Operational Excellence initiatives, and design & implementation of medium- to large-scale projects. This position will handle large amounts of data and design feasible solutions acting act as a liaison between the solution end users and the business partners (such as IT, Enterprise Project Management, etc.) and/or 3rd party vendors. This position will also be responsible for the management of Loan Operations projects, development of system business requirements and perform User Acceptance test. This position document procedures, deliver user training and provide training to junior business analyst.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analysis and generate ad hoc management reports based on the requests from business units
Act as a liaison between end users and business partners (such as IT, Change Execution, etc.) and/or 3rd party vendor to design feasible analytical and/or technical solutions for medium to large projects and operational needs
Develop appropriate process flow to improve efficiency and quality as well as meeting compliance/regulatory requirements
Write business requirements for system-related projects and work with IT and/or 3rd party vendor to ensure the successful solution delivery
Design and perform user acceptance test to ensure a system or application functions as expected
Manage project implementation on behalf of Loan Operations business teams
Present analysis result and/or project progress update to the management team, business units and business partners
Provide training to business unit end users on newly developed/upgraded systems
Identify the opportunities for data report automation and work with IT to materialize such opportunities
Assist in identifying data quality issues and recommend options and implement process improvements
Compile and maintain the documentation (such as procedures, guides, instructions, etc.) for critical applications, reports and daily business analytics processes
Provide support and training to other business analyst
Perform other miscellaneous tasks as requested
Qualifications
Master’s degree in finance, business, engineering, science or related fields or equivalent work experience
Minimum 5 to 7 years experience in banking industry preferably in commercial and mortgage lending
Demonstrable experience in process automation design and implementation
Excellent analytical skills, with experience performing complex data analysis
Excellent written, verbal and comprehension communication skills required
A self-starter, who can effectively navigate a complex organizational structure, achieving results through influence and collaboration
Ability to multi-task with attention to detail, adapt quickly to changes and work effectively in a fast-paced environment
Proficient in Microsoft Office with advanced Excel skills and intermediate SQL skills required
Working knowledge in IBS Insight, LPS, SAP Business Intelligence, and Passport applications are preferred
Good leadership skills required
Primary Location: El Monte, Los Angeles, California
Schedule: Full-time
EMAIL YOUR RESUME

As a Competitive Intelligence Analyst you will become the authoritative source of industry data and trends. This person will work closely with our CTO and IT engineers to help shape winning strategies at Newegg. This person will need to understand our IT infrastructure and capabilities. Company Description
Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention; to care more about our clients’ brands; and to buy more products and services from them.
Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.
With a bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.
Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights; content and creative production; communications and strategy; finance and marketing; and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

positionName: Senior Research Data Analyst- Kaiser Permanente Bernard J. Tyson School of Medicine
description:
The Kaiser Permanente Bernard J. Tyson School of Medicine, Office of Research and Scholarship (ORS), Senior Research Data Analyst (SRDA) is responsible for making strategic data-related decisions by evaluating complex data processing, management, tracking and analysis as well as dissemination of their work within a research environment. This position reports to the ORS Research Data Manager for Research and Scholarly Support Services (RSS) Team.
The Senior Research Data Analyst works collaboratively with the RSS team and Research Data Analyst staff to facilitate the data analysis and dissemination for the research and scholarly projects of students and faculty consisting of varying complexity in different areas of health-related research. Students and faculty bear primary responsibility for conducting their own research and scholarship and this team provides appropriate guidance and staff support to enable successful work to be undertaken.
Provide quantitative measurement, data analysis and dissemination expertise for ORS. Responsible for implementing established processes, as well as developing and applying innovative techniques for measuring, analyzing, and reporting on healthcare processes, health outcomes, and health costs.

Essential Responsibilities:
In consultation with the Research Data Manager, the SRDA initiates, coordinates, and facilitates analytical projects to meet utility care data analyses, faculty and student client needs and achieve programmatic and organizational objectives.
Facilitates effective communication and collaboration with stakeholders: senior leadership, librarian, statisticians, project managers, data analysts. Work may include collaborating on the development of plans for student and faculty study design and analysis; providing guidance or setting priorities for ongoing programming activities; participating in the review of analytic tables / results and dissemination.
Based on agreements of the KPSOM ORS Senior Associate Dean, Research Director, and Research Data Manager, the SRDA sets overall project direction to address key utility care analyses objectives and client needs. Assists in the prioritization of projects that compete for limited resources, and the scheduling and sequencing of work across projects to make the best use of utility care analyses resources.
Applies project leadership skills, methodological expertise, and knowledge of KP and external data and analytical resources to determine the scope, design, development, and implementation of utility care analyses projects, including partnerships with regional analytical groups and consultation with Health Plan and Medical Group subject area experts.
Advises the KPSOM ORS Senior Associate Dean, Research Director, and Research Data Manager on project staffing decisions.
May coach KPSOM ORS Research Data Analyst and RSS Team to accomplish project objectives and develop staff capabilities.
Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. Engages and sustains support among project participants, faculty and students. May represent the KPSOM ORS RSS Team with data analyses for external partners and clients in communications related to projects.
Applies analytic knowledge, skills and experience to perform project-related work, complete specific project tasks, and create project deliverables.
Basic Qualifications:
Experience
Minimum five (5) years of experience in an analytical environment required (w/ masters degree), OR
Minimum two (2) years of experience in an analytical environment required (w/doctoral degree).



Education
Masters degree. Disciplinary training in advanced quantitative measurement methods (mathematics or statistics), ideally in the context of a quantitative social science or health services research.



License, Certification, Registration
N/A



Additional Requirements:
Experience with analysis of large administrative databases and computer intensive statistical analysis (preferably using SAS), multivariate statistical methods, general research methodology.
Proven leadership skills in project management and consulting. Must exhibit efficiency, collaboration, candor, openness, and results orientation.
Demonstrated effectiveness in written and verbal communication of technical material.
General knowledge or work experience in one or more of the following areas: disease management, survey design, health status measurement, qualitative analysis, case-mix or health risk adjustment methods, research methods.
Demonstrated ability to effectively design, develop, manage, and coordinate analytical efforts among multiple constituents.
Excellent project management skills, including setting priorities and developing work plans assembling project teams, structuring and executing quantitative analyses, overseeing support staff, and meeting deadlines.
Skills in analytical methods including problem and model formulation, algorithm selection, and development of overall solution strategy.
Creativity, critical thinking, and excellent problem-solving skills.
Outstanding written and verbal communication and effective interpersonal skills.



Preferred Qualifications:
Minimum seven (7) years of experience in an analytical environment in health care preferred.
Experience with Research design, methodology, and consultation.
Experience consulting on the design and implementation of research projects preferred.
Doctorate degree.
Knowledge of healthcare industry, especially healthcare analytics preferred.
Familiarity with Kaiser Permanente healthcare system preferred.

Job Posting Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Department: BI/ Data Insights Group
Location: Burbank, CA

About Us:
ViacomCBS Streaming (formerly CBS Interactive) is a division of ViacomCBS that encompasses both free, paid, and premium streaming services including Pluto TV, Paramount+, CBS Sports Digital, and CBS News Digital.

Role Details:
Data plays a central role at ViacomCBS Streaming, and as part of the Data & Insights Group (DIG), Business Intelligence Analysts are key to delivering actionable insights for our leadership teams to act upon. The BI Analyst is responsible for developing and generating reports, insights, & analysis across multiple systems. You will be expected to identify business, marketing, and product opportunities, challenges, and trends and be able to communicate your findings effectively to a variety of stakeholders. This role will be primarily focused on data analysis work related to Paramount+ and other streaming initiatives.

Your Day-to-Day:
Build and manage reports showing the health of key performance metrics
Write SQL to query a data warehouse (BigQuery) for data in order to answer questions from a variety of stakeholders
Present insights and analysis to different teams and stakeholders
Develop and maintain statistical and spreadsheet models for forecasting, scenario planning, and other predictive work
Work closely with product, finance, and marketing teams to represent and capture business goals and initiatives
Develop automated dashboards and reports that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Make recommendations to the product, finance, and marketing teams on tactical adjustments to improve performance
Support A|B testing tasks with exploratory analysis, sample size calculations, and test analysis

Key Projects:
Building dashboards (using Tableau and other BI tools) that illustrate how key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics are changing over time
Refining reports, dashboards, and insights based on the needs of a rapidly changing business
Live Sports and Premiere Event reporting focused on content performance and audience acquisition
Supporting monthly and quarterly reporting initiatives
Developing our standard reporting for product KPIs and questions
Owning the forecasting model for the portfolio of properties
Perform Ad Hoc analysis on specific business problems and summarize findings in an accurate, concise, easy-to-understand manner

Qualifications:
You Have:
BA/BS or equivalent training and experience in Business Analytics
2-3+ years of experience in digital media with data analysis as a key component of the work
Can provide accurate information in a usable form and on a timely basis.
Can communicate clearly and succinctly, adjust to a variety of styles and audiences and tell compelling stories with data
Proficiency in web analytics, video analytics (Adobe Analytics and/or other robust data solutions)
Experience with SQL and/or other query languages
Experience with Python or other scripting languages
Adept with presentation tools and services (Google Docs, Tableau, Google Data Studio, Keynote, PowerPoint, etc.)
Must successfully pass a background check

You might also have:
Strong mathematics, statistics background
Experience using project management tools like those from Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience using Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
A background in SVOD/AVOD/TVE or other subscription-based digital services

positionName: Senior Analyst, Data Technology & Performance Operations
description:
Data Tech and Operation Sr. Analyst – Performance Media Group
Sony Pictures built a best-in-class data foundation and launched an in-house Digital Media Buying team. This team is entrepreneurial at its core: laying the foundation of a new internal marketing function while growing and evolving to meet the needs of Sony’s business. All members are expected to come in with a start-up mentality (ambitious, hands-on, etc.) – eager to build the future digital-first workforce of Sony Pictures.
Job Duties:
The Sr. Analyst will be responsible for hands-on operation within the following, but not limited to, environments – e.g. CRM (OSDS 3.0 and/or others) data operation and Salesforce Audience Studio (formerly Krux). In addition, he/she will be responsible to develop analytical insights based on 1st party data:
CRM Audiences Operation: The Sr. Analyst will be tasked to operate within Sony own-and-operated 1st party data platform (OSDS). He/she will be responsible for working closely with the data science group as well as any other external agencies in delivery Sony 1st party data to the designated platforms for activation. He/She will troubleshoot any technical issues to ensure smooth activation for each marketing campaign.
DMP Audiences Operation: The Sr. Analyst will be tasked to operate within a Data Management Platform (SF Audience Studio). This will include, but not limited to, collaborating with internal IT team and external agencies in tagging on Sony web & media assets pre-campaign; building/deploying audience segments based on engagement signals; performing QA, while troubleshooting any technical related issue to ensure smooth activation for each marketing campaign.
External Data Operation: The Analyst will assist the PBM team in pushing for, coordinating and troubleshooting integrations between various publishers, as well as internal partners, and Sony’s DMP. He/she will assist in coordinating communications between SPE partners to the internal teams and ensure audiences data is passed seamlessly to Sony for retargeting and measurement purposes.
Audiences Activation: The Sr. Analyst will require great communication and organizational skill in assisting PBM team to communicate all audience related information to ensure a flawless audience-centric media execution, including but not limited to, developing and delivering data activation plan with PBM team; liaising between internal media team, the Performance Marketing Group (PMG), and external agencies while delivering all necessary data/material (e.g. budget).
Audience Technology: The Sr. Analyst will assist the PBM team in assessing technology platforms/data partners. This will include coordinating testing schedule with internal and agency planning teams, maintaining a schedule of all legal related projects to ensure these new partners are properly vetted with the necessary security protocols, and working with the Analytics team in establishing measurement goal (success KPIs).
Analytics & Reporting: The Sr. Analyst will collaborate with PBM team in running various pre, mid and/or post-campaign analyses, across movie release campaigns, using DMP collection & activation/performance data (e.g. Audience profiling and Audience performance report). He/She will share and present insights/findings with to larger department.
Advanced Audience Analytics: The Sr. Analyst will be involved in a variety of analytical projects spanning various data sources (including DMP data, partner sandbox, etc.). He/She will work with the data science team while sharing insights with the internal media team.
Miscellaneous: As Sony’s internal data operations and performance media group grow and evolve, it will be critical for the Sr. Analyst to support the education of our internal teams (audience data capture & activation). The Analyst will support the PBM team in regular knowledge-share sessions to socialize DMP strategic updates to internal and external team.
Job Requirements:
B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Marketing, Statistics, or related fields
1 to 3 years of experience in ad tech, performance media, media analytics, or data/audience marketing
Work cross-functionally across the company, including with Media stakeholders (planning and activation), Data Scientists, IT, External vendors, and more to execute upon audience activation
Demonstrate ability in working with Excel (PivotTables, Pivot Graph, Data Table, etc.), Word, and PowerPoint
Experience in any DMP, DSP, social media buying platform, or data onboarding system
Proficient in SQL with working experience is a plus
Ability to:
Operate in data management and onboarding platforms
Compiling large data sets while developing insights from the data
Collaborating with PBM team on a variety of projects
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with different teams across the organization on deliverables
Proficient in Excel with an analytical thought process
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and maintain strong attention to detail
Excellent communication and presentation skills both verbal and written
Work under pressure and with short deadlines across multiple teams with fragmented, vertical (title-by-title) prioritiesSony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.

Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.
Delivering first-in-class content in the best and most engaging ways possible while equipping our people to do so requires an incredible amount of talent… and technology. The technology and operations group covers things like the company’s data strategy, content delivery systems, master control operations, broadcast engineering, advertising technology, and the technology platform for HBO Max, while also supporting the everyday underpinnings of our company. Join our community of extraordinary team members who are truly building the tools that will run the future of entertainment.
Join us. Shape your story here.
The Job

Warner Bros. Technical Operations Inc. seeks a Sr Analyst, Data Intelligence & Reporting for the International Operations: Global Client Relations & Content Dist department. The primary responsibility of this role will be to support data-driven supply chain operational excellence, and continuous improvement, through effective development and application of data intelligence methodologies, data tools, and tracking/reporting protocols. Focus areas will include end-to-end execution of direct to consumer and business to business content distribution pipelines, beginning with content readiness and planning through successful delivery of content to our various endpoints.

The role will be responsible for determining the type of data insights necessary for the business to monitor progress and prioritize improvement projects that align with business priorities. Effective partnering with key stakeholders and SMEs to determine which data visualization approach will be used to present the data for end users be expected.

This role will work with complex data and will need to be comfortable transforming raw data into actionable visual insights that will be important to the business, as well as to provide recommendations on process improvements based on data results. The Analyst will also help to define KPI’s necessary to manage the business effectively and work to gather business requirements and present to other reporting aspects of the company to ensure all groups work together to provide effective reporting solutions.

The Daily

Data Analysis, Data Science and Continuous Improvement
Perform data analysis activities on an array of reporting needs of varying size\length\risk – these will range from performance insights to business decisions
Design, develop, implement and maintain predictive analytical models and dashboards using appropriate data mining and statistical tools to evaluate historical performance and forecast future performance to determine operational capability and related needs
Analyze and model internal value chain data and other supply chain data sets.
Establish automated KPIs dashboards, reports, and predictive models to help teams make faster better decisions and to highlight and address performance needs
Partner with the operations, product, data and business teams to answer high-priority strategic questions
Support improvement in our operational models use of data-driven intelligence to highlight areas for improvement, or to support business decisions.
Gather and document data workflows, data logic, and system functional requirements to adequately capture data needs across applicable operational workflows.
Complete gap-analysis on new and existing workflows and processes as it pertains to data flow
Identify how to provide efficiency and streamline new and existing business process through data application
Provide process improvement recommendations to the business through gaining an understanding of the relevant workflows and by applying related data modeling to support conclusions.
Stakeholder and Participant Engagement

Work closely with business users to define and deliver effective data visualizations for performance management, planning and requirements building purposes.
Encourage engagement from all teams into the strategic approach to improvements and new initiatives
Effectively prioritize ongoing projects by actively partnering with the wider business to understand their goals and objectives
Liaison between stakeholders, operations and technology teams (including 3rd party outsourcers) ensuring that all parties have the information needed to be able to do their jobs, make effective and metrics-based decisions and drive forward objectives and outcomes.
Delivery Management And Training

For certain initiatives, manage the implementation of a project to its completion. This may involve project planning, reporting, risk and issue management, communications planning etc.
Ensure the targeting goal has been communicated clearly to stakeholders and achieved
Ensure new data views are achieving intended results, post implementation
Develop and implement consistent business rules and concepts across various functions as a tool for implementing new products with stakeholders
Train fellow employees on best practices for data visualization and help others be successful stewards of our tools. Transform the way our business users consume data and insights through highly usable and visually stunning data products and the understanding of how to read data and report on it.
The Essentials
5+ years of relevant experience:
Delivering business intelligence and dashboard solutions
Expert in Tableau, Power BI and data visualization design
Analyzing, compiling, cleansing, interpreting, joining and staging data
Working with an Enterprise Data Warehouse and/or SQL Server databases
Demonstrable skills building responsive data visualizations
Working in an Agile development environment
Research product and technical data in order to recommend products, technologies, and processes for ongoing projects
Experience in creating reporting and data roadmaps and execution in a team environment
Experience in using data to determine process improvement opportunities
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Supply Chain Management with relevant work experience required
Master’s Degree in Predictive Analytics or similar desired
Proficient experience with programming and conducting analyses using data scripting languages (e.g SQL, Python, R, SAS, etc.), or similar analytical languages.
Advanced experience pulling and analyzing large and complex data sets (preferably using programmatic methodologies). Ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations
Proven ability to produce high quality data insights in a fast paced environment
An expert who can tell a story with data, as well as visualize it with a variety of tools (Tableau, SAP BusinessObjects, Excel, etc)
Strong background in data relationships, modeling and mining
Experience working with non-structured databases and evolving data systems
Providing expertise to data engineers on how to structure data to future proof data reporting solutions
Ability to work on teams and to collaborate on reporting solutions
Ability to train employees on how to pull reports and read data
Ability to create executive level presentations summarizing business problems and improvements using data
Familiarity with Six Sigma methodologies
Excellent Analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills
Superior customer service skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills to all levels and various functions within the company
Ability to work independently and problem solve with little to no direction
Willingness and ability to learn in a fast-paced environment
Ability to teach and train effectively
Experience managing multiple, simultaneous projects
Must be able to organize and schedule work effectively
Must be able to work well under time constraints
Must be able to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities, communicating changes in scope and schedule to all parties concerned
Must be able to work flexible hours, including possible overtime, when necessary
Must be able to maintain confidentiality
Leadership to drive change and influence others

Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies

Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Who We Are
Since 1987, DocMagic has been solving the mortgage industry's toughest challenges with innovative technology solutions! By anticipating a change in advance of industry trends, DocMagic delivers unmatched service, compliance expertise, and strategic digital transaction management in support of our customers.
Position Summary
The Business Analyst will provide overall functional design guidance in the evolution of an enterprise software application suite. This position will provide broad cross-domain and cross-disciplinary expertise in establishing the scope that will be used to design and develop DocMagic's software solution. As a member of the project team, the analyst will work in an interactive environment with business and technical staff to ensure a high degree of collaboration in support of a successful overall solution. Responsibilities for this role will include working with writing business requirements, designing and testing software solutions, developing business specification artifacts for the Company, and collaborating with a highly skilled software development team.
Essential Functions
Will utilize software development design tool and processes (i.e. JIRA, confluence, Gliffy, etc)
Identify potential impacts and/or gaps in terms of organization, business, and processes between current customer situations and the desired and-state of the software solution.
Effectively analyze software solutions to validate the application for business and technical requirements while guiding the improvement of the application.
Design complex software products including the deployment of multiple versions/releases of a large product.
Anticipate and appropriately escalate forthcoming issues and risks of the software solution and will partner with teams to address software defect analysis, troubleshooting and resolution.
Develop and create design specifications and functional design documentation and comply with established design principles, standards, and procedures for software development.
Prepare and present written and verbal concepts to the software development team.
Partner and collaborate with business stakeholders and software development team on projects and initiatives
Effectively and efficiently provide responses to project intake forms and BRDs ascertaining sponsor and stakeholder high-level requirements and estimates.
Assess and establish requirements and timeboxes for new features or initiatives. Define procedures for signoff and execution preparatory for software development.
Act as a BA on one or more scrums teams, writing, Jira epics, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Other Skills

Golden State Water Company is one of the largest investor-owned water utilities in the United States. We have been all about water for more than 80 years. Our team of professionals delivers reliable, quality water and great service to customers in 75 communities across California.


POSITION DEFINITION: Senior Regulatory Analyst

Under general supervision, the Senior Regulatory Analyst performs a wide variety of substantive and complex analytical, business, regulatory and ratemaking-related tasks that affect the operations of the company. This includes, ensuring that the Regulatory Affairs department complies with regulatory requirements and filings. The Senior Regulatory Analyst provides regulatory and analytical support to managers and staff to assist team members in making technical presentations to regulatory agencies and related public agencies.

Accountability

The Senior Regulatory Analyst may take responsibility for the independent management and delivery of regulatory projects, coordinating efforts across multiple business units. This includes, following departmental procedures to complete work and prioritizing own work at times. Subsequently, the Senior Regulatory Analyst must be able to anticipate consequences of actions, potential problems or opportunities for change with responsibility for acting decisively in critical situations in order to circumvent a potential problem. The Senior Regulatory Analyst, in concert with the regulatory team, is accountable for developing the business case for water rates, which includes review of expenses, capital budgets, water sales, revenues, and CPUC policies. Communication includes data gathering and coordination with operations and finance personnel as well as representing the company in communications with CPUC staff.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Writes testimony and testify in formal hearings at the CPUC
Performs complex analyses and studies regarding the company’s water supply, water use, cost-of-service, infrastructure financing, water rates, and other business, operational, or technical matters
Writes formal applications and prepares testimony for rate cases and advice letter filings
Performs primary statistical and analytical studies as it relates to monthly statistical revenues, sales, expenses, rate base reports and other financial data for its impact relative to the Company’s water rates
Supports project teams on rate case filings
Testifies as a witness in CPUC evidentiary hearings. Participates in regulatory investigation and rule-making proceedings
Provides training to company personnel regarding regulatory matters
Represents the Regulatory Affairs Department in Inter-Company committees, task groups, etc.
Interfaces with CPUC staff on a project or major component of GRC application
Supports the Manager and other team members with long-range planning matters
Develops and maintains spreadsheets, databases, and other computer tools to input and retrieve data, and to support a variety of business and operational needs
Prepares routine and complex correspondence, reports and regulatory filings
Prepares written reports for the Board of Directors and Officers of the Company
Performs analysis and forecasting that may include access to employee data that is considered confidential, private and sensitive
Responsible for maintaining internal controls in accordance with Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) and coordinating directly with internal and external auditors
Performs other duties as assigned


QUALITIES OF A SUCCESSFUL PERSON IN THIS POSITION

The successful Senior Regulatory Analyst has the ability to:

Analyze situations accurately and take effective action
Reason logically and creatively
Utilize a variety of analytical and research techniques to resolve complex utility or regulatory problems
Work well with others
Maintain composure under stressful situations
Complete assignments independently or with minimal supervision
Work productively and effectively when faced with time pressures, disruptions, or multiple responsibilities
Make sound decisions based on the information available
Speak clearly and concisely
Present key facts, points, or inferences in writing in a clear, organized, and concise format
Read, interpret, and analyze data and present ideas and information effectively
Write a complex report that includes facts, conclusions, and recommendations
Read and understand technical materials
Interpret and synthesize information across different or multiple sources


MINIMUM POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in accounting, mathematics, economics, business, engineering, environmental or resource planning, or a related discipline
Five years of verifiable work experience in accounting or finance or utility regulatory analysis
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in researching, analyzing and preparing statistical and analytical studies
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to prepare statistical and analytical studies using spreadsheets and word processing software
Proven ability of completing multiple project assignments
Utility experience preferred
Proficiency in Microsoft applications (advanced Excel skills preferred)


Other Required Skills:

Trustworthy; strong personal integrity; emotional maturity
Demonstrates high level of accountability and ownership
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Solid presentation skills
Executes with discipline and urgency
Collaborative/Team oriented
Exhibits professionalism with internal and external contacts
Organized with strong attention to detail and time management skills
High degree of initiative; self-starter
The nature of the job may require some travel and requires the Senior Regulatory Analyst to work well with others in multi-tasking situations. The above job description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all responsibilities, skills or competencies associated with this job.

May include but not limited to standing, climbing, walking, lifting, bending, pulling and/or pushing, grasping, reaching, stooping and crouching, sitting, typing, walking, reading, writing, color determination, speaking, and listening for extended periods of time.


The responsibilities of this position will involve access to information that may be considered confidential, private and sensitive. Therefore, the individual filling this position will be required to both allow and pass a background check.


Note: Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with special needs to perform the essential functions.

Angi® is the home for everything home. From repairs and renovations to products and financing, Angi is transforming every touch point in home services. With over 25 years of experience and a network of nearly 250,000 pros, we have helped more than 150 million people with their home needs. Our products and technology help our customers love where they live while helping small businesses grow and thrive. We believe the home is the most important place on earth and we are at the beginning of our ambitious journey to redefine how people care for their homes - join us!

About the role:

Angi is seeking a strong Senior Business Analyst to join the Category Management team. This team seeks to develop targeted strategies, tailored solutions, and optimized operations to address the unique needs of the Homeowners and Service Professionals that we serve – all in the belief that this is necessary to unlock and further accelerate the company's growth. This is a unique opportunity to work on Angi's highest growth revenue initiatives, from early testing through scaling.

Our business is a two-sided marketplace of homeowners and service professionals. This makes our analytic opportunities complex and rich. We work daily with product, operations, BI, and other departments across the organization to develop, refine, and monitor results of initiatives designed to drive outsized value. Due to the multifaceted nature of our business, our team provides an excellent environment to combine and apply your business acumen, technical knowhow and quantitative skills to drive insights.

You will be responsible for driving impact through exploratory analyses, AB test deconstruction, KPI development and report/dashboard construction for the Home Exterior team.

What you'll do:

Provide data-driven insights and analyses for the Category Management team and category-related initiatives across the organization
Develop your technical skills – particularly in SQL, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, Looker, and R
Partner with our product team to model strategies for new products, provide insights to help shape roadmaps and develop test ideas
Collaborate across operations and various analytics teams developing exploratory models that uncover marketplace dynamics, user behavior insights and levers to affect each
Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and be the subject matter expert on Home Exterior data
Synthesize large data sets into digestible information
Establish statistical models and reporting to seed strategic ideation and monitor execution
Pursue new approaches to solving problems with creativity and innovation

What we're looking for:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technical field such as Business Analytics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, etc.
3-5+ years of professional experience in a financial/business analysis role
Advanced SQL experience and knowledge of relational databases, Tableau, Looker, or Adobe Analytics experience a plus
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information and presenting concise analyses
Prior, small company or start-up experience a plus
Exceptional quantitative skills and aptitude
Strong grasp of statistics and statistical software (R, Python, etc.)
Humble and effective cross-functional team player
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Intellectual curiosity balanced with an orientation for getting stuff done
Ability to validate results of analyses by reconciling with data from other sources
Attention to detail, a sense of urgency, and relentless follow through
Compensation & Benefits:

Commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living
This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package
Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)
The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

positionName: Experienced Consultant - Data Engineering and Analytics
description:
Ready to thrive in the next step on your career journey?
West Monroe is seeking an experienced Data Engineering & Analytics Consultant to join our emerging Data Engineering Practice in the Los Angeles office developing technology solutions for our clients in the data warehousing and BI space. This is an excellent opportunity to work within our Information Management team with Fortune 250 clients developing BI strategy and roadmaps, implementing new customer facing reporting and analytics platforms, while gaining exposure to a variety of industries including Healthcare & Lifesciences, Consumer & Industrial Product, Energy & Utilities, and Financial Services/Banking.

Responsibilities:
Work closely with our clients as part of a development team to evaluate requirements and develop business intelligence and data warehousing solutions
Design and develop data warehouse database schemas
Design and develop extract, transform, and load (ETL) mappings, procedures, and schedules
Design and develop reports, dashboards, KPIs, and data extracts
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS 'big data' technologies.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.

Qualifications:

Working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience and knowledge of relational databases, data modeling, and ETL tools

positionName: Business Intelligence Analyst, Content Discovery & Insights
description:
Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from ViacomCBS, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream ViacomCBS Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage. Role Details:
This BI Analyst will be responsible for developing and generating reports, insights, & analysis across multiple systems, focused on content discovery and content performance. You will be expected to identify business, content strategy and product opportunities, challenges, and trends and be able to communicate your findings effectively to a variety of stakeholders in the content and product vertical. This role will be primarily focused on data analysis work related to Paramount+ Your Day-to-Day:
Define and deliver KPIs and reporting, that will inform product and content strategy
Write SQL to query a data warehouse (BigQuery) for data in order to answer questions from various partners in the product vertical, focused on (but not limited to) content discovery, performance and features
Collaborate with measurement operations and data teams to ensure appropriate tracking is in place to perform needed reporting and analysis
Present insights and recommendations to the business in a clear, confident and understandable manner
Utilize reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau, Data Studio and Adobe Analytics to create dashboards that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Research industry trends and communicate how these could potentially impact the business Key Projects (examples):
Conduct reporting and analyses to service product and content strategy needs
Build dashboards (using Tableau and other BI tools) that illustrate how key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics are changing over time
Refine reports, dashboards, and insights based on the needs of a rapidly changing business
Support monthly and quarterly reporting initiatives
Develop our standard reporting for product and content KPIs and questions
Perform Ad Hoc analysis on specific business problems and summarize findings in an accurate, concise, easy-to-understand manner Qualifications:

You Have:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience
2-3 years experience in digital marketing/entertainment sector
Can provide accurate information in a usable form and on a timely basis.
Demonstrable experience in translating data into insights in a clear and succinct manner, adjusting to a variety of styles and audiences
Expert in SQL
Knowledgeable in Tableau; Adobe Analytics; Data Studio
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Great presentation and communication skills, with the ability to convey concepts to partners at all levels
Ability to work in a fluid environment, against tight deadlines
Interest in television, entertainment and pop culture
Must successfully pass a background check You might also have:
Strong mathematics, statistics background
Experience using project management tools like those from Atlassian (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience using Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)
Experience with A/B Testing
A background in SVOD or other subscription-based digital services
