Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

About the opportunity:

SWCA is looking for a Field Data Collection Analyst with experience in each phase of the product management lifecycle. This position will be responsible for managing our mobile data collection systems used for collecting spatial and scientific data for environmental resource projects in a mostly offline environment.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With almost 40 offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.
This is a great opportunity to join a small dynamic team and use technology to better our natural environment.
This position is available for distributed work in the US.
What you will accomplish:

The Field Data Collection Analyst role at SWCA will serve as the primary point of contact for tablet standards, policies, and functionality for the successful development of a companywide system for managing mobile data collection.
Their responsibility is to lead the effort of creating a scalable tablet program to reduce frustrations, inefficiencies, and inconsistencies across the company. They will work collaboratively with business and technology teams crafting and executing necessary strategies to integrate governance across business lines, service lines, and regional operations. The Tablet Analyst must have a demonstrated ability to understand business concepts, including the ability to critically evaluate change management techniques and breaking down high-level projects into targeted deliverables. They must be comfortable working with different stakeholders and be open-minded to new and changing approaches to ensure the desired solution is achieved.
Responsibilities include:
Assess the status of mobile data collection across the company.
Prepare product requirement documents that define the requirements and functionality for mobile data collection.
Support the ongoing research and assessment of the mobile data collection experience at SWCA.
Define and maintain the product roadmap and strategy and manage the mobile data collection program through the product development life cycle.
Develop a product portfolio/guide that includes recommended hardware, software, roles and responsibilities, and purchasing frequency based on business needs.
Consider the current ecosystem of tablet use and management including involvement in troubleshooting current issues to identify pain points and opportunities for improvements.
Work with tablet users to get feedback and conduct needs analyses for future tablet development efforts.
Research mobile solutions and validate options through collaboration and experimentation.
Collaborate with Technology teams including Information Security, Procurement and User Support for equipment procurement and tablet security measures.
Collaborate with GIS leadership for ESRI application releases, training, and GPS requirements.
Collaborate with Technical Directors and VPs of Scientific and Technical Services on best management practices for data collection.
Articulate your solutions effectively to technology team leads and then to senior leadership for incorporation into each P&L’s capital expense annual budget.
Develop training materials such as demonstrations and workshops for tablet users.
Work with Technology Support team to develop a tablet troubleshooting protocol.
Experience and qualifications for success:
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Software Development, Geography (with an emphasis/certificate in GIS), or related field with experience in Business Information Systems, Technology Development, User Experience (UX), or database development/management or related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience managing data collected via mobile data collection systems.
Prior experience defining, launching, and maintaining technology products.
Demonstrated experience developing business cases for products based on business context, client needs, and financial analysis.
Experience assessing, documenting, and presenting user requirements.
Familiarity with spatial data collection platforms such as ArcGIS Online/Portal via Collector/Survey123.
Familiarity with commercial off-the-shelf or open-source data collection platforms such as Fulcrum, iForms, Wildnote, Open Data Kit (ODK), etc.
Experience documenting workflows, preparing, and presenting training material to technical and non-technical audiences.
PREFERRED or HELPFUL
Previous experience as a product manager or similar role managing mobile data collection systems at an enterprise level.
Experience working with remotely managed devices through Mobile Data Management systems.
A working understanding of agency internal processes and procedures and positive existing relationships with federal land management and regulatory agencies, such as the BLM, USFS, NPS, BOR, DOE, DOT, Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS), U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), and/or U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS).
Proven experience with a subset of public lands, natural and cultural resource issues, wind projects, transportation projects, oil/gas projects, and/or renewables projects.
SWCA Environmental Consultants is a growing employee-owned firm, providing a full spectrum of environmental services. With offices across the United States, SWCA is one of the largest environmental compliance firms and ranks among Engineering News-Record’s Top 200 Environmental Firms.

This contact information is for disability accommodation requests only. All other inquiries will not receive a response.

Overview:
Assisting the Product Owner, this position will be responsible for working with the greater Honda team (including field and finance company) and dealers to facilitate the transformation towards online sales. Additionally, this role will focus on improving digital and physical processes in key business areas related to: OEM and dealer websites, digital retailing customer experience, optimizing each step in the digital/in store purchase process (technology and organization) and data management and analysis relating to retailing.
The right candidate will exhibit excellent communication and organizational skills, the ability to build strong relationships in the office and the field, and with our cross-functional teams.

The Role You Will Play:

Experience designing and executing custom analyses that support client business objectives

Excellent written and verbal communication skills: ability to tell a compelling story with data
Strong attention to detail

Experience with Relational Databases (e.g. – SQL Server) and Business Intelligence tools (e.g. – Tableau) (preferred)

Internet Brands is looking for a Sr. Manager Data Analytics to support our Legal vertical (e.g. Avvo.com, Nolo.com, Lawyers.com, Martindale.com).

The Ideal Candidate:

You are an organized self-starter with a keen business sense who loves digging into data to understand trends and performance. You have a passion for manipulating large volumes of data, building dashboards, and have a consistent focus on efficiency. You easily understand requirements and communicate the progress of your work. You have a bias for action and know when to apply the 80/20 rule. You’re also a great teammate who likes a rapidly changing environment and wants to join a company that offers a ton of opportunities to build your skills.

The Manager’s primary role is to be responsible for insights and analysis support. To achieve this, they will guide other analysts on the team or by directly providing the information. This position requires an ability to understand the key metrics of a business and interpret the results to the business owners. They will work in a project team-oriented and dynamic environment which will require working closely with other teams and adjusting to new developments as they arise. Various software packages and tools will be utilized to collect, mine, and report on this data. Strong analytical and communication skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines are critical for this position.

In this role, you will:

Provide insightful summaries and next step recommendations of projects to the business owners.
Create insightful, easy-to-understand visualizations that provide performance, trending, and benchmarking analysis to meet business needs.
Manage and mentor other analysts in generating visualizations, analysis, and insights.
Performing advanced analysis of web traffic, email engagement, and app engagement data to measure the success of programs, including click-through analysis, retention, re-engagement, and A/B testing.
Become a subject matter data (and business) expert related to appointed areas of responsibility.
Collaborate with agile engineering teams to design flexible solutions to support analytic needs.
Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations to what-if scenarios, to deep dives, uncovering patterns, identify trends, and new opportunities.
Manage and prioritize requests from stakeholders and set expectations
Required Qualifications:
Experience (6+ years) in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.
Experience coaching and developing advanced analysts.
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills including experience in supporting and communicating data-driven analyses to various departments and stakeholders.
Highly Proficient (3+ years) with creating, maintaining, and optimizing Tableau workbooks.
Highly Proficient (4+ years) in using SQL for data analysis and reporting.
Advanced Excel skills are required.
Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize workload and roadmaps.
Excellent business and product sense
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using web analytic tools (Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics)
Experience working with Data Engineering, Marketing, Product, and Sales teams
Experience in modeling with R or Python

location: 2120 E Grand Ave, El Segundo, CA 90245
description:
Location: El Segundo, CA


Education Required: Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in math, engineering, business, or the sciences.


Skills Required:
At least eight (8) equivalent years of experience performing Acquisition Management and Planning activities in the government (military and/or civil servant), federally funded research and development center, or profit / non-profit government support / development Contractor arena. Two (2) years shall include duties/assignments specifically in support of space acquisition programs.
Bachelor’s degree in Management, Business, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Engineering, Technology, Engineering, or Operations Research is required.
Knowledge of various quantitative techniques used to analyze data, develop models, interpret results and brief senior level DoD leadership.
Must be able to work independently, as well as with at team, on time-sensitive high visibility tasks.
Knowledge of DoD budgetary principles and procedures.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities.
Demonstrated knowledge of acquisition management regulations, practices, policies, and procedures associated with Major Defense Acquisition Programs.
At least two (2) years of experience using Software Tools: MS Office, MAR Reporting-PMRT/SMART, and CCaR.
Active Department of Defense Secret Clearance (required).
US citizenship (required).


Responsibilities:
The Acquisition Management and Planning Analyst performs a variety of acquisition management, planning, analysis duties in support of Air Force programs.
In this role, you will focus specifically on the acquisition management, planning, analysis and execution of enterprise cross-mission ground development, acquisition, and operations. You will interact with a multidisciplinary DoD technical workforce and defense hardware contractors in the accomplishment of their duties. You will evaluate and support the development of program documentation, which includes acquisition strategies, systems engineering plans, Integrated Master Plans and Contract Data Requirements Lists, for adherence to DoD and Air Force policies and guidance. Responsibilities and tasks will also include:

Perform market research and provide acquisition strategy recommendations
Advise and assist in organizing and establishing Integrated Product Teams
Analyze progress against program plan and schedule
Evaluate program plan for compliance with applicable DoD and Air Force policies and guidance
Draft and prepare written communication materials to include; program acquisition point papers, briefings, articles, media releases, communication plans, and responses to requests for information


Benefits:
We offer competitive salaries commensurate with education and experience. We have an excellent benefits package that includes:

Comprehensive health, dental, life, long and short term disability insurance
100% Company funded Retirement Plans
Generous vacation, holiday and sick pay plans
Tuition assistance

Benefits are provided to employees regularly working a minimum of 30 hours per week.

Apply now to connect with a company that invests in you.

Job Description:
The Video Operations group is seeking a Master Data Specialist for Asset Management/Archive and Servicing for branded original content. This position will be responsible for collection and maintenance of critical information necessary to describe, archive and distribute Original Content.

The Video Operations team focuses on creating the premiere video experience for all content types, with impact throughout the industry, for a worldwide digital audience.
Ideal candidates are not only passionate about entertainment, but also care deeply about the customer experience, and can contribute to a diverse organization with expertise in Partner Relations, TV App Services, Video Services, Technical Operations, and Quality Control.
Our responsibilities include working with internal partners, ingestion of all video, audio, timed text, and ancillary assets, collaborating with developers on integration into our platforms and services, along with supporting localization, accessibility, quality control and more. We are a group that thrives in a team oriented environment, utilizing analytical skills to compliment problem-solving abilities, to arrive at efficient
solutions— all in order to support our collective goal of providing a truly extraordinary global customer experience for our platforms.

Job Description
The Master Data Specialist will support the following:
Learn the inner workings of a studio title and metadata management operation and its contributors.Own the feed of enterprise dates to support business related content distribution to multiple external and internal endpoints.Locate, acquire and manage acquisition of all required dates and associated metadata.Support creation of operating procedure documentation.Support implementation of new business initiatives resulting in metadata standards changes and new origination workflowsSupport systems development, data migration and data integrity projects.Assist in master title management as necessaryDesign and generate reporting / metrics as necessaryDemonstrate working knowledge of digital archival principle, collection management, and migrationOther responsibilities as assigned by Management

Key Qualifications
We are looking for 7+ years experience including education within the fields of library science, computer science or engineering or within Mastering/Archive/Asset Management related Operations at a Studio or Television related content company, or Post Production facility.
Ideal candidates will demonstrate skills and interest in the following areas:
You have a strong knowledge of EST/VOD, OTT, or SVOD distribution workflows or you have a strong interest in the media distribution businessYou have an interest in archive / library sciences, policy and best practicesYou have a working knowledge of metadata standards and concepts with an emphasis on descriptive metadata.You have created, developed and designed workflow and task management solutions for metadata gathering and quality control.You are familiar with studio rights and availability managementYou understand order management and media distribution workflowsYou can explain and drive system integration discussions and document data flowsYou have experience with SDLC (software development life cycle) projects and are able to prioritize tasks and projects accordinglyYou understand purchase order / request concepts and related financialsYou have a working understanding of domestic and localized international versioning (multiple languages, Standards and Practice review and version management)You are comfortable writing technical documentation to communicate technical requirements, conceptual designs and workflowsYou must be collaborative, organized and a team playerYou are able to work in a changing and evolving environmentYou must have the ability to make decision independentlyYou have excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with an ability to contribute to and understand the organization’s vision for the future
Education
College education preferred within the fields of library science, computer science or other allied discipline.

At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.
Consider applying here, if you want to:
Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact.
Develop lasting relationships with great people.
Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career.
We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members.
Sr. CI Analyst – Manufacturing Analytics
The Sr. CI Analyst – Manufacturing Analytics is responsible for supporting Niagara Bottling plants and corporate teams through cleaning, manipulating, and conducting research on all distribution and warehouse (D&W) data, and applying this data to sophisticated analytics programs to drive decisions and support. Through leveraging key partnerships, and developing a deep understanding of the business this role is responsible for delivering solutions to various business problems and drive process optimization across all domestic and international manufacturing plants.
Essential Functions
Data Analysis:
Design, develop, and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly D&W performance reports that provide information used in the decision-making process of various initiatives/projects.
Provide analysis on D&W, procurement, inventory, financials, etc. in direct support of the technical services team and Niagara leadership team’s needs.
Develop data models to aid in better understanding the impact of manufacturing activities to Key Performance Indicators of the manufacturing sites.
Develop necessary D&W reporting and analyses for Plant sites and Plant regions.
Collaboratively and independently assist in the analysis of data through extracting and defining relevant information.
Work with Business stakeholders to identify value added analytical opportunities
Prepare timely reports to highlight discrepancies in a dataset and accordingly suggest business rules to manage them.
Leverage statistical modeling and mathematical methods for projects and deep dive analysis
Provide analytical expertise and develop data analysis tools to assist in understanding and solving business problems
Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice
D&W Data Reporting:
Build and maintain KPI reporting for production performance for our network of manufacturing facilities
Conduct ad-hoc analysis
Work with IT to recommend new technologies for analytics and data science
Work with IT teams as a liaison for all D&W data solutions
Build predictive cost reduction models for D&W projects and initiatives
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
4 Years – Experience in Field or similar distribution, warehousing or manufacturing environment
2 Years – Experience managing people/projects
 *experience may include a combination of work experience and education
Preferred Qualifications:
6 Years– Experience in Field or similar distribution, warehousing or manufacturing environment
4 Years – Experience managing people/projectsexperience may include a combination of work experience and education
Competencies
Experience with scripting languages - R, Python, SQL, etc.
Deep knowledge of SQL to extract and transform data from various databases into meaningful analyses and reports.
Experience in various enterprise resource solution tools such as Oracle ERP, Oracle EBS.
Experience in data visualization platforms e.g., Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, Cognos etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Access)
Strong and proven analytical and strategic skills
Initiative and resourcefulness in completing work assignments with limited guidance.
Detail oriented with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects and complete assignments quickly and accurately.
Ability to effectively communicate and interpret, concisely, data to all team member levels.
Working knowledge of statistical models that can be used on large data sets to infer useful information
Problem Solving - identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully
Ability to work independently, asking for direction when needed
Oral Communication - speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; demonstrates presentation skills.
Team Work - balances team and individual responsibilities; contributes to building a positive team spirit; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives.
Written Communication - writes clearly and informatively; presents numerical data effectively; able to read and interpret written information.
Education
Minimum Required:
Bachelor's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar.)
Preferred:
Master's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar.)
Certification/License:
Required: N/A
Preferred: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt or Higher
Typical Compensation Range
Pay Rate Type: Salary
$90,090.00 - $10,500.00
Benefits
https://careers.niagarawater.com/us/en/benefits

Analytics experience with healthcare operations required
MSO/medical group operations setting preferred
Ability to oversee a team of 3
Experience with developing, improving, and aligning reports and reporting processes required
Analytics and reporting experience with healthcare operations data required
Strong understanding of and experience with KPIs, utilization management (UM), electronic data interchange (EDI), and claims
Assess and streamline reports and reporting processes
Extract and work with large data sets from EPIC
Strong understanding of Perform data analytics and reporting on
Advanced Excel and very strong SQL required
EPIC Tapestry experience strongly preferred; strong EMR/EHR system experience required
Communicate and collaborate effectively with others

Sr. Business Analyst
Torrance, CA
Contract
(Honda)
Please send resumes to kate.fox@elwoodprofessional.com
Company Profile:
Global automotive manufacturer
Began production in 1982 at the Marysville, OH location
State of the art plant, employs over 9,000 employees
Manufacture 680,000 vehicles per year and more than a million engines a year
What this Company Offers you:
Medical, Dental, Vison
Great work environment that offers long term stability
Holiday Pay
Shutdown Pay/Service Pay
Paid Days Off
Overview:
Assisting the Product Owner, this position will be responsible for working with the greater Honda team (including field and finance company) and dealers to facilitate the transformation towards online sales. Additionally, this role will focus on improving digital and physical processes in key business areas related to: OEM and dealer websites, digital retailing customer experience, optimizing each step in the digital/in store purchase process (technology and organization) and data management and analysis relating to retailing.
The right candidate will exhibit excellent communication and organizational skills, the ability to build strong relationships in the office and the field, and with our cross-functional teams.

The Role You Will Play:
Assist in championing online retailing transformation efforts within the organization including design, coordination, analysis and communicating.
Responsible for data-led recommendations, tracking, and reporting to improve the online retailing process across the business.
Facilitation with internal stakeholders, potential vendors (including selection process) and identified dealers in the promotion, support and maintenance of all initiatives related to the online retailing program.
Collaboration with team and key partners to drive adoption of online retailing.
Evaluate and provide guidance in market analysis of online retailing and programs including OEM and third-party tools.

Background Profile:
Must have Bachelor’s Degree or higher
Must have automotive experience and, ideally, automotive retail experience. Must be familiar with the automotive sales process and individual components
Strong presentation and data analysis skills
The ability to work with team members from different levels (executive leadership to business analysts) and different business units across the enterprise (Sales, Service, Marketing, Finance, IT)
Experience in budget coordination and project scheduling
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications specifically Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams
5+ years of Business Analyst experience
Experience with digital tools in the automotive space (retailing, website, marketing, analytics, etc.)
Familiarity with IT development processes and coordination
Experience in an Agile work environment
Experience in vendor selection through proposal (RFP) process

Please send resumes to kate.fox@elwoodprofessional.com

***Lexmark is a federal contractor and, in accordance with Executive Order 14042, requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Some positions may require additional customer-required screenings.***
Lexmark is currently seeking an exceptional IT Strategic Data Analyst to join our Continual Service Improvement (CSI) team. The successful candidate will work cross-departmentally to:
UNDERSTAND our key IT and business processes
DESIGN and DEVELOP reports, performance analytics, and dashboards
PROACTIVELY SUPPORT operations improvements, project monitoring and status, and strategic decisions for IT
Specific Responsibilities and Tasks
Provide thought leadership and data-driven insights for IT and business stakeholders by focusing on measurement and tracking of business value
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business and insight goals
Identify relevant KPIs and diagnostics to pursue
Analyze data and provide insights to drive better informed tactical improvements and strategic decisions
Prepare and present compelling analytical presentations and effectively communicate complex concepts to IT and business stakeholders
Monitor performance targets and quality standards, and take remediation action if necessary
Develop a plan for data governance and validation within core reports, KPIs, and metrics
Education and/or Experience Qualifications
3+ years of experience in report building and performance analytics
3+ years of experience in predictive intelligence and/or data science (machine learning / AI)
2+ years of experience working with a BI tool (Power BI preferred)
Ability to visualize data for varying audience levels
Knowledge in querying languages and how to build complex queries
Understanding of Javascript to support development of data collection jobs and advanced dashboards
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, look-up formulas) and Powerpoint
Preferred: Experience with ServiceNow reporting, including Performance Analytics Premium
Preferred: Knowledgeable in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), SSDL, and SDLC
Preferred: Experience and/or certification in ITIL 4 Foundation
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (business, statistics, economics, engineering, informatics, or an IT related field)
Communication, Engagement, and Focus
Build and maintain constructive relationships with IT practices and business units based on mutual trust and respect
Know the Lexmark business units’ functions and understand how decisions are made
Present a sharp vision of what can realistically be achieved, and deliver on commitments
Be persuasive and influential in presenting plans and ideas
Demonstrate advanced written and verbal communication skills
It is preferred this position be in Lexington, but will consider remote for a strong candidate.
**Relocation assistance will not be offered for this position.

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential
Rewards designed for you
Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work
Computershare celebrates the diversity of our people, and we welcome applications from everyone.
We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.
Covid-secure
We’ve kept our business running during the pandemic by moving most of our employees to remote working, and by creating and maintaining a safe environment for those people who need to be in the office. We carefully limit the amount of people at our locations and ensure that those who cannot work remotely are kept safe with proper distancing and protective equipment.
In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Overview:

With a focus on the Government, Kearney & Company provides financial services, including auditing, consulting, and technology services. Our commitment to our employees and clients as well as to dedication and trust, critical values to our Firm, have led to Kearney’s recognition as one of the leading accounting firms in the country. Based on our employees’ feedback, we are also consistently rated a Best Place to Work. Employment at Kearney means a flexible, collaborative, and open-minded work environment. We hope it is your “first easy decision.” Learn more at www.kearneyco.com/careers.
COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new Kearney team members will be required to comply with Executive Order (EO) 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID-19 Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, and the corresponding COVID-19 Workplace Safety: Guidance for Federal Contractors and Subcontractors issued by the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force, mandating Federal Contractors, including Kearney team members, to submit proof of vaccination status prior to their first day of employment. Prospective or new Team Members may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement by contacting the Director of Human Resources (covid-19@kearneyco.com /703-931-5600) and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Client site vaccination requirements, if different or more strict, will take precedence over Kearney’s vaccination policy, complying with the mandates mentioned above.

Job Summary:
The HRIS Analyst (Long Term Contract) is a Human Resource position reporting into the Corporate HR Manager. This position is responsible for the effective maintenance and ongoing management of the HRIS/Payroll System, UKG (formerly UltiPro).
This position is also responsible for reporting, analytics and day to day system troubleshooting and compliance. The HRIS Specialist is responsible for serving as the functional expert for the organization's HRIS/Payroll system and provide outstanding support to ensure data integrity and accuracy for all HRIS/Payroll transactions, procedures, report writing, and processes. The HRIS Specialist will partner with HR Reps and Payroll to collaborate on projects and daily priorities including but not limited to organization/position management , employee onboarding, payroll, benefits administration and dash boarding/analytics.

5-7 years related professional experience in a similar role
Understanding and/or experience in multiple disciplines of Human Resources and Benefits required
Experience with UKG report building and presenting metrics to management required
Advanced Microsoft Excel User
Must thrive in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and provide the necessary attention to the details required in HRIS and Payroll administration
Understanding of HR functions outside of the Analyst role (i.e. Benefits, Policy, Staffing, etc).
Daily Functions:
System Administrator for the ongoing configuration, integrations, and management of HRIS/Payroll System, UKG
Actively seek out knowledge on system modules and functionality
Act as Security Administrator responsible for all phases of system security including user/role updates, password resets and role review audits
Create and maintains monthly metrics for HR dashboard

Evaluate, test, and implement HRIS/Payroll system enhancements, upgrades and troubleshooting
Analyze data and provide analytical reports to internal customers on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Leads the day-to-day functional workflow including providing the HR/Payroll department team members with leadership, direction, and training, as well as leading continuous process improvement initiatives
Understands system requirements and ensures administration of data alignment with HRIS, Payroll and legal requirements
Assure company compliance with ACA reporting, EEO, payroll/tax updates, company audits and other laws and mandates that arise
Responsible for open enrollment participation, online session development, plan structure updates, feed file management, plan and rate updates and daily benefits reporting and auditing
Serves as company liaison and system administrator to UKG
Identify, understand, and communicate all UKG updates, events, problems and solutions to HR/Payroll Dept.
Dvelope UKG tutorials and trair users upon request
Set up demos and recommend adoption of future UKG enhancements
Responsible for transmission of biweekly 401k contribution and participant files
Works with users to support functionality and troubleshoot system-related problems Carry out other duties as appropriate and as assigned by his/her Manager

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Must be able to independently prioritize assignments based on urgency and communicate timelines effectively, Strong follow up skills
Must be able to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality
Must be able to identify areas of improvement and develop creative solutions
Must be able to identify system glitches, inaccurate set ups and troubleshoot effectively
Superior organization skills, quality and accuracy on all functions
Ability to analyze and interpret complex documents
Strong time and project management skills
Strong customer service mindset
Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
Education and/ or Work Experience Requirements
Preferred BA/BS degree in Human Resources or related degree, or equivalent in experience

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

positionName: Manager, Data Performance and Business Intelligence
description:
WORK LOCATION: A HYBRID WORK EXPERIENCE
At Wavemaker, we believe that work is a part of life, not the other way around. To support that belief, we have recently adopted a “collaboration-led” hybrid approach to work in order to provide employees with the flexibility to do the best work of their lives no matter where they are working. This means that for roles where it makes sense, you'll spend some of your time in our incredible workspaces (when it's safe to do so) and some of your time remote. Check out this updated list of where we can hire:
California – LA or SF
Colorado – Denver
Florida – Miami/Fort Lauderdale
Georgia – Atlanta
Illinois – Chicago
Massachusetts – Boston
Michigan – Detroit
New York – New York City tri-state area (NY, NJ, CT)
North Carolina – Raleigh/Durham
Texas – Austin or Dallas/Fort Worth
Utah – Salt Lake City
THE ROLE:
As the Manager, Data Performance and Business Intelligence your role is to support and own operations that are crucial to the Wavemaker promise of making smarter, faster decisions for its clients. In this role, you will leverage Wavemaker’s proprietary data solutions to meet our clients’ and Planning teams’ needs for data management and visualization. This position requires both a strategic and tactical viewpoint, aided by intellectual curiosity, strong problem-solving skills, along with an understanding of digital and traditional media. The ideal candidate is expected to demonstrate hands-on skills in data QA, data provisioning, processing, management, and analysis.
YOUR IMPACT:
Assist in the strategy and development of Business Intelligence platforms (Datorama) for data visualization and insight generation for use in campaign monitoring and optimization.
Perform data QA and help develop automated QA processes to ensure data accuracy and timeliness while working with vendors in troubleshooting.
Assist in the development of custom databases on the reporting platform and collect data requirements from teams to assist in database build.
Manage the retrieving, compiling, and formatting of large volumes of data.
Communicate technical terms to non-technical people and helping them understand why change might be required to achieve a specific goal or to complete a project.
 YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field with 3+ years’ professional work experience in data management or data analytics preferably in a marketing and/or media agency.
Strong experience with Datorama and data visualization as well as tools such as Alteryx.
Knowledge of visual techniques for data analysis and presentation is a plus.
Experience with database structures; experience working with Microsoft Azure and familiarity with SQL
Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focused, and comfortable with numbers.
Familiarity with data from web/ad measurement technologies such as: ad serving platforms (e.g. DFA, Sizmek), campaign management (e.g. Prisma), website analytics software (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics), paid search engine marketing data sources (e.g. Adwords, Marin, DoubleClick)
Ability to communicate and understand business requirements from non-technical stakeholders while simultaneously managing their expectations at the same time

ABOUT WAVEMAKER:
We believe there always is a better way to grow. We positively provoke growth for our clients by reshaping consumer decision-making and experiences through media, content, and technology. The Wavemaker way is globally consistent. Fueled by the world’s most powerful consumer data, we understand where and how marketing can intervene decisively to help brands win more sales.
Our name is our mission and our method. To make waves, you need to be provocative, even fearless. We do our best work for brave brands and people who want to be challenged to go further and faster. We know it’s not easy, but if it’s in you, we will get it out of you.
 Our 7,600 people across 90 markets provoke growth for some of the world’s leading brands and businesses. Our attitude of Positive Provocation is enabled by:
deep knowledge we have of our clients’ business
confidence to challenge what’s gone before
the support to go further than we thought possible
 We are a part of GroupM, WPP’s global media investment management company.
GroupM and all of its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

description:

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.

company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy & Autism Services
description:
Come join a team of passionate therapists providing excellent pediatric therapy to children throughout the United States! Achieve Beyond was founded in 1995 and is continuously growing to meet the needs of developmentally disabled children through our ABA, speech, occupational, and physical therapy. We currently offer our services in the entire metro New York area (including the five boroughs of NYC, Hudson Valley and Long Island) and Albany, New Jersey, Connecticut, Delaware, California (within in the greater Los Angeles and San Francisco areas), Florida, and the Virginia/ Maryland/ DC area. We specialize in conducting initial evaluations and providing ongoing services in home, community and clinic settings. Achieve Beyond is centered around a culture of collaboration and support to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards.
All of our clinicians will have access to the following benefits:
Training and use of our paperless billing and data collection system
Full practice management – we take care of intake, staffing, billing, tracking authorizations, insurance correspondence and maintenance of your certifications, so you are able to focus on providing our children with the best services!
Access to continuing education workshops and trainings (we are an ASHA and BACB ACE provider)
Team-building meetings, events, and trainings

Now Hiring: Fee For Service, Hourly Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
LOCATION: Los Angeles, CA
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct assessments for children diagnosed with ASD and work with caregivers to create meaningful goals and treatment plans
Design behavior intervention plans
Create functional specific, observable, and measurable goals for behavior therapists and caregivers to implement.

Clinically review session notes on a regular basis for assigned behavior therapists
Analyze data and implement data-driven program changes
Ensure that progress is generalized and caregivers are active participants in therapy through specific goals, training sessions, and communication.
Conduct reassessments at least twice per year while summarizing data and progress for each client supervised
Regular communication with parents, behavioral therapists, and the Achieve Beyond office is required
Maintain confidentiality of information regarding children and families (in accordance with HIPAA and State & Federal regulations).
Ensure that all programs are socially significant, functional, and lead to independence and happiness!(services, programs, schedule, staff, etc.)

REQUIREMENTS:
Must have a passion for ABA and working with children, families, and therapists!
Master’s Degree in (Behavior Analysis, Special Education, Educational/Health/Human Services, Psychology).
BCBA REQUIRED
Minimum of one year of ABA client/teacher field supervision
Must be self-motivated, a team player, and exercise patience/professionalism.
Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.

Physical Requirements:
Must be able to travel to and from assigned cases including but not limited to driving personal vehicle, walking, and/or use of public transportation such as a bus or train.
The ability to climb and descend staircases
The ability to lift 10 pounds regularly
The ability to sit on the floor, kneel, and/ or crawl for extended periods

Compensation depends on experience and will be discussed during the interview process.

positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality -Cloud Data & Analytics Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team

Analytics & Cognitive

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

Analytics & Cognitive will work with our clients to:
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms
Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions
Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

Relationship Management of executive clients and sponsors:

Participate in Business Development, develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients, organize and lead pursuit teams, participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process, contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.

Practice Development & Eminence:

Develop practical solutions and methodologies, develop "thoughtware" and "point- of-view" documents, participate in public speaking events, get published in industry periodicals.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Required:

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Preferred:
Strong project management and delivery experience, including budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). Working knowledge and experience of MS Office applications and training development tools.
Located within a commutable distance of a Deloitte office.

Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Company Info:

About Legrand
Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.
About Legrand North and Central America
Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401K match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.
About Legrand’s Data Center Power and Control Division
Legrand’s Data, Power & Control (DPC) division is a global provider of award winning technology and infrastructure products which serve the expanding requirements of today’s data centers and related ecosystems. Our innovative products are principally sold under the Starline, Raritan, Server Technology, US Safety Trolley, and Legrand brand names. As a leading provider of best in class overhead power supply system’s, intelligent PDUs, KVM switches, connectivity, cabinet and containment solutions, our goal is to support next generation technologies with flexibility for future growth and energy and installation efficiencies, united by superior design.
