positionName: Group Director Data and Analytics Strategy
description:
THE ROLE:
The Group Director, Data and Analytics Strategy leads the Strategy & Analytics group on a given client account. They work alongside Mindshare’s Planning and Activation teams to accelerate our clients’ data-driven advantage to win the most valuable consumer moments more often. We work cross-functionally to ultimately construct and measure media and content architectures to drive data driven marketing efforts in market against business outcomes.
In addition to working with Mindshare’s internal Planning and Activation teams, the Group Director, Data and Analytics Strategy will work with clients to enable the data and tech that lay the foundation for executing precision marketing. They will also consult closely on the paid, owned, and earned media ecosystem to maximize customer engagements, connecting AdTech and MarTech to better understand journeys and outcomes.
The person in this role will the required to lead a US-based team with members in Chicago and New York.
QUICK NOTES:
Client commitment will be dedicated to Kimberly Clark serving in an advisory capacity across all aspects of our Strategy & Analytics offerings for that client
The role will be tasked with seeking out and vetting new data, technology, and media partners across the industry that will help support our communications and media strategies
The candidate will possess a unique set of analytical, technical, and communication skills, as they are responsible for clearly articulating the detail behind the data and technology that inform and power agile precision marketing strategies
WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT THIS POSITION:
Opportunity to guide the continuous evolution of Mindshare’s Data, Tech, & Analytics service offerings
Fuses digital& data strategy, with cross-channel planning
Bridges the gap between ‘math people’ and traditional media planning
HOW WE’LL GROW TOGETHER:
Mindshare advocates career growth. We will explore growth opportunities with you across the Mindshare network, and GroupM/ WPP network as your career extends
Exposure both within the Mindshare/GroupM network and the larger media industry. There is high-level engagement from some of the biggest players in the field like Google, Adobe, Facebook, Salesforce, Amazon, and so many more to help us excel on behalf of our clients
YOUR IMPACT:
Mindshare is looking for specialist leader to drive integrated, data driven precision media and measurement. The role of the team is to drive Data, Technology, & analytics strategy to address Kimberly Clark USA unique business, brand and advertising challenges.
The person in this role will be responsible for the following:
Alignment and orchestration of data (media), technology, and measurement/analytics services to deliver client value (“An Outcomes Framework” to guide our data and analytics purpose)
Enable smarter audience-led marketing by creating a more robust data strategy for media, and collaborating on a technology roadmap, to plan media experiences against people, purpose, and intent
Helping clients understand the long- and short-term impact of their media and marketing investments
Deep knowledge of, and fluency in, media systems and data (online and offline)
Experience developing and managing complex measurement, reporting, and optimization systems for large, fast paced clients
The desire and confidence to lead cross functional (data/tech/analytics/strategy) teams, and clients, into uncharted territory
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Primary responsibilities revolve around leading a team to develop and execute industry-leading precision marketing underpinned by great analytics, modeling and measurement strategies:
Responsible for developing cross capability solutions (data, technology, and measurement) and will be accountable for their delivery
Outline a Precision Marketing thought leadership plan to manage with C-level and senior brand marketers at KC, including perspective on future of data in a post cookie/ ad tracking world
Scope and oversee (with the cross-functional team) of a bespoke KC planning system, including audience planning, budget setting, mix optimization, and testing framework
Use Mindshare Strategy & Analytics client value advisory frameworks to map out solutions, sequences, and roadmaps to recommend solutions that provide value to clients (e.g., develop Outcomes Framework with the client)
Priority Area #1: Revise overall approach to measurement strategy for a more person-based real-time performance marketing approach.
Provide advice on how to use analytics and measurement to understand marketing fundamentals (MROI, Reach, Frequency, Flighting, Audience, etc.)
Drive education around the relationship between advertising investment/activity, and KCs long- and short-term business growth
Ensure that KC has a long-term Measurement Roadmap in place, leveraging best-in-class internal and external tools
Develop consumer journey framework and decision sciences processes to impact optimization and ways of working at various stages
Priority Area #2: Refine overall approach to audience strategy
Redefine audience approach foundations (source of growth methodologies, foundational data strategy)
Identify the role of consumer segmentation approaches, and scope/ design use cases
Integrate Identity strategy into addressable media planning and buying strategy and operational workflow, including clear connectivity to comms planning and greater accountability through testing and measurement
Identify enabling technology gaps and scope and roadmap solutions as needed
Develop and maintain relationships with internal client stakeholders
Ensure appropriate staffing levels and expertise against the scope of work
Drive thought leadership, and guide the direction and development of the dedicated team
Provide staff with all the necessary tools and training to improve upon existing expertise
Ensure client service teams have fully optimized their media plans and developed a rich and well thought out audience, data, and measurement strategies
Write POVs on industry topics and educate clients on innovations in various spaces
Use advanced analytical and technology solutions to drive growth and connect media actions to business value
Develop a learning agenda with category, business, and media Insights
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience leading a customer-facing team of audience strategists, analysts, and data ops managers to develop cross-media data and measurement strategy across multiple product categories. This individual should have a strong understanding of tools in the media analytics, data sciences, and research space, be familiar with various modeling approaches, hold expertise in data strategy for audience-led media activation, and enabling technology to drive automation, standardization, and speed into a modern precision marketing engine. This cross-section of skills will allow the Group Director, Customer Strategy to recognize opportunities to build and execute bespoke solutions for KC. Experience with working across teams in different geographies and integrated agency models is a plus.
Leading and developing large digital accounts, digital teams/ departments, etc, and prioritizing competing projects and deliverables
Growing business via external opportunities/ new business or internal client relationship development
Experience in digital strategy, media, AdTech/MarTech operation, and applied programmatic knowledge
Previous hands-on use of a DMP (SFDC, Adobe, etc.) and analytics platforms - building and syndicating audiences, maintaining taxonomy structures, reporting and insights, troubleshooting
Ability to leverage disparate data sets into strategic media approaches
Embody an intellectual curiosity around what data means by putting it into context of the client’s business and focusing on asking the next question.
Analytical thinker knowledgeable in the online/offline digital ecosystem.
Experience working with business outcomes to provide optimization recommendations that go beyond front-end media metrics: Incrementality Testing, Churn Analysis, Next Best Action, Propensity Modelling, Media Mix Models, Multi-Touch Attribution, Sales/ Brand Lift Studies
Digital Media Technologies: DCM, DSP’s, Social Ad Platforms, Moat, DoubleVerify, NielsenMarCloud, Nielsen DAR/TAR & IAS, SFMC, LiveRamp
Understanding of all media activation channels (social, search, programmatic, shopper, endemic, TV)
Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Syndicated Audience and Measurement tools: VideoAmp, ComScore, Nielsen, MRI/ Simmons
Bachelors or advanced degree in Statistics, Economics, Business, Math, or Sciences is preferred
ABOUT MINDSHARE:
At Mindshare, we believe in speed, teamwork and provocation. Mindshare USA empowers people to challenge the status quo, through what we call Provocation with Purpose. We’ll encourage you to break the rules, knock things down, rebuild them better, and push the boundaries of what’s possible. It takes a team of people who invest in other’s success, and together we make Mindshare the place where we do the best work of our career. We’re a team that is radically honest – we call this our Authenticity Quotient. We are curious and competitive – that’s our Passion Quotient. We embrace teamwork and adaptability – that’s our Emotional Quotient. We’re proud to be unmistakably #TeamMindshare.
GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the greater work we can create together.

Business Systems Analyst
We are looking for a new team member who’s is eager to partner with us in delivering global business process and system based initiatives to our customers (ie. Project Management/Corporate Payroll/HR Business Systems)
Responsibilities
Lead projects related to Plexxis ERP, Paychex, and Paylocity that support the company’s operations across Payroll, Absence Management, and Time Tracking with integrations into General Ledger and with Time and Expense
Partner with customers to translate their needs into detailed business requirement documentation that can be presented to all levels of management, customers, development teams and vendors.
Consider the impact on current and future business applications and processes, assessing upstream & downstream impacts of the proposed system and business process changes.
Liaison with IT, HR partners, and vendors to review and provide input into solutions to address business requirements and make recommendations to sr. management.
Interact and communicate with various levels of business partners (SME’s, managers, executives) ensuring business partners consensus throughout your assigned projects.
Plan, prepare, develop, facilitate and monitor the execution of User Acceptance Testing to ensure a smooth transition into production.
Prepare plans, instructional presentations and deliver training to prepare users to accept the business process and system related changes.
Perform/Review simple to advanced system configurations.
Lead scheduled Plexxis ERP, Paychex, and Paylocity update cycles by conducting impact analysis on current processes and downstream functionality as well as document and test updates.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (Business or MIS).
6+ years' operational business experience, with demonstrated leadership, project management, or managerial skills.
5+ years' demonstrated experience in business systems requirements, analysis, design, and implementation.
Business operational knowledge in one or more of the following areas is helpful: Payroll, Time Tracking, Absence Management, HCM.
Experience with Microsoft Windows applications, Microsoft Office including MS Excel, MS Outlook, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Visio.
High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent organizational, analytical and time management skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Proven experience managing projects and resources and driving them to completion
Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
The ability to communicate/present information to employees on all levels and in small or large groups.
Prior experience in a technical role for enterprise application implementation projects (e.g. ERP, CRM, HRMS) a plus!
Establish and maintain strong client relationships, work independently and with others.
State Payroll functional experience preferred

positionName: Auto, Transportation, Hospitality Data & Analytics Dev Ops Senior Manager
description:
Auto, Transportation, Hospitality - Data & Analytics Dev Ops Senior Manager

Our Consumer industry practice is focused on serving the changing consumer, who have rapidly evolving needs, behaviors and preferences for products, services, and experiences. Our Automotive, Transportation, Hospitality & Services sector is going through an unprecedented period of significant evolution and opportunity with silos being broken down and an increased focus on the customer experience. Organizations are building differentiated customer experiences and highly integrated supply chains while maintaining growth and profitability, which creates unique challenges to innovate, modernize technology, and transform their business models.


The Team - AI and Data Operations

We establish and operate the data fabric of our client's largest and most complex deployments enabling organizations to adapt to the rapidly changing business needs using their core data platforms, applications and solutions. And we deliver this using a combination of people, automation, AI and industry leading practices to enable intelligent operations across all levels of enterprise.

We provide flexible, long-term, staffing models that allow us to optimize the data life cycle, drive agility and scale and put data in the hands of decision makers faster and drive enhanced analytics insights.

Deloitte's AI and Data Operations offering provides our clients a proven approach to optimizing, modernizing and operating their data and analytics capabilities, as well as their platforms and infrastructure. Deloitte supports Clients as they transition their data and analytics investment and operational focus from routine capabilities to a shift to driving business value and innovation.

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The AI and Data Operations team leverages the power of data, analytics, Intelligent automation, science and cognitive technologies combined with the Data Dev Ops approach to help uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy and Analytics and Cognitive practices, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.


The AI & Data Operations team will work with our clients to:
Stand up and operate their data and analytics related capabilities, applications and infrastructure by providing multi-year managed services leveraging the constructs and principles of Data Dev Ops
Provide capacity by embedding talent in our client organizations to quickly scale data, business intelligence, visualization and analytical teams up and down, on-demand
Support as-a-service based subscription models at scale that include analytics and data assets supporting industry and function-specific needs

Work you'll do

As a Senior Manager, you will lead and deliver large, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative business and technology solutions for large companies. You will contribute to the firm's growth and development in a variety of ways including:

Engagement Management:

Lead engagement planning and budgeting; mobilize and manage engagement teams; define deliverable structure and content; facilitate buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client; direct on-time, quality delivery of work products; manage engagement economics; manage engagement risk.

Relationship Management of executive clients and sponsors:

Participate in Business Development, develop and maintain contact with top decision makers at key clients, organize and lead pursuit teams, participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process, contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.

Practice Development & Eminence:

Develop practical solutions and methodologies, develop "thoughtware" and "point- of-view" documents, participate in public speaking events, get published in industry periodicals.

People Development:

Perform the role of counselor and coach, provide input and guidance into the staffing process, actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, provide leadership and support for delivery teams and staff in local offices.

Qualifications

Required:

Experience with Data Integration and Big Data technologies including some (not all) of the following - ETL/ELT tools like Informatica and Talend, Spark, Airflow, Cloud Based Data Integration tools like AWS Glue, GCP Data Flow and Azure Data Factory
Experience implementing or operating data and analytics solutions using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience working with DevOps methodology and tools like GitHub, Jenkins, Maven, Bitbucket, etc.
Should be well versed with ITSM (IT Service Management) tools and the individual modules of ITSM
Incident Management
Change Management
Problem Management
Escalation Management
Release Management
Configuration Management
Must have a good understanding of Data Integration and Big Data technologies
Should be experienced in the data integration, provisioning and load processes of Data Warehouses, Data Marts and Data Lakes
Travel up to 50% (While 50% is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent professional experience
Limited sponsorship may be available

Preferred:
Strong project management and delivery experience, including budget oversight and staffing of project teams including time management.
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Previous experience mentoring, training and developing junior members of the team; experience in employee performance reviews.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint). Working knowledge and experience of MS Office applications and training development tools.
Located within a commutable distance of a Deloitte office.

Roles and Responsibilities: Within the CX Division, the Data Privacy Governance (DPG) team serves as the hub for privacy compliance work across the Honda enterprise. Extensive interaction with those teams, with IT personnel, and with the Honda legal teams is requires. Required Skills:

Strong presentation and analysis skills.

Familiarity with IT development processes and coordination.
Experience in an Agile work environment.
Experience in vendor selection through proposal (RFP) process.
Must Have Data Privacy Experience (GDPR and CCPA)
Education Required: BA/BS

Business Analyst – The Greeley Company
About The Greeley Company
The Greeley Company is a leading provider of consulting, education, interim staffing, credentialing management, and external peer review to healthcare organizations nationwide. Headquartered in the greater Boston area, The Greeley Company has helped more than 1,000 healthcare organizations within the past three years address challenges related to regulatory compliance, credentialing and privileging, peer review, clinician burnout, bylaws and physician-hospital alignment.
The Greeley Company joined The Chartis Group in 2019. The Chartis Group is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, operations and performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, Chartis helps leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals, physician enterprises and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
Across both Greeley and Chartis, we are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission “to improve healthcare delivery”, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities.
Role Overview
The Greeley Business Analyst should be energetic, a team player, and an enthusiastic learner. Flexibility with respect to travel and on-site engagements is essential. A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. A diverse and inclusive place to work

Kwx is an integrated home experience company that seamlessly unites the KW ecosystem to keep the agent at the center of the homeownership journey.
Austin, Texas-based kwx is the holding company of Keller Williams Realty, the world’s largest real estate technology franchise by agent count. With more than 1,070 offices and 190,000 associates worldwide, Keller Williams is also No. 1 in units and sales volume in the United States.
In 2020, Keller Williams initially began the formation of kwx, composed of Keller Williams, Keller Williams Worldwide, Keller Offers and Keller Home Financial Services, consisting of Keller Mortgage and Keller Covered.
Since 1983, the company has cultivated an agent-centric, technology-driven and education-based culture that rewards agents as stakeholders. For more information, visit kwx.kw.com.

Equivalent Experience

Job Description

Working with business and/or product owner, you will formulate and help define system scope matrix , objectives, and requirements through best practice disciplines, research, and requirements gathering. 
You will lead and/or assist business and technical teams to develop and/or modify processes to resolve moderate to complex business issues. 
You will support design, build, and test phases for assigned projects including defect triage and resolution. 
Provide the team an analysis of business and user needs, elicitation, organization and documentation of user stories, business requirements, process flows , and translation of business requirements into functional requirements and acceptance criteria to capture what the team discussed and agreed upon. 
Support solution and functional specification definition. 
When available, you will review impacted systems’ technical and logical design for the ability to lead through creating or updating system/process/data flow diagrams with minimal support. 
Utilize basic SQL skills to perform data queries that are simple to medium in complexity to support analysis as needed throughout all phases of the project. 
Collaborate with project managers to develop detailed project information for their task assignments.

Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a directly related field or industry required 
5+ years’ experience in business analysis, business systems, or both 
3+ years’ experience using Microsoft Office application Word, Excel, Visio, SharePoint, Outlook, PowerPoint, online meeting collaboration tools, IM, etc. 
3+ years’ experience with excellent meeting facilitation and communication skills 
Astute Knowledge of financial services industry in one or more of the following: Brokerage Services, Wealth Management, Advisory, trading platforms/systems, finance, online account services, cash management
Knowledge of BA Professional best practices of Business Analysis/Business Systems Analysis
Comprehensive understanding of best practices related to release and change management, software development life cycle, workflow and process modeling and diagrams
Proven proficiency in leading through completion of high quality business, functional and non-functional requirement documentation – solid understanding of business requirements vs solution oriented functional requirements.
Proven talent in developing a business analysis plan in support of providing meaningful project phase estimates for all business analyst activities - especially takes ownership and accountability for the requirements phase and is highly capable to plan the tasks, effort and duration of all the tasks necessary to complete the BRD, FRD and supplementary documentation
Must have strong and creative problem solving skills

Skills
Business analysis, financial services, investments, Sql, finra, finance, Reporting, uat, uat testing, test script, kpi, jira, annuities, User stories, Requirements gathering, Requirement gathering, confluence, wealth management, excel macros, excel pivot tables

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.

Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.

Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.

Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).

Job Description:
Have you developed a reputation for your ability to strategize, analyze, design and implement important eCommerce initiatives Do clients rely on you to create and communicate the detailed technology architecture and implementation strategy for the solution If leading technical teams through the design and development of complex transactional systems sounds like a challenge you want to tackle, then we want to meet you.

The work:
Participate in the analysis, design, and implementation of relevant eCommerce platforms such as hybris, Oracle/ATG, Magento/Adobe Commerce, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, and IBM Websphere Commerce
Apply specific functional knowledge of eCommerce or WCM applications to help guide the design and implementation of the solution
Manage and conduct requirements gathering, stakeholder interviews and initial client discover work
Prepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case and work-flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle
Lead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project or QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenarios
Prepare training materials appropriate for target audiences and developed solution and conduct training sessions
Assist with gap analysis, business process redesign, roadmap planning and developing proof-of-concepts
Support the development of strong client relationships by building trust, rapport and strong working relationships with key sponsors, stakeholders, and team members
Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts.

Here’s what you need:
Minimum 3 years of experience gathering and documenting requirements
Minimum 2 years of full lifecycle implementation experience using various SDLC methodologies
Minimum 1 year of implementing eCommerce applications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
Functional expertise in relevant eCommerce or WCM technologies such as Magento/Adobe Commerce, hybris, Oracle/ATG, Sterling Order Management, Manhattan Associates, Demandware, Intershop, IBM Websphere Commerce, Cloudcraze
Experience eliciting high-level business requirements and creating detailed functional specs as well as other documentation like requirement traceability matrixes, work-flow diagrams and use-cases
Ability to lead team and client meetings and to clearly articulate the solution being developed with all the stake holders
Experience in a consulting environment with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovation.

Functions as the technical liaison for the Fitness Call Center and Fitness Operations teams partnering with development groups and product owners for the various Fitness applications.

Document system bugs, errors, and solutions

Proficient in VSTS, SQL, and MS Office.

Ability to facilitate and manage meetings.

Ability to display excellent customer service to meet the needs and expectations of both internal and external customers.
Excellent listening and interpersonal communication skills to identify critical core competencies based on success factors and organizational environment.

Demonstrated ability to analyze information, problems, issues, situations and procedures to develop effective solutions.

positionName: Senior Associate, Data and Analytics Modeler
description:
Innovate. Collaborate. Build. Create. Solve. The KPMG Digital Lighthouse is KPMG's award-winning Analytics & AI Center of Excellence recognized by clients and leading analyst firms in the US and globally. The KPMG Lighthouse is a curation of specialized technical capabilities and domain experts working across the digital landscape: applied data science, AI, data engineering and insights, software engineering, automation, and big data. Here, you'll work with a diverse team of professionals to explore and build solutions for clients in a multiplatform environment.
You'll be an important part of our high-energy, unique, fast-paced, and innovative culture that delivers with the agility of a tech startup and the backing of a leading global consulting firm. In this particular role, you'll work specifically in the AI Analytics & Engineering Community within the Digital Lighthouse, on a wide range of projects. From applied AI to optimization to big data platform engineering, your analytical and technical skills will drive real impact in the business world. At KPMG, our commitment to your career development helps to set us apart as an employer. We want to enhance your potential, both for yourself and as a contributor to our firm. That's why we provide every opportunity to expand your skills, knowledge and experiences through formal education and training programs, leadership development opportunities, and, as well as informal one-on-one coaching and mentoring from your KPMG colleagues.
KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Data and Analytic Modeler to join our KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics.
Responsibilities:
D&A Modelers help to bridge the gap between technical modeling needs (i.e., data science) and business issues skewing toward data science but also bring big data engineering capabilities playing an important “utility” role helping to manage overall solutioning
Assess, capture, and translate complex business issues and requirements into structured analytics use case, including rapid learning of industry/domain/client dynamics and development of effective work stream plans while managing KPMG resources to drive engagements to successful closure
Research and communicate sector or process-specific data and D&A solution design requirements, including building such design requirements into targeted visualizations
Build analytics solution modeling logic within a variety of analytics tools and on a variety of big data platforms as required by the client, creating robust documentation of solutions and underlying design decisions
Deliver client project modeling work stream through direct ownership of data integration, validation, mining, and modeling, as well as client communication deliverables
Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate exploratory models that will reveal insight and opportunities for the client
Qualifications:
Minimum three years of data analytics experience with a professional services firm, an internal strategy/analytics group, or similar environment with previous experience in strategy and/or analytics consulting highly regarded
Bachelor's degree or Masters from an accredited college in a Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering or a related field with a focus on analytics with working knowledge of modelling (regression, machine learning, feature selection, dimension reduction, validation), data (extracting, preparing, munging, validating), and building analytics pipelines
Proficiency with sophisticated analytics tools and programming languages such as SAS, R, Python, Alteryx, SQL, working independently with minimal supervision as well as collaborating effectively as part of a team
Experience working with one or more of the following: machine learning, analytics, neo4j, Neptune, RDF, gremlin, graph
Strong communication skills, able to explain technical concepts to business audiences, and to explain business concepts to technical resources across both client and KPMG teams
Demonstrated ability of understanding engagement objective, to include an understanding of the clients' business problem and how the engagement helps address it; knowledge of or strong aptitude for understanding business, operational, process, delivery and revenue models
Broad, versatile knowledge of analytics landscape, with demonstrated solution design and build expertise, work stream management skills, and business consulting acumen in applying advanced analytics to solve business issues
Ability to travel up to eighty percent of the time; Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future
KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Business Analyst - REMOTE

RESPONSIBILITIES


Works with other teams to interview stakeholders and elicit basic to moderate business requirements.
Assists facilitation of meetings to build deep understanding of functional business and it areas (e.g., customer, field operations) to understand business requirements.
Assists in translating business and design requirements into technical requirements.
Analyzes process/system changes, with supervision, to ensure design changes meet business requirements.
Develops experience with drawing process maps and using business process modelling techniques.
Manages overall catalogue of process flows for small to medium complexity projects.
Analyzes fairly complex data for projects with little to no supervision.
Performs QA against specifications.
Identifies issues with the quality and performance of products, services, solutions or processes and proposes improvements.
Supports small to medium complexity projects with some degree of supervision, including tracking issues and managing action items.
Appropriately documents knowledge and share lessons learned for medium complexity projects.
Assists with BA activities needed on agile scrum teams; displays understanding of agile methodology.
Analyzes, identifies, and directs solutions to eliminate problems, improve user effectiveness, and improve system accuracy.
Comes up with ideas and insights to share with senior business analysts that will optimize business results.
Works in an agile environment and engages in development practices such as XP, test driven development.

REQUIREMENTS


Developing knowledge of the practices, procedures and principles of performance analysis (trending, root cause and gap analysis), benchmarking and audit compliance.
Strong familiarity with specialized business technologies and applications (e.g., workforce management, outage management, mobile dispatch).
Good understanding of customers business model, and different parts of the business (e.g., distribution, transmission operations).
Strong proficiency in standard software applications (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint). 3-5 years of experience
Bachelors degree strongly preferred

Internet Brands/WebMD/Medscape is looking for a Data Analytics and Personalization Manager to join our Los Angeles-based headquarters.

The Ideal Candidate:
You are an organized self-starter with a keen business sense who loves digging into data to understand trends and performance. You have a passion for manipulating large volumes of data, building dashboards, and have a consistent focus on efficiency. You easily understand requirements and communicate the progress and status of your work. You have a bias for action and know when to apply the 80/20 rule. You’re also a great teammate who likes a rapidly changing environment and wants to join a company that offers a ton of opportunities to build your skills.

The Data Analytics and Personalization Manager primary role is to be responsible for insights and analysis support. To achieve this, they will provide guidance to other analysts on the team or by directly providing the information. This position requires an ability to understand the key metrics of a business and interpret the results to the business owners. They will work in a project team-oriented and dynamic environment which will require working closely with other teams and adjusting to new developments as they arise. Various software packages and tools will be utilized in order to collect, mine, and report on this data. Strong analytical and communication skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines is critical for this position.

In this role, you will:

Provide insightful summaries and next step recommendations of projects to the business owners.
Create insightful, easy to understand visualizations that provide performance, trending and benchmarking analysis to meet business needs.
Manage and/or mentor other analysts in generating visualizations, analysis and insights.
Support the business with time-critical data analyses.
Performing advanced analysis of web traffic, email engagement, and app engagement data to understand and measure the success of programs, including click through analysis, retention, re-engagement and A/B testing.
Become a subject matter data (and business) expert related to appointed areas of responsibility.
Collaborate with agile engineering teams to design flexible solutions to support analytic needs.
Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations to what-if scenarios, to deep dives, uncovering patterns in order to identify trends and new opportunities.
Required Qualifications:

Experience (6+ years) in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills including experience in supporting and communicating data-driven analyses to various departments and stakeholders
Highly Proficient (3+ years) with creating, maintaining, and optimizing Tableau workbooks.
Highly Proficient (4+ years) in using SQL for data analysis and reporting.
Advanced Excel skills are required. Must be proficient with advanced analytic functions such as vlookup, named ranges, pivot tables, formulas, etc.
Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize workload and roadmaps
Excellent business and product sense
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience using web analytic tools (Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics)
Experience working with Marketing, Product, and Sales teams.
Experience managing other business intelligence analysts

About Internet Brands:

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Assisting the Product Owner, this position will be responsible for working with the greater company team (including field and finance company) and dealers to facilitate the transformation towards online sales. Additionally, this role will focus on improving digital and physical processes in key business areas related to: OEM and dealer websites, digital retailing customer experience, optimizing each step in the digital/in store purchase process (technology and organization) and data management and analysis relating to retailing.
The right candidate will exhibit excellent communication and organizational skills, the ability to build strong relationships in the office and the field, and with our cross-functional teams.
Daily Tasks:
Assist in championing online retailing transformation efforts within the organization including design, coordination, analysis and communicating.
Responsible for data-led recommendations, tracking, and reporting to improve the online retailing process across the business.
Facilitation with internal stakeholders, potential vendors (including selection process) and identified dealers in the promotion, support and maintenance of all initiatives related to the online retailing program.
Collaboration with team and key partners to drive adoption of online retailing.
Evaluate and provide guidance in market analysis of online retailing and programs including OEM and third-party tools.
Required Skills:
Must have Bachelors Degree or higher, or equivalent work experience
Must have automotive experience and, ideally, automotive retail experience. Must be familiar with the automotive sales process and individual components.
Strong presentation and data analysis skills.
The ability to work with team members from different levels (executive leadership to business analysts) and different business units across the enterprise (Sales, Service, Marketing, Finance, IT).
Experience in budget coordination and project scheduling.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications specifically Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams.
Desired Skills:
Experience with digital tools in the automotive space (retailing, website, marketing, analytics, etc.).
Familiarity with IT development processes and coordination.
Experience in an Agile work environment.
Experience in vendor selection through proposal (RFP) process.
Position Factors (i.e. multi-plant assignment, work environment):
Work environment is likely a mix of virtual and, when appropriate, in person at the Torrance office. Mix may change depending on COVID conditions.
Why Kelly®?
As a worker today, it’s up to you to take charge of your career and look for opportunities to learn, grow, and achieve your potential. Helping you find what’s next is what we’re all about. We know what’s going on in the evolving world of work—just ask the 440,000 people we employ each year. Connecting with us means getting the support, guidance, and opportunities needed to take your career where you may have never imagined.
About Kelly®
At Kelly, we’re always thinking about what’s next and advising job seekers on new ways of working to reach their full potential. In fact, we’re a leading advocate for temporary/nontraditional workstyles, because we believe they allow flexibility and tremendous growth opportunities that enable a better way to work and live (plus, did we mention we provide a ton of benefits?). Connecting great people with great companies is what we do best, and our employment opportunities span a wide variety of workstyles, skill levels, and industries around the world.
Kelly is an equal opportunity employer committed to employing a diverse workforce and providing accommodations for people with disabilities in all parts of the hiring process as required under its Employment Accommodation Policy. Kelly will work with applicants to meet accommodation needs that are made known to Kelly in advance.

positionName: Life and Annuity Senior Business Analyst
description:
Our Purpose
At Majesco, we believe in connecting people and business to Insurance in ways that are Innovative, Hyper-Relevant, Compelling and Personal. We bring together the brightest minds to build the future of Insurance; a world where Insurance makes life and business easier, more connected and better protected.
Job Overview
The Lead Business Analyst - Technical will carry the ownership of identifying business objectives, work with customers to define business process changes by producing requirement and functional design documents & supporting execution of integration tests, including monitoring software incidents and communicating software issues & tracked to the closure.
Key Role and Responsibilities
Extensive and demonstrable experience (at least 8 years + in the North American L&A industry) in relation to:
Excellent business and domain knowledge of the North American Life & Annuity Insurance industry, especially in Policy Admin Implementations
Working with customers to define configuration requirements, and developing an overall configuration approach for the client
Producing requirement and functional design documents using an agile gap-analysis and directed requirements approach to lead the customer needs definition
Estimating the effort required to configure the system
Configuring the products and business process rules to solve customer business challenges
Working with Product management to share customer configuration concepts and further develop our base product features
Identifying opportunities to meet customer business objectives using business logic and configuring applications to meet those objectives
Project management experience
Experience gathering requirements/user stories, understanding North American Life & Annuity product specifications and designing business process flows
Experience implementing North American Life & Annuity products on Policy Administration systems
Knowledge of Group and Individual North American L&A markets
Agile or SAFe experience is a plus
All About You
Minimum 8+ years of experience in Life, Health, Annuity or supporting these products with at least 5-10 years of experience working in software companies building software in the above areas.
 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Applications or global equivalent required.
 LOMA Certifications is a plus.
Majesco is a leading insurance solutions and services provider.
Majesco's software for core insurance functions include Policy Administration, Underwriting, New Business Processing, Billing, Claims, Product Modeling, Incentive Compensation and Producer Life cycle Management. Additionally, Majesco offers consulting and insurance specific IT services for testing, data conversion, data-warehousing/BI, mobility, enterprise integration and BPM. Majesco specializes in connecting people and business to insurance in ways that are innovative, hyper-relevant, compelling and personal. Our technology, expertise and leadership helps insurers modernize, innovate and connect to build the future of their business – and the industry – at speed and at scale.
Majesco is an inclusive equal opportunity employer and complies with federal, state and local laws regarding equal employment opportunity. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religious beliefs, sex (including pregnancy), age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, military status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by federal, state and/or local employment laws.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonableaccommodation@majesco.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting and your contact information. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. This email alias is not for the general submission of application materials and any application materials submitted through this alias will not be considered. In addition, Majesco will not provide a response to inquiries made to reasonableaccommodation@majesco.com that are not related to accessibility of the online application system by persons with disabilities.

positionName: Manager II - Data Analytics, Kroll Government Solutions
description:
In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business.
We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of One team, One Kroll, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.
At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support multiple audit and analytic priorities including data intake processing, compiling data statistics, and data normalization
Demonstrated ability to take unknown data sets and provided context, identify anomalies, and create actionable insights to support the business.
Work with business and supervisor to design and develop ad - hoc and standard reports to meet discovery, decision support, and management reporting needs.
Experience working with varied data at scale, developing tools and techniques to facilitate data import, data analysis, data export, and reporting applications.
Demonstrate skills and knowledge of relational database management system, e.g. Microsoft Access Database, Oracle Database Server, and others.
Prepare and maintain process and procedure documentation.
Work continuously to improve efficiency and repeat-ability of processes and procedures.
Solid understanding of data analysis best practices
Ability to plan tasks in a logical and achievable manner.
Ability to work under minimal supervision, has initiative, and can manage several simultaneous projects.
Ability to work through problems and develop creative solutions
Familiarity with IBM Infosphere, Tableau, SharePoint, Python, SQL
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s Degree (BS/BA) in Business Information Systems, Business Administration, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar is preferred.
At least five years experiences working with/supporting enterprise data interrogation, analytics, or reporting environments.
Ability to use advanced features throughout the Microsoft Office Suite (i.e. pivot tables, functions, data imports)
5+ years data manipulation with Oracle or other large relational database
5+ years actively using SQL, Python
Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communities
Experience working with diverse teams
In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.
Kroll is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.

Immediate need for a talented Business Analyst with experience in the Telecom Industry. This is a 04+ Months contract opportunity with long-term potential and is located in El Segundo, CA. Please review the job description below.

Primary responsibility to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the needs of the project stakeholders.

Design, develop, and maintain dashboards and reports providing actionable business intelligence and data analytics for operational support.

Our client is a leading Telecom Industry and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. If you are interested in this position, please apply online for immediate consideration.

positionName: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - C3 & Smart Transformation
description:
Job Description
This Senior Marketing Data Analyst reports to the Senior Director of Data Science and Advanced Analytics and is responsible for leading a data driven culture across marketing for Fortune Brands Global Plumbing Group (GPG). The Senior Marketing Data Analyst provides insight, analysis and self-serve analytic solutions across the Marketing organization. This person will have deep analytics and statistical skills to evaluate marketing performance leading to optimized marketing campaigns to acquire and grow customers at GPG. This person needs to be comfortable working with diversified business partners including varied marketing functions, business operations, and data engineers. This role can be remote in the mainland U.S.A.
Responsibilities
Act as the subject matter expert for all marketing data, reporting and attribution for all channels.
Produce detailed reporting dashboards that will be used to track our performance and impact on overall goals.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and use cases.
Help to craft an ongoing experimentation program, including hypothesis formulation, experimental design, significance-setting, and post-experiment analysis.
Educate and support teams with strategies on how to connect data to results.
Collaborate with creative, ecommerce, product, and engineering teams to test and optimize every touchpoint of the customer’s journey.
Embrace a culture of always testing and always learning.
Be proactive when scoping, sizing and fulfilling large and small requests balancing efficiency and quality.
Work with marketing team and data engineers to ensure marketers have access to user data needed for segmentation and targeting.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Analytics, Finance, Computer Science). Master’s Degree preferred
Minimum 5 years of related experience. A Master’s Degree may offset 2 years of experience
Minimum 3 years experience with SQL (Snowflake, MySql, etc.) and with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik
Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends, and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools
Familiarity with marketing funnel reporting and industry KPIs
Experience with creating, executing, and analyzing complex AB/MVT test constructs to test stakeholder hypotheses
Experience in analyzing consumer behaviors and market trends to provide data driven decisions
A strong interest in analytics and a desire to understand the ‘why’, and not just the ‘how’, a campaign performed
Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures
Additional Information
Fortune Brands' Global Plumbing Group (GPG) is a multi-brand plumbing business that is inspiring people by designing beautiful experiences with water. GPG's trusted brands include Moen and the House of Rohl portfolio. We welcome you to visit the Moen.com and HouseofRohl.com websites to learn more about us and why we are a top workplace.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Fortune Brands' GPG is an equal opportunity employer. GPG evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodations
Fortune Brands' GPG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@moen.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Responsibilities:

Gather and interpret business requirements for on-going implementations of Global HR systems & processes
Manage and execute all aspects of delivery, including requirements gathering, design, testing and support
Partner with HR and IT functions to execute project deliverables
Work effectively in a team environment by leveraging expertise of others and utilizing best practice solutions
Develop and execute test scripts

Required Skills/Experience:
This individual must possess excellent interpersonal, communication, and client management skills while displaying the highest degree of integrity. The ideal candidate will be detail oriented, organized, proactive, and understand the urgency and confidentiality of the HR function.


Bachelor’s degree required in HR, IT, business or related discipline and 2-4 years of related work experience in HR IT systems in general
Possess expertise with HR Systems, as a system administrator &/Or expertise working with SAP
Experience working processes and systems that support interfaces
Able to identify system solutions and communicate functional design specifications related to interfaces to other internal resources
Ability to analyze and diagnose interfaces between internal and external partners
Excellent business partnership skills, and skills in building broad relationships & networks; experience working in a matrix environment preferred
Experience in creating and developing test plans
Ability to earn and keep the confidence of stakeholders
Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills
Possess strong analytical skills with the ability to think through complex, multidimensional problems
Flexible and able to respond quickly to changing job demands and prioritize multiple responsibilities

Desired Skills/Experience:

Experience in process change efforts within HR IT systems & demonstrated results
Possess strong HR knowledge, including understanding of HR master data

Introduction
The IS Billing and System Data Analyst works collaboratively with the Finance, Sales, and Support team to ensure client billing settings are properly documented in NetSuite and maintains the IS client billing calendar. This role processes, confirms accuracy, and distributes student/course enrollment billing reports to required stakeholders and works proactively to analyze and resolve any discrepancies while ensuring all client billing process steps are completed prior to billing calendar deadlines. Finally, this role maintains a detailed knowledge of the features and functions of the Student Information System in order to assist with other student data analysis and input requirements that may arise.
About Us
Weld North Education (WNE) is a leading digital education technology company focused on developing digital curriculum and tools for K-12 students. At WNE, we focus on building the best digital curriculum capabilities and resources to enable teachers, administrators, parents, and students to benefit from innovative technologies designed to maximize potential. Our teams are creating the future of integrated curriculum and assessments to transform the way teachers teach and students learn.
A Day in the Life as a Business & Systems Data Analyst
Pulls student billing data for Finance based on specific customer requirements and adjusts discrepancies as necessary.
Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent (GED). Knowledge of word processing, basic spreadsheet and database maintenance. Strong data entry skills, alpha and numeric. Previous experience preferred. Highly motivated, customer centric with excellent detail/accuracy, verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes. Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality results-driven, team-oriented environment. Willingness and ability to work flexible hours. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Working knowledge of CRM software (NetSuite preferred).
Compensation and Benefits
We offer competitive salaries and benefit choices. Our health & welfare benefits provide full-time employees both choice and value to meet the needs of our diverse workforce. We offer multiple health, dental, and vision plans to choose from including accident/critical illness insurance, pet insurance, identity protection, and others. We also provide (at no cost to employees) life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO, holidays, volunteer time off, and paid bonding leave, among others. We contribute to an employee's 401(k) and HSA account. And to support professional growth, we offer multiple training and development programs through our in-house university.
Equal Opportunity Employer
WNE is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce, providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Data Associate
About The Chartis Group
The Chartis Group (Chartis) is a comprehensive advisory and analytics services firm dedicated to the healthcare industry. With an unparalleled depth of expertise in strategic planning, performance excellence, informatics and technology, and health analytics, we help leading academic medical centers, integrated delivery networks, children's hospitals and healthcare service organizations achieve transformative results.
We are comprised of uniquely experienced senior healthcare professionals and consultants who apply a distinctive knowledge of healthcare economics, markets, clinical models and technology to help each client address their most pressing issues. We question everything and apply thoughtful and rigorous analysis to each challenge, issue and opportunity.
We are lucky to have extraordinarily talented people working in our firm – all brought together around our unifying mission, a shared dedication to our core values, and the emphasis we place on creating an environment that enriches the experiences of our clients, our colleagues and our communities. In this way, we find that we are remarkably aligned with our clients. And that has made for achieving some truly great things.
The Chartis Group has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, New York, Minneapolis, and Nashville.
Role Overview
The Chartis Group’s Advanced Analytics Team is responsible for providing high quality data and analytic support to client engagements, internal research, and development initiatives within the firm. They apply advanced database management and sophisticated analytical tools and skills to derive compelling quantitative findings from large client, industry, and proprietary datasets.
The Data Associate will work directly with our consultants and clients to provide analytic support on a range of healthcare projects. This is an exciting opportunity for an innovative and quantitative thinker who is passionate about healthcare to help develop the analytical capabilities of our rapidly growing firm.
Responsibilities
Participate in the entire project lifecycle – from requirements definition and scoping, through execution. During this time, you will work with both project teams and clients to define and fulfill data and analytic requests.
Perform complex analysis (e.g., merging multiple datasets for new insights into relationships between variables) and provide data and analytic support to Chartis consulting engagement teams
Thoroughly QA and cleanse raw datasets, ensuring accuracy of your deliverables
Build new datasets to maximize utility using advanced data management and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel, Alteryx, R, SQL, Python, Snowflake, etc.)
Execute core analytics for a range of client engagements (e.g., strategy, performance improvement, digital health)
Develop impactful data analytics and visualizations including mapping using business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau)
Document analytic methodologies and approaches
Codify datasets and outputs into client-ready deliverables and transfer to project teams/clients
Support the analytic and research needs of Chartis’ internal firm teams and practice areas, including contributing to practice development initiatives, whitepaper development, training, and knowledge management initiatives
Qualifications & Desired Skills
Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering
At least 2-3 years data analytics experience, ideally in a professional services firm or healthcare provider setting
Strong Tableau skills (Desktop/Creator) required. Experience with Tableau Server and Tableau Prep is greatly preferred.
Experience with data visualization, mapping and data cleansing
Ability to create dashboards from a variety of data sources
Familiarity with SQL and managing large data sets (>1M rows) required; additional experience with Snowflake, SAS, Alteryx and/or similar programs preferred.
Familiarity with healthcare data (e.g., claims data, hospital reporting data, or clinical decision support data) and analytics preferred
Proficiency with MS Office applications
Strong work and time management skills; able to work effectively under tight timelines and adapt to shifting priorities, in both individual and team settings
Open to learning new software programs as needed for new types of projects or client engagements
Comfortable working with consulting colleagues, including clearly communicating analytic findings in the context of client engagements
At The Chartis Group, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives the provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.
Atlanta | Boston | Chicago | Minneapolis | New York | San Francisco

Location. Remote – United States
We give you a world of potential.
Computershare has an exciting opportunity for a Data Systems Analyst with our team.
This is a great opportunity to begin a career with an industry leader in mortgage servicing solutions for the financial services and investment banking industries.
A role you will love
As a Data Systems Analyst you will be responsible for producing and tracking the day to day flow of various reports and Servicing Agreements along with updating and maintaining Policies and Procedures. This position will also be required to create and maintain various adhoc reports to support the Investor Reporting Department.
Creating and maintaining various databases for reporting and tracking purposes. This will include, but is not limited to tracking, reconciling and reporting supplemental proceeds, losses, and tracking loss severities.
Collecting and reviewing data files, including Sale Files, Prefund Files and Loan Substitution Files to ensure Loan Accounting, Inventory Management and Investor Reporting has performed all necessary tasks prior to the stated cutoff.
Creating and maintaining Investor Reporting Policies and Procedures and creating process flows for all Investor Reporting processes.
Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.

What we need from you
Required:
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Access, and SQL skills.
Preferred:
Experience with Python.
Word, Accounting software, Internet software, MortgageServ and/or other mortgage servicing systems knowledge.
General organizational, problem solving, and strong communication skills.
Ability to amortize loan payments.
Key qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
Required:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree in accounting, finance or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience
Experience working on a team or in cross-functional work groups, project management and/or process improvement.
Experience with Investor Reporting.
A company to be proud of
Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a world leader in financial administration with over 12,000 employees across 21 different countries delivering expertise to over 25,000 clients. At Computershare, it’s more than just a job, our open and inclusive culture means that we will help you to grow, to move forward and make the most of the world of opportunities we have available. With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere. #worldofpotential

Employee Share Plan. Set aside salary to purchase shares in our company and you’ll increase your investment when you receive a generous company contribution towards additional shares.
Health and Wellbeing. Our health and wellbeing rewards can be tailored to support you and your family.
Save for Your Future. We will support you along your retirement savings journey.
Paid time away from work. Our employees enjoy a competitive paid time off package, including a day each year to volunteer time for a good cause that is important to you.
Employee Discounts. We’ve partnered with other organisations to offer you extra savings. Enjoy discounts with banks, car manufacturers, on flights, accommodation and days out as well as with many big brand shops.
Extra Rewards. From tuition reimbursement to cash bonus recruitment referral programs, our comprehensive benefits package offers a multitude of options.
Compensation. Colorado based candidates $70,000 - $85,000 per year.
A diverse and inclusive place to work

We believe that having a culture of inclusion is essential in delivering good results. Attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse workforce where employees feel valued, respected, and empowered allows people to reach their full potential. As a business this diversity helps us to better reflect and understand.

In most circumstances we are currently performing all interviews, assessments, and background checks online to ensure the safety of everyone involved. Should you be successful in securing a role and it can be performed from home, we will arrange for equipment to be sent to you and your onboarding and training will be provided remotely.
