Position Description:

At a Glance
Legrand has an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst to join the Legrand Data, Power & Control Team under the direction of the Director of Sales Operations. The Business Analyst will provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for operations and business objectives. This position will pull information from ERP, CRM and other various databases and use data analysis tools to analyze information to allow the Company to measure our Customers, Vendors, and Products to further enhance our business performance and profitability. The Business Analyst will provide analysis support primarily to the Sales, Product Management and Marketing teams, in a fast-paced environment.
What Will You Do?
Communicate directly with key end-users in the business to translate business/data challenges into reports, insights, and analysis.
Respond to user requests to develop, test, and run reports to extract/report on requested data, i.e. writing technical/functional specifications for end users.
Develop data models, processes, and structure to provide insights to key business stakeholders.
Analyze and intimately understand database tables to establish knowledge of data for accurate retrieval and use in report writing.
Utilize available tools such as Power BI, SFDC and SAP to provide technical reports.
Create, update, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards from multiple systems (i.e. Salesforce, Power BI, SAP).
Work closely with end users, programmers, and functional teams to design business intelligence and operational reporting solutions for decision making and compliance monitoring.
Analyze sales, marketing & financial data contained in various databases to identify data reporting issues and root cause analysis for existing and proposed system tools.
Responsible for Salesforce account hierarchies and data maintenance tasks including both individual and mass record updates to ensure clean reporting outputs.
Document detailed specifications for each report including both the technical specifications and a summary of the report.
Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings to the executive team.
Contribute to building out division-led analytics initiative using Power BI
Utilize software to generate metrics and develop actionable recommendations. Provide support to research teams or management by collecting and analyzing data and reporting results.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with an emphasis in Business and/or Marketing; or at least 1-2 years applicable experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience:
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a data anlysis role.
Skills/Knowledge/Abilities:
Effective oral and written communication skills with the ability to provide concise insights and analysis to multiple groups in the company including Engineering, Finance, Product Management, Marketing, and Sales.
Ability to clearly communicate insights and reporting confidently to executive leadership.
Ability to problem solve and implement creative solutions to automate data flows
Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to work independently.
Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and Power Pivot/Power Query to manipulate and analyze data.
Advanced computer proficiency with knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word/Excel/Outlook/PPT)
Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL and Python preferred.
Ability to interface effectively with both technical and non-technical team members
Work environment is fast paced, and priorities can shift quickly. All employees are expected to go outside their primary responsibilities when required, and multi-task job duties on a regular basis. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Overview:

Data Analyst III - REMOTE
Company Overview:
CoventBridge Group is the leading worldwide full-service investigation solutions company providing: Surveillance, SIU and Compliance, Claims Investigation, Counter-Fraud Programs, Desktop Investigations, Social Media, Record Retrieval, Canvasses and Vendor Management programs. With offices in the UK and U.S. the company provides top tier data privacy and security practices, deploys robust case management technology customized to clients’ needs and delivers worldwide coverage via its 1000 employees and affiliates worldwide.
About the Opportunity:
The Data Analyst III Performs high-level complex evaluation and analysis of data to support potential fraud cases and requests for information using claims data across multiple Medicare/Medicaid benefit types. The potential fraud cases involve high dollar amounts, sensitive issues, or otherwise meet criteria for referral to law enforcement, recoupment of overpayment, and/or administrative action based on reactive and proactive data analysis. Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analyst associates and assists management with special projects.
In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting CoventBridge Group's objective: To provide services to our clients that exceed their expectations and contribute to improved healthcare delivery by identifying and eliminating fraud, waste and abuse.

The Data Analyst III position will report to the Data Supervisor and will work in our Grove City, OH office or if not local, remotely from a home office.
Responsibilities/ Requirements:
Responsibilities:
Work with local management, investigators, and analysts to provide reactive and proactive case development support and to fulfill law enforcement data requests.
Communicate effectively with internal and external customers, including federal law enforcement officers.
Performs quality assurance and validates data analysis results and analytically identifies potential fraud, waste and/or abuse situations in violation of Medicare or Medicaid laws, guidelines, policies, and regulations.
Serves as a mentor to less experienced data analysts.
Develops and documents new processes and procedures to improve staff efficiency and better meet department and contract goals.
Works with Statisticians and Data Analysts to ensure quality data analysis results with statistically high probabilities of producing case referrals to law enforcement, overpayments, and/or administrative actions.
Prepares, develops, and participates in staff training as related to Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste and/or abuse data analysis.
Proactively monitors data sources (claims data, internet, etc.) to identify new and emerging Medicare/Medicaid fraud, waste, and abuse trends.
Comply with and maintains various documentation and other reporting requirements as needed.
Assists with special projects that require complex analysis of data.
Requirements:
A minimum of three (3) years of previous experience in healthcare data analytics, with preference given to candidates with Medicare/Medicaid program integrity experience
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of health care information (health claims data; specifically, Medicare and Medicaid, ICD-9-CM and ICD-10-CM codes, physician specialty codes) is required.
Have high proficiency level with MS Office Products.
Requires a working knowledge of SAS and/or other software applications necessary to perform healthcare claims data analytics.
Full COVID-19 vaccination and documentation are required as this position directly or indirectly supports a Federal Government Contract. [2 doses of Moderna or Pfizer; 1 dose of Johnson & Johnson]. Medical and religious accommodations are considered for exemption.
Benefits:

Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision plans
Life, LTD and STD paid by the employer
401(k) with company match up to 4%
Paid Time Off and company paid holidays
Tuition assistance after 1 year of service
*CoventBridge is proud to be an EEO-AA employer M/F/D/V.*

Sprout Mortgage's technology team is growing, and we are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team!

As a Business Analyst, you'll work to develop custom built solutions for retail loan officer, wholesale, correspondent, and loan manufacturing systems inside a developing digital ecosystem for the mortgage industry. You must understand the needs of different user personas and be able to articulate these to various groups within the product team and business organization. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and help implement the deployment plan. You will be asked to wear many hats and be a front-line contributor in leading product development. You will be the voice of the business to the development team and answer any questions and provide clarification on requirements. If you do not know the answer, you will find out from the relevant party. We are looking for a Do-It-All Rockstar who is great at building relationships, someone who will go the extra mile, wants to help build market defining products, and grow to manage their own product(s) in the future.

Desired Skills & Experience

Required

3+ years of experience working as a business analyst, preferably with finance/mortgage knowledge.
Experience working with new product development, creation of various artifacts such as SRS, FS, Use Cases, Data Flows and Process Flows for specific features within a project release.
Ability to meet with various business/client partners to understand their needs and challenge.
Must be able to write clear and concise business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Capable of analyzing and documenting data transformations and logic that need to be built to support the exchange of information, both internal and external.
Competency in basic product smoke testing.
Experience working within standard Agile methodologies, including, but not limited to, Scrum and Kanban.
Lead process improvement with your business partners and identify bottlenecks.
Experience working with a distributed team.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field, or foreign equivalent required.

Preferred

Experience with EllieMae Encompass
Strong core Business Analysis skills in the areas of elicitation, requirements analysis, business process improvement, requirements modeling, gap analysis, functional decomposition and design, data modeling, rapid prototyping, and other techniques (Agile experience preferable).
Strong analytical skills with an understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Experience with JIRA or any other project management tool (bonus if you know Aha!).
Experience with Cloud Environments (i.e., AWS, Azure, and Google).
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Team player with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to listen, articulate, facilitate and advocate.
Learns quickly when facing new problems, enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks, and is willing to experiment and try anything to find solutions.
Ability to effectively manage and facilitate meetings.
Self-motivated, strong initiative, flexible and good time management skills
Good knowledge on Mortgage Rules & Regulations as well as mortgage related data.
Help with UAT Testing and Analysis of test results.

Senior Data Analyst

CA or TX-Remote


This is a CA-remote or TX-Remote, Exempt, Full-Time position. This position reports to the Chief Technology Officer of the Company.

Why Movoto?

Movoto Real Estate is the fastest-growing top 5 residential real estate site used by 650,000 buyers and sellers daily. As we scale for rapid growth, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to guide the development of key components of our portal.


What we're looking for in you:

As a Senior Data Analyst at Movoto, you will be a key player in helping us impact thousands of consumer home shoppers and real estate agents. You will be responsible for statistics and data collection for all traffic and online behaviors. You will own the definition of all data tracking, integration, and verification. In this role, you will work closely with product managers and analysts to define, and review tracking policy, and work closely with engineers to implement and verify data. This role will require a Product Manager mindset along with the technical skills of web-related data.
What you'll be doing:

Define problems and opportunities of current user behavior combined with traffic and product goals.
Define how to track and monitor data working closely with traffic and product managers and maintain all tracking definitions with documentation.
Create tagging/tracking strategy and work with engineering to ensure the right data is being measured.
Manage, maintain, and refine the global implementation of Google Analytics and 3rd party campaign tagging.


What you should have:

B.A./B.S./Master's in economics, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or other quantitative focus.
3+ years of experience in data analyst or data science
Experience in managing tracking for entire traffic and online user behaviors required
Experience setting tagging strategy and implementing tags with Google Tag Manager
Ability to verify the tracking implementation
Strong communication and organization skills
Working experience with large datasets using data analytics tools
Experience in creating entire tracking from scratch
Excellent SQL skills and experience with BI dashboards
Proficient in tools such as A/B testing platforms (VWO, Optimizely), analytics solutions (Oracle, Tealeaf, Clicktale aka Contentsquare, Indicative, Kissmetrics, Tableau), and other various qualitative survey tools
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Google Analytics
SEO/SEM experience

About Movoto Real Estate

Movoto Real Estate was founded on a simple principle: Real estate should be easy.

This foundational idea continues to drive our mission every day, building cutting-edge, optimized technology tools and connecting talented, customer-focused agents with motivated buyers and sellers. Today, we are the fastest-growing top five residential real estate site in the United States with nearly 26 million monthly visits. But we are more than a real estate brokerage and research site—we're a technology company that is bringing real estate into the future with our end-to-end suite of proprietary tools for buyers, sellers, and agents.

In 2020, Movoto was acquired by OJO Labs, a leader in personalized, AI-enabled real estate tools. Combining OJO and Movoto's deep commitment to creating end-to-end home-buying solutions, we continue to strive to become the most trusted real estate company in North America. Our real estate technology platform comprises the latest data-driven AI technology, client communication tools, marketing and transaction support, a real team of dedicated transaction coordinators, and an agent earnings structure that ensures our agents are successful and can focus on serving their clients.

Movoto is not only committed to making real estate accessible to a diverse community through technology, we strive to increase representation—across all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, sexual orientations, and physical or mental abilities—in our teams. We continue to promote an inclusive work environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work.

Together with OJO and our growing team, we have renewed our dedication to the mission that started it all: making real estate easy in this rapidly changing world.
